loans.name: Zaineb

texts.en:
Zaineb has successfully built her general store business  with the support of Kashf Foundation and Kiva. She has a good customer base and earns enough income to contribute in the family's income. 

Previously, Kiva's help, she was able to expand her business. This is in her 5th loan  and she would like to use 40,000 PKR to purchase oil, flour, cookies and grain. 

This will enable her to increase her sales and profits.

loans.use: to purchase oil, flour, cookies and grain.

loans.name: Khursheed

texts.en:
Khursheed  is a 52-year-old married woman with 2 children. She began selling milk to help support the family, and she is known for providing good quality milk.  She is happily supporting her family with the income she has generated. 

She has requested 45,000 PKR  to purchase another buffalo to increase sales, generating more income, and  cover her daily expenses.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Saed

texts.en:
Saed is a 29-year-old single man from a village near Jenin city. He works as an employee in a factory where he gets a low income. He also works with his family in their agricultural land. They plant seasonal fruits and vegetables. It is a very good business and supports the family with a good income.

Saed took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy more seeds and seedlings for the new season. By taking this loan, Saed will be able to improve the family farm and increase its productivity.

Saed appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy more seeds and seedlings for the new season.

loans.name: Montaser

texts.en:
Montaser is a 25-year-old single man from Jenin city. He works as a teacher in a public school where he teaches mathematics. He loves his job and this field so he decided to improve himself. Montaser registered in the university to take a Master's degree in mathematics.

Montaser took  out a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to pay the university installments for this semester. By taking this loan, Montaser will be able to improve himself and take a Master's degree. 

Montaser appears in the photo.

loans.use: to pay the university installments for this semester.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy chairs and desks for her educational center.

loans.name: Alaa

texts.en:
Alaa is a 19-year-old single lady from Jenin city. She lives with her family in a small simple house. Her father works as an employee with a low income. This is the only source of income for the family. Alaa is a student in the university where she studies Arabic literature. She wants to complete her study and find a job as a teacher in the future.

Alaa took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to pay the university installments for this semester. By taking this loan, Alaa will be able to complete her study faster.
 
Alaa appears in the photo.

loans.use: to pay the university installments for this semester.

loans.name: Muhabat

texts.en:
Muhabat, 27 years old, is a very kind woman. She is married and the careful mother of 2 children. Muhabat's husband is a master of repairing houses. Muhabat and her husband are hardworking people and they work from early morning until late evening to earn a living. 

Muhabat has 2 hectares of land where she grows different kinds of vegetables such as onion, maize, etc. She sells the harvest in a local market. Muhabat has done this work for more than 7 years. She is asking for a loan of 2,000 Somoni (TJS) to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers for the new sowing. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers for the new sowing

loans.name: Farida

texts.en:
Farida is a farmer who has a plantation. She has been in the agricultural business since 2010. She sells her agriculture products at the local market. She has a lot of clients who prefer her goods because she grows good quality vegetables.  She hopes that during some future year, she will develop the business and make more income. 

She is a well-bred person and has good knowledge as she was one of the best pupils at the school. Her parents were poor and that’s why she couldn’t get a higher education. She always dreams of being a high-degree person. 

Farida has acquired a loan to buy mineral fertilizers and seeds. She awaits your support and believes that your support will make her living condition better.

loans.use: To buy seeds and mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en: Jennifer is standing next to a pile of crab traps. She is a married woman from Estancia, Iloilo. She has two sons ages six and nine. In 2005, Jennifer started investing in fishing, preferably in catching crabs. She usually earns 10,000 PHP per month for her family. She is asking for a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy more crab traps so she can increase her catch. Like many parents she dreams that she can provide a good life for her children. Her income will be used for school fees, healthy meals and reinvestment in the same business.

loans.use: to buy more crab traps

loans.name: Jen Jen

texts.en:
Jen Jen is a married woman with four children from Concepcion, Iloilo. She and her husband have sold fish for several years.   She raises pigs for additional income. 

Jen Jen requests a loan to buy  fish and piglets.  This loan will help her to  improve her business and income. In the future, Jen Jen dreams of expanding her ventures in order to generate more revenue and save money for her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy fish and pigs.

loans.name: Manzoor

texts.en:
Manzoor  is a 45-year-old married woman.  She  buys goats & calves at low prices, raises them, and then sells them in the market at higher prices. She earns  enough money to contribute to the family's income. She also sells milk to generate additional income. 

She needs to improve her business to meet increased household expenses and will use 35,000 PKR  to purchase more animals. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market.

loans.use: to purchase animals.

loans.name: Al- Ayam 14 October Group

texts.en:
Al- Ayam 14 October is a group consisting of six hardworking women from Taiz, Yemen. They have requested a group loan of 180,000 YER from AMB and will hold each other accountable for the loan repayment.

Samira, an active woman from a very poor family, doesn’t have a fixed source of income. Her husband works for a small income which is not enough to cover his family's necessary expenses. The house where Samira and her family live is old and needs a lot of renovation and a wall around it. Samira decided to help her husband with the necessary renovations. She applied for a loan of 30,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase cement to renovate the inside of the house and bricks to build a wall around it. Samira hopes to complete all the building of the house.

loans.use: to purchase cement to renovate the inside of the house and bricks to build a wall around it

loans.name: Mukhtara

texts.en:
Mukhtara  is a 32-year-old married woman and talented seamstress.  She is appreciated in her community. Her tailoring business was started several years ago to help with household expenses. She works hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. 

She  requests 40,000 PKR  to purchase spools of thread, ribbons, cloth, needles, and scissors  to increase her earnings.  She wants to provide a better quality-of- living to her family members.

loans.use: to purchase spools of thread, ribbons, cloth, needles, and scissors.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a cow, in order to secure dairy for his children

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is 20 years old and lives in the town of Kaliro in the Iganga region of Uganda. She is married and has one child. For the past two years, Regina has been working hard to manage her bar business, that sells soft drinks like sodas and spirits too. 

To help expand her business, Regina has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase different types of drinks like wine, beer and sodas to attract more customers to the bar, and will help Regina to generate greater profits and manage to take care of her child and herself, too. Regina hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a plot of land and construct a permanent house on that land, and start living there which will reduce the cost of living  and create enough space for the family since they are living in a too small rental house.

Regina is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to purchase different types of drinks like wine,  beer, and sodas to attract more customers to the bar

loans.name: Marina

texts.es: Marina de 64 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus dos hijos, el mayor de ellos trabaja y le ayuda económicamente, ella se dedica a la venta de comida su negocio está ubicado  cerca de una gasolinera en una zona muy transitada y tiene muchos clientes, ella esta solicitando un crédito para poder comprar mas materia prima como: pollos, carne, arroz, frijoles, verduras, frutas y demás productos para continuar con sus ventas y asi tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Marina is 64 years old. She lives in her own house with her husband and two kids. The oldest son works and helps them financially.

She sells food. Her business is located near a gas station, in a very busy area. She has many customers.

 She is requesting a loan to be able to buy more basic products such as chickens, meat, rice, beans, vegetables, and fruits among others, so she'll continue selling them to have a better income.

loans.use: to buy more basic products such as chickens, meat, rice, beans, vegetables, fruits, among others.

loans.name: Oliva

texts.en:
Oliva is 18 years old and lives in the town of Kaliro in the Iganga region of Uganda. For the past two years, Oliva has been working hard to manage her bar business, which sells local brew (a drink called malwa). 

To help expand her business, Oliva has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy enough millet and sorghum that will be used in brewing the drink, hence attracting more customers. This will help Oliva to generate greater profits and to manage to take care of herself rather than asking for money from her parents or her friends. Oliva hopes that in the future, she will be able to have her savings to buy a plot of land and build a house of her own. 

Oliva is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy enough millet and sorghum to brew a local drink and attract more customers

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma, 48, is a resident of Tanza, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Jose, a construction worker, and has two children. She works hard to augment their income to support and meet their daily personal and household needs and to send her children to school.

Vilma operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a general store is basically a small convenience store that sells fresh, dry, and packaged commodities directly to consumers. Almost all products are essential household items and food. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by buying supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum net income of PHP 400 a day.

To help her continue operations of her general store business, she is requesting a PHP 8,000 loan, which she will use to buy grocery items such as sacks of rice, charcoal, soda, and other grocery stuff. She is positive that it will boost her income as she expands her business. She is thanking God and you in advance for a good return on her investment and the financial help that will be given her.

Vilma hopes to maintain and grow her business to give her family a better life. She strives hard to give her children the best education possible and prays for a quiet and happy life. She faithfully meets up every week with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for groceries, beverages and toiletries to sell.

loans.name: Russili

texts.en: Russili is a 58-year-old married woman from Concepcion, Iloilo. For more than 20 years, she has earned a living through her sari-sari (convenience store) business, selling various goods and items to the people in her neighborhood. Russili is asking for a loan to buy more stock such as rice, condiments, sugar, coffee, eggs, soft drinks, detergents, soap, noodles and canned goods to sell. This will help her improve her inventory, which will attract more buyers to her store.

loans.use: to buy more stock such as rice, condiments, sugar, coffee, eggs, soft drinks, detergents, soap, noodles and canned goods to sell

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is 29 years old, married, and has one child. He operates a retail shop in Nakuru, which he has been doing for seven years. 

Samuel requested his fourth loan from VisionFund, which he will use to buy more stocks of maize and beans to sell. He will use the anticipated profits to buy more stocks of cereals to sell as well as to repay the loan. In the future, he hopes to have a prosperous business and be successful.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of maize and beans to sell

loans.name: Sajo

texts.en:
Sajo  is a 32-year-old married woman. She and her husband sell buffalo and cow milk in nearby areas to support their family.  Sajo ’s job is to raise the buffaloes and collect the milk. 

They need additional income to meet everyday expenditures. Sajo requests  25,000 PKR  to buy another buffalo to meet customer demandsand  provide a  better standard of living to her family.

loans.use: to buy one more buffalo to cater to more customers for providing better standard of living to her family members.

loans.name: Geeta

texts.en:
Geeta is a 25-year-old married woman with 1 child. Her husband started a rickshaw-driving business. He owns one rickshaw and needs financial help to pay the repair and maintenance costs of the rickshaw. Geeta requests  40,000 PKR. 

This is her 4th loan cycle and she has a good repayment history. She thanks  Kashf and  is hopeful that her husband’s business will be profitable and their living standards will improve.

loans.use: to repair and maintain the rickshaw.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is a married woman, aged 35 years, living in a town with her family of two children who attend school. She is a small-scale farmer who grows food crops for feeding her family and also grows coffee to sell. She operates a retail shop to get additional income. She started this business in 2006.

She works eight hours per day and she acquired this loan to buy organic fertilizer and also to add to her retail shop.  She has hopes of increased yields from the coffee and of expanding into a large business which can supply all the people around. Her clients are traders from the surrounding places.

The challenges she faces are bad debtors and lack of sufficient capital. She describes herself as being a trustworthy woman.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Abraham

texts.en: Abraham is a very enterprising and tenacious man with big dreams that he has been cultivating and trying to make reality. He is a smallholder farmer from Kerugoya in the central region of Kenya. Abraham owns a one-acre farm. On the farm, he practices mixed farming. The loving father keeps dairy animals and grows maize and vegetables. He has seven years of experience in farming. Abraham is seeking a loan to expand his horticulture farm. He is very hardworking and determined to increase his farm's output. Loans for smallholder farmers with little irregular income and no solid collateral are hard to come by in Kenya. Few organizations such as Juhudi Kilimo support farmers like Abraham. Through a group of 10 members called Gakui self-help group, Abraham has access to income-generating asset loans from Juhudi, which uses the group-based savings as collateral. According to Juhudi Kilimo, horticulture represents an opportunity for reducing poverty through income generation among smallholders, whether unskilled or semi-skilled. Juhudi Kilimo facilitates loans that empower smallholder farmers like Abraham because the institution believes that men, too, are actively involved in various segments of the horticultural industry. With your help, Abraham will be able to pay for his children’s education, which is one of his biggest dreams.

loans.use: To expand his horticulture farm

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is 56 years old and from Estancia, Iloilo. She is married, and her four children are all adults.

Myrna is engaged in a buy-and-sell and wholesale business. She usually buys items in bulk and sells them to the retailers. She buys sacks of salt for the fishermen’s use and also wooden boxes as containers for dried fish during transport. Her business allows her to hire people to help sometimes, and this gives opportunities to people to work as well.

Myrna’s business has been thriving for twelve years now. She is asking for a loan of 20,000 PHP to buy sacks of salt and wooden container boxes.

In the future, she hopes to expand her business and increase profitability.

loans.use: to buy salt and wooden container boxes for dried fish.

loans.name: Noralyn

texts.en:
Noralyn is a married woman from Concepcion, Iloilo. She has been engaged in retail sales of rice for more than ten years now. This is the source of her income.

Noralyn is asking for a loan to buy more rice to sell. A loan will help her improve her stock, thus allowing her to cater to more buyers in her store.

In the future, Noralyn hopes to make her business a success.

loans.use: to buy more rice to sell.

loans.name: Liana

texts.en:
Liana is a young woman, 35 years old, from the small village of Khelvachauri district. She has five family members and they don't have any significant income for their existence. The family belongs to the subsistence poor category and lives in poverty. They have a small agricultural plot. In particular, they own a milk cow and own a small plot of land where they grow potatoes. Liana has a great desire to do her bit for her family's welfare, and to somehow increase their income. 

To realize her plans, she requires financial support and has obtained credit from local financial institutions. Liana has requested a loan from Credo to start a trading business. Her loan request was approved in the framework of a joint initiative by Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisions provisions for business start-ups and restart-up credits with soft conditions for the country's rural poor, who are regarded as "high risk borrowers" because of their low income, and lack of access to credit products. With the received credit, she will purchase a minibus and by helping her husband she will begin trading in fruits and vegetables. Her husband will be a driver and they both will be involved in their family business. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly increase the family's income and the family members will be able to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a minibus to start a trading business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more seeds and seedlings for the new season

loans.name: Anorbi

texts.en:
Anorbi is 40 years old. She is divorced from her husband. She lives with her parents, brother, and his wife. Anorbi has two children.

She graduated from Medical College and currently works in the hospital as a nurse. She has worked for four years. Anorbi also sews national women’s dresses. She is teaching her daughter how to sew.

Anorbi’s mother is ill. She suffers from a serious disease. Currently, they don't have sufficient money for treatment. Anorbi believes that with help of Humo and Kiva lenders, her mother will take treatment and get well.

loans.use: pay for treatment of her mother.

loans.name: Jenevy

texts.en: Jenevy is a 38-year-old married woman and the mother of four children from Concepcion, Iloilo. She runs a small sari-sari or retail store business selling various goods and items to the people in her place. Jenevy is asking to take a loan to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, rice, bread and snack foods, condiments and others.  A loan will help her improve her business as well as her income. She dreams of expanding her store in the future. She also wants to save money for her children’s schooling.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, rice, bread and snack foods, condiments and others.

loans.name: Ana Claudia

texts.es:
Ana, es una mujer soltera cabeza de familia, sus dos hijos adolecentes representan para ella no solo un gran amor, sino una motivación para alcanzar sus metas y superarse para obtener mejores beneficios.
Sus ventas de comida han representado la fuente de ingresos y progreso.
Con su venta de comidas aspira a pagar la educación de sus dos retoños y por ello quiere darle un impulso a su negocio, solicitando un crédito el cual invertirá en la compra de surtido como carnes, desechables, ensaladas, papas, cubiertos plásticos, panes, salsas etc. 
Con estos insumos podrá realizar mayor número de preparaciones y ofreceré promociones para atraer clientes.
texts.en:
Ana is a single woman who is the head of the household. She has not only a great love for her two adolescent children, but they are also a motivation for her to reach her goals and improve herself, to get the most benefit.

Her food sales have accounted for her source of income and progress. By selling food, she aspires to pay for the education of her two children and that is why she wants to boost her business. She is asking for a loan, which she will use to buy an assortment of items such as meat, disposable items, salad, potatoes, plastic cutlery, bread, salsas, etc.

With these goods she will be able to prepare a larger amount and she will offer promotions to attract customers.

loans.use: to buy an assortment of items such as meat, disposable items, salad, potatoes, plastic cutlery, bread, salsas, etc.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is 64 years old. She is from Estancia, Iloilo. She is married with eight adult children.

In 2009, she started a sari-sari store business, where she sell items such as shampoo, toothpaste, conditioner, milk, sugar, cooking oil, and soy sauce. But recently, her store lacked some merchandise, and she wishes to buy more stock to make it thrive once again.

She is asking for a loan of 20,000 PHP to buy additional supplies for her store such as bath soap, noodles, beef loaf, corned beef, canned sardines, shampoo, and seasoning.

Lilia will use her earnings to save for her future needs and reinvestment in the same business.

loans.use: to buy bath soap, noodles, beef loaf, corned beef, canned sardines, shampoo, and seasoning.

loans.name: Lalyn

texts.en:
Lalyn is 37-year-old married woman with eight children. Her eldest is seventeen and the youngest is two years old. For fifteen years, Lalyn has provided  manicure and pedicure services in her neighborhood. She goes door-to-door with her manicure kit to find customers in her neighborhood. Lalyn knows that she can provide  hairstyling to her customers,  but she lacks the capital to venture unto this business. 

She requests 15,000 PHP to buy a hair brush, cosmetic set,  and hair iron. Her husband delivers fish and Lalyn would  like to use some of the loan to buy fish. 

In the future, she plans to expand her business and have her own beauty shop. She also dreams of being successful and sending her children to school.

loans.use: to buy a hair brush, cosmetic set, and hair iron.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase new and stylish women and children's clothing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a bigger stove  for his hot drinks stall to heat the water faster

loans.name: Teodoro

texts.en:
Teodor raises and sells hogs. He is a 61-year-old married man from Dulag, Leyte. He is a father of four dependents. Two of them are still attending school. Aside from that, he also engages in farming. He grows and sells rice. He has been engaged in that kind of business for eight years now.

He is asking for a loan to buy pig feed and purchase fertilizers, and pay for the laborer. These will improve his hog-raising business. He will also improve the yield of his farm. With these, he could now continue to send his children to school. He could now provide his children with proper diets.

In the future, Teodoro hopes that he can expand both his businesses to be successful and to become more sustainable.

loans.use: to buy pig feed and purchase fertilizers, and pay for the laborer.

loans.name: Doris Adriana

texts.es:
Doris es una viuda de 33 años de edad, madre de una pequeña de 12 años por la cual se levantó del llanto, y busco fuerzas para superar ese mal momento de perder a sus esposo.
Un restaurante represento no solo un medio de sostenimiento de su familia, sino que pudo socializarse y tener una buena relación con sus clientes ya que ella trabaja sola y realiza la labor de mesera, cocinera, aseadora.
La sostenibilidad de su negocio se ha convertido en su prioridad para este comienzo de año, y por ello solicita un crédito para la compra de surtido de frituras, carnes, refrescos y desechables.
Los gastos de diciembre la han dejado con poco surtido y necesita levantarse y vender pues las deudas no se detienen y solo tiene el restaurante para ganar el sustento para su hija y ella.
texts.en:
Doris is a 33 year old widow and mother of a young 12 year old daughter.  She seeks strength to overcome this difficult time of losing her husband.

A restaurant is not only her means for supporting her family, but also a way for her to socialize and have good relations with her customers as she works alone and performs the work of waitress, cook, and housekeeper.

The sustainability of her business is her priority for the beginning of the year and for this she is requesting a loan for the purchase of an assortment of fried foods, meats, soft drinks, and disposable goods. The expenses of December have left her with little selection and she needs to pick up more and sell to pay her expenses and earn a living for herself and her daughter.

loans.use: to purchase an assortment of fried foods, meats, soft drinks, and disposable goods. Additionally, she seeks to hire somebody to help.

loans.name: Hadeel

texts.en:
Hadeel is a 21-year-old single lady, living with her family in Salt. She is a fourth year student working to get a Bachelor's degree majoring in business administration. She is one of six family members. 

Hadeel`s father is retired from the army, but his pension is not enough to meet all of the semester fees and expenses of the household. Hadeel hopes to find a job immediately after she graduates  to help her family with household expenses, Because of that she has requested an education loan to cover her semester fees. That will help her graduate faster and find a job.

loans.use: To pay for her semester fees, which will help her graduate faster and find a job.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for his semester fees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase construction materials to renovate her house from the inside.

loans.name: Juma's Group

texts.en:
Juma is 42 years old and has seven children. He is a group leader and is representing his group, formed by eight farmers in Matete District, Kenya. 

Juma has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2010. This decision was largely a result of his desire to get the best quality fertilizer and hybrid seeds and, although he described his last harvest as excellent, he believes he could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. Juma also decided to purchase a solar light as part of his loan, which he is very excited about, as it will allow him to have light during dark hours for his children to be able to study.

Obtaining this loan means that Juma's Group will be able to receive a total of eight solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 3.5 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Enock's Group

texts.en:
Enock is 66 years old and has six children. He is a group leader and is representing his group formed by eleven farmers in Matete District, Kenya.

Enock has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2011. This decision was largely a result of his desire to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods.

Although he described his last harvest as good, he believes he could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. Enock also decided to purchase two solar lights as part of his loan, which he is very excited about, as it will allow him to have light during dark hours for his children to be able to study.

Obtaining this loan means that Enock's Group will be able to receive a total of eleven solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of six acres.

loans.use: to purchase two solar lights and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Belesi's Group

texts.en:
Belesi is 40 years old and has eight children. She is a group leader and is representing her group formed by nine farmers in Matete District, Kenya.

Belesi has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2011. This decision was largely a result of her desire to earn enough to feed her family.

Although she described her last harvest as good, she believes she could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. Belesi also decided to purchase a solar light as part of her loan, which she is very excited about, as it will allow her to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study.

Obtaining this loan means that Belesi's Group will be able to receive a total of eight solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 5.75 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Neijer

texts.es:
Neijer es un hombre soltero de 44 años de edad, que lleva más de 10 años  realizando su profesión de peluquero, una profesión muy competida en estos últimos años, ya que se ha convertido en la salida de muchas personas desempleadas.
Neijer se encuentra buscando un apoyo pues necesita abastecer su salón de belleza con shampos, tinturas para el cabello, esmaltes, bisutería.
Tu apoyo será un gran aliciente para este hombre que solo tiene esta peluquería para mantenerse y en la que espera brindar empleo, pero lo lograra con tu ayuda.
texts.en:
Neijer is a single man, who is 44 years old. He has spent more than 10 years pursuing his hair salon business—work that has become very competitive in recent years, since many people have become unemployed.

Neijer is looking for support since he needs to supply the beauty salon with shampoos, hair colors, nail polish, and costume jewelry. 

Your support will be a big benefit for this man, who only has this salon to support himself. He hopes to offer jobs to others, and he will succeed in this with your help.

loans.use: to buy shampoo, hair color, nail polish, and costume jewelry to supply his business.

loans.name: Maria Ester

texts.es: Doña María, tiene 58 años de edad, es soltera por viudez, reside en una colonia suburbana del municipio de Choloma, Cortes junto a uno de sus hijos y nietos.  Hace 8 años que ella decidió poner su propio taller de costura donde confecciona vestidos, faldas, blusas, pantalones y hace reparaciones de ropa. Las prendas que elabora son por encargos y también vende de manera ambulante en la zona. Ha solicitado un prestamo por 5,000 lempiras para comprar hilos, zíperes, broches, botones y una tela que necesita. Su plan fue aprovechar la temporada de alta demanda de prendas de vestir.  Tiene como meta a futuro poder tener su propio local para el negocio.
texts.en:
Maria is 58 years old, is a widow, and lives in a suburban colony in the municipality of Choloma in the department of Cortes with one of her children and her grandchildren. Eight years ago, she decided to start her own sewing workshop, where she makes dresses, skirts, blouses, and pants and does clothing repairs. The garments she makes are to complete orders, and she also sells her products by foot in the area. 

She has requested a loan for 5,000 lempiras to buy thread, zippers, clasps, buttons, and fabric that she needs. Her plan was to take advantage of the season of high demand for dresses. 

Her goal for the future is to be able to have her own storefront for the business.

loans.use: to buy thread, zippers, clasps, buttons, and fabric that she needs to make dresses.

loans.name: Maha

texts.en:
Maha wants to see her children successful persons in the future, so she is fighting, against all obstacles, to pay the education fees for her children.
She has a daughter named Nadine, and now she is studying at the university in the fourth year, majoring human resources engineering, 

Maha is dreaming of the day when Nadine will graduate and she will be proud, too, Maha asked for an educational loan to help her daughter pay semester fees, due to Inability to pay her fees.

loans.use: To pay semester fees for her daughter Nadine, due to inability to pay her fees.

loans.name: Ruth's Group

texts.en:
Ruth is 58 years old and has seven children. She has been a farmer for more than 30 years and is always said to be a very resourceful person. Even though Ruth is the only one featured in the above picture, she is actually representing her group formed by 13 farmers in Matete District, Kenya.

Ruth started working alongside One Acre Fund a few years ago, in 2010, and decided to do so because she wanted to get the best quality fertilizer and hybrid seeds. Since then, she has seen her life improve; especially in the sense that she has been able to consistently feed her family ever since. This year she decided to represent her group because she wanted to gain leadership skills.

Ruth’s Group will receive farming inputs to plant a total of 6.75 acres of land. Additionally, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light so, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 9 solar lights.

loans.use: to buy cost-efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season

loans.name: Yerlis Milena

texts.es:
Yerlis es una joven promiscua, a sus 24 años de edad es madre de 4 hijos de 2, 5, 6, 7 años de edad, y junto con su pareja viven en un humilde hogar donde ambos hacen su mayor esfuerzo para sostener la familia. 
Para apoyar a su pareja en el sostenimiento de su familia Yerlis vende alimentos, los cuales fabrica al aire libre, a fuego de leña, su comida ha tenido buen aceptación por su exquisito sabor y su preparación tan clásica.
Yerlis al ser una mujer con muchas responsabilidades y ante todo baja de recursos quiere recurrir a un crédito para la compra de: 3 láminas de Zinc, 4 listones de madera, 2 vajillas, 6 sillas y una mesa.
Este crédito le permitirá transformar poco a poco su negocio en un restaurante y buscar un mejor beneficio para ella y sus hijos.
texts.en:
Yerlis is a young woman, who is 24 years old and is the mother of 4 children who are 2, 5, 6, and 7 years old. She and her partner live in a humble home where both do their best to provide for their family.

To support her partner in providing for their family, Yerlis sells food, which she makes in the open air on a wood fire. Her food has been well received for its exquisite flavor and its classical preparation. Yerlis is a woman with many responsibilities, and above all, she is low on resources. Because of this, she wants a loan to buy 3 sheets of zinc, 4 strips of wood, 2 sets of silverware, 6 chairs, and a table. 

This loan will allow her to transform her business little by little into a restaurant. She seeks better earning for herself and her children.

loans.use: to buy 3 sheets of zinc, 4 strips of wood, 2 sets of silverware, 6 chairs, and a table.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en: Cecilia hails from Estancia, a municipality of Iloilo. She is a 40-year-old married woman with two children ages nine and eleven. In 2000, she started a buy-and-sell business of fruit and vegetables like carrots, cabbage, spring onions, bananas, taro, eggplant and papayas. She is asking for a loan of 20,000 PHP to buy more vegetables and spices like carrots, eggplant, cabbage, chili and water spinach. In the future, Cecilia plans on having a grocery store.

loans.use: to buy carrots, eggplant, cabbage, chili and water spinach

loans.name: Gilbert's Group

texts.en:
Gilbert is a 41-year-old proud father of five children. He is a group leader, often described as a very hardworking individual, and is representing his group of 8 farmers in Matete District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2012, Gilbert has noticed that he has had more profits from each harvest.

Gilbert described his harvest as good last year, but believes he can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. He is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because he will now be able to have an overall improved quality of life. With the profits from this season’s harvest, he plans to send his children to school.

With this loan, Gilbert’s Group will be able to plant a total of 3.75 acres of land and purchase a total of 8 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Alice's Group

texts.en:
Alice's Group is formed by eight farmers in Matete District and is being represented by Alice, who is the group leader pictured above. She is 31 years old, married, and has two children. Alice has been a farmer for six years and is often referred to as a very hardworking individual.

Alice isn’t new to One Acre Fund; she actually joined the program in 2013 and has since noticed her life has changed; especially in the sense that she has had more profits from each harvest ever since. This year, Alice will not only get fertilizer and maize seeds as part of her loan, but will also purchase a solar light. She is very excited about this addition since now she will have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study.

Using this loan, Alice's Group will purchase a total of 5 solar lights and will use the farming inputs received to plant a total of 3.25 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light, as well as hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize.

loans.name: Patrick's Group

texts.en:
Patrick's Group is formed by seven farmers in Matete District and is being represented by Patrick, who is the group leader, pictured above. He is 40 years old, married, and has four children. Patrick has been a farmer for more than 20 years and is often referred to as a very hard-working individual.

Patrick isn’t new to One Acre Fund, he actually joined the program in 2012 and has since noticed his life has changed, especially in the sense that he has had more profits from each harvest ever since. 

This year, Patrick will not only get fertilizer and maize seeds as part of his loan, but will also purchase a solar light. He is very excited about this addition since now he will be able to have light during the night and have somewhere to charge his phone.

Using this loan, Patrick's Group will purchase a total of two solar lights and use the farming inputs received to plant a total of 3.75 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light, as well as hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize.

loans.name: Cherryl

texts.en:
Cherryl is a hard-working woman from Estancia, Iloilo. She is married with four children ages 12 to 18. In 2000, Cherryl started operating a small sari-sari (variety) store which sell chips, snack food, candies and bread. She also does direct selling of trendy and affordable clothes, locally known as RTW (ready-to-wear). Cherryl is asking for a loan to buy chips, candies, cookies, soft drinks and trendy clothes.  

In the future, she hopes to have another business that will cover the needs of her family, specially her children's schooling.

loans.use: to buy chips, candies, and cookies

loans.name: Dedina

texts.en:
Dedina is a resident of Estancia, Iloilo. She is 57 years old and has seven children. Her dependents are 13 and 18 years old. 

She started a business selling home-cooked snacks like rice cakes and fruit juice in tetra packs. She also owns a sari-sari store. These businesses have been thriving since 2011. 

Since Dedina also supports the needs of her children and their education, she needs more capital to make her businesses sustainable. She is asking for a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy sugar, coconuts, milk, flour, and rice. 

Dedina's priority is spending her profits on her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy sugar, coconuts, milk, flour, and rice

loans.name: Isaac's Group

texts.en:
Isaac is a 64-year-old proud father of nine children. He is often described as a very friendly person. 

Isaac is a group leader and is representing his group of 11 farmers in Matete District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2013, Isaac has noticed that he has had more profits from each harvest.

He described his harvest as good last year, but believes he can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. With the profits from this season’s harvest, he plans to send his children to school.

Isaac is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light in addition to fertilizer and maize because he will now be able to have light during dark hours for his children to be able to study. 

With this loan, Isaac’s group will be able to plant a total of five acres of land and purchase a total of 11 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and to gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Lucelis Margoth

texts.es:
15, 13, 2, 10, 7, 3 son las edades de los hijos de la señora Lucelis, una mujer responsable y trabajadora que con su venta de alimentos que ubica en todo el frente de su hogar, el cual nació como necesidad económica y que ahora necesita tu apoyo para impulsar mejor su negocio pues las autoridades sanitarias le están poniendo reglamentación para vender libremente sus productos. 
Lucelis no tiene capital y necesita con urgencia compra láminas de zinc, 2 listones de madera, mesas, sillas, y capital de trabajo para producir sus alimentos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Lucelis’s children are 15, 13, 2, 10, 7, and 3 years old. She is a responsible and hard-working woman, who sells food in front of her home—a business that was born out of financial necessity. Now, her business needs your support to go forward, since the sanitary authorities are setting regulations for selling her products freely.

Lucelis does not have capital, and she urgently needs to buy sheets of zinc, 2 strips of wood, tables, chairs, and capital to produce her food.

loans.use: to buy sheets of zinc, 2 strips of wood, tables, and chairs, all of which she needs urgently.

loans.name: Catrina

texts.en:
Catrina is 40 years old and from the town of Estancia in Iloilo. She is married with seven children. Her husband works as a carpenter. 

For five years, she has been making doormats from used clothes to sell at the market and to her customers. Catrina is inspired to work hard for her four dependents aged 7, 10, 12, and 17.

She is asking for a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy more cloth for herself and wood and nails for her husband. 

In the future, she hopes to expand her business to make it more profitable.

loans.use: to buy cloth, wood, and nails

loans.name: Jorge Gustavo

texts.es: Jorge, tiene 24 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su esposa con quien tiene dos hijos, y reside con su familia en el Municipio de Tocoa, Colon. El trabajó en una empresa privada anteriormente, hace dos años que estableció su propio negocio de venta de ensaladas de frutas con miel o leche condensada, este producto lo vende en panas plástica bien presentable y ofrece en forma ambulante movilizándose a varios lugares en una motocicleta. Ha solicitado un prestamo por 25,000 lempiras para comprar uniformes, hacer el tramite del logotipo ,también para pagar el capital inicial para establecer el negocio en un local, además va cancelar una pequeña deuda pendiente y quedar solo con la institución. Su plan es mejorar la imagen del producto para obtener mejores ingresos. En un futuro tiene planes de poner venta de comida y entregarla a domicilio y obtener más ingresos para comprar una casa y ayudar a sus hijos a crecer y darles calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Jorge is 24 years old and lives in a common-law marriage with his wife, with whom he has 2 children. He lives with his family in the municipality of Tocoa in Colon. He previously worked in a private business. Two years ago, he started his own business selling fruit salads with honey or condensed milk. He sells this product in plastic containers that look good, and he sells by foot, moving to various places by motorcycle. 

He has requested a loan for 25,000 lempiras to buy uniforms, to make a logo, to provide the initial capital needed to establish his business in a storefront, and to repay a small debt so that he remains only with this institution. His plan is to improve the image of the product to gain more income. 

In the future, he has plans to sell his food by delivering to customers’ homes. Ultimately, he plans to earn more income to buy a house and help his children grow and give them a good quality of life.

loans.use: to buy uniforms, to make a logo, to provide the initial capital needed to establish his business in a storefront, and to repay a small debt.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase construction materials to renovate the house.

loans.name: Peter's Group

texts.en: Peter is 59 years old and has six children. He is the group leader of Peter's Group, which consists of 13 farmers in Matete District, Kenya. Peter has been farming with One Acre Fund for three years, having joined the program in 2011. This decision was largely a result of his desire to earn enough to feed his family and, although he described his last harvest as good, he believes he could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. Peter also decided to purchase two solar lights as part of his loan, which he is very excited about, as it will allow him to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. Obtaining this loan means that Peter's Group will be able to receive a total of 14 solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 5.5 acres.

loans.use: to purchase two solar lights and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Sumaya

texts.en:
Sumaya is 17 years old and lives in the town of Kaliro in the Iganga region of Uganda. For the past 4 years, Sumaya has been working hard to manage her fish selling business.

To help expand her business, Sumaya has requested a loan of 200000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to stock more fish that will be sold to her customers at a lower price, and will help Sumaya to generate greater profits.  She has a thought of owning a whole sale store that will start selling fish in bigger quantities. Sumaya hopes that in the future she will be able to manage and pay for her father's medication and seeing him get well.. 

Sumaya is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: buy fish to sell

loans.name: Mehdi

texts.en:
Mehdi  is a 40-year-old married man.  He has two sons and his wife is a housekeeper.  The main income of family comes from gardening. Mehdi grows  vegetables and greens, and sells them to neighbours and to a local cafe. His monthly income is 125AZN and it's not enough for this big family.  

Mehdi's garden was small and he bought a piece of land to make it bigger. Now he needs to grow  there new fruits and vegetables. He applied for 800 AZN in loan in order to buy and install artificial irrigation for his new garden. This will increase harvest and income for his family. He hopes that he will be able to get more money and provide his family a good life.

loans.use: install an irrigation system

loans.name: Rukia

texts.en:
Rukia is 24 years old and lives in the town of Kaliro in the Iganga region of Uganda. She is married and has 3 children, with 1 of them currently in school. 

For the past 3 years, Rukia has been working hard to manage her grocery store, which sells things like sugar, cooking oil and other home use items. 

To help expand her business, Rukia has requested a loan of 200000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to to buy more items that will attract more customers at her grocery store, and will help Rukia to generate greater profits and see her children go in better schools. Rukia hopes that in the future she will be able to enlarge her grocery shop into a whole sell shop so as to get more profits to sustain her family needs. 

Rukia is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training

loans.use: restock her store

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is 16 years old and lives in the town of Kaliro in the Iganga region of Uganda. For the past 1 year, Mariam has been working hard to manage her bar which sells drinks like beer water and wine. 

To help expand her business, Mariam has requested a loan of 200000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more drinks to increase on the stock in the business, and will help Mariam to generate greater profits and to pay rent for the business. Mariam hopes that in the future she will be able to build some small shelter were she can operate the business from. 

Mariam is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: buy drinks to sell

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy is a married woman. She is 53 years old with seven children. Her youngest is already 19 years old. Her husband is a carpenter while Daisy spends  most of her time looking after her transportation business using their tricycle. 

Daisy started her business in 2007. She is asking a loan to buy a new side car for her tricycle so it will be more comfortable.  Any income generated will be used to buy healthy food for her family. 

Daisy plans to buy more tricycle someday for a better income.

loans.use: buy a side car

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is a 58-year-old married woman and a mother of five children from Ormoc, Leyte. She runs a small sari-sari or retail store business, selling various goods and items to the people near her place. 

Virginia has been in this business for more than a year now. Virginia is asking to take a loan to buy more stocks to sell like canned goods, noodles, sodas and beverages, soap and toiletries, condiments and cooking oil, soft drinks and beverages, bread and snack foods, coffee and sugar.  This loan will be used to improve her stocks, thus attracting more buyers to her store. 

In the future, Virginia hopes of making her business more stable and profitable. Moreover, she wants to save money for her children's schooling.

loans.use: restock her store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy animal feed & piglets

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana is a 42-year-old married woman and a mother of four children from Concepcion, Iloilo. She is engaged in a fishing business with her husband for more than 10 years now. This is their only source of income. 

Susana is asking to take a loan to buy fishing materials like nets, lead weights, hooks and floaters. With this  loan she and her husband will be able to improve their catch, thus giving them more fish to sell in the market. 

In the future, Susana hopes of making their fishing business a success. Moreover, she wants to save money for her children's schooling.

loans.use: buy fishing supplies

loans.name: Edilyn

texts.en:
30-year-old Edilyn is from Estancia, Iloilo. She is engaged in multiple businesses. She is into selling trendy clothing, direct selling of Personal Collection products like lotion and detergent, food vending and she also invests in a potpot (a bicycle with a side car to transport passengers) business. She is asking for a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy more clothes to sell and ingredients like flour, sugar and cooking oil. 

Edilyn hope that the loan will enable her to earn more so she can support her two children's education. They are aged seven and nine.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like flour, sugar and cooking oil, and more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Rodrigo De Jesus

texts.es:
Ser un emprendedor, buscar su propio horizonte quizás fue la mejor decisión del señor Rodrigo que en el año 2013 inicio la venta de mercancía como electrodomésticos, ollas, contenedores etc. No solo ha significado mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia que la conforman su pareja y tres hijos de 3, 8 y 11 años de edad, es un hombre de verdad muy anímico, que se le nota gran animo pro progresar y es ese impulso esa energía que lo lleva a solicitar un préstamo para la compra de mercancía ya que no se detendrá hasta tener un local comercial y generar empleo.
Apóyalo y aliméntale sus  buenos propósitos.
texts.en:
Being an entrepreneur, Mr. Rodrigo’s best decision of 2013 was starting to sell merchandise including electrical appliances, pots, trashcans, etc. This has improved the quality of life for his family—which includes his partner and three children who are 3, 8, and 11 years old. He is a very emotional man, and he is very energetic about progressing. This energy brought him to request a loan to buy merchandise so that he doesn’t have to stop his work and can do his job.

Support him and nourish his good intentions.

loans.use: to buy electrical appliance merchandise.

loans.name: Blanca Lucila

texts.es:
Blanca es una madre muy responsable de 1 hijo, ha tenido que pasar por muchas adversidades en su vida, sin embargo siempre ha tenido la fortaleza para salir adelante y continuar progresando con su familia. 
Hace un tiempo montó su venta de huevos, para lo cual tiene una cantidad de gallinas que le permiten tener ciertas ventas. 
Sueña con ver su negocio crecer y sabe que con la ayuda de la Corporación Interactuar y de las personas que apoyen su oficio podrá lograrlo.
Es por esto que busca un préstamo que le permita comprar más gallinas para poder incrementar su capacidad de producción de huevos y así responder a la demanda de sus clientes por los huevos.
De esta manera sus ventas se incrementarán considerablemente, además de que su negocio resurgirá y podrá salir adelante. 
Tatiana también desea tener un gran negocio donde pueda utilizar toda la capacidad que pueda para sacarlo adelante y así ofrecerle a su hijo un futuro económico estable.
texts.en:
Blanca is a very responsible mother of 1 son. She has had to endure many adversities in her life, and she has always had the strength to go forward and to continue progressing with her family.

Some time ago, she started selling eggs, so she has many hens that allow her to have guaranteed sales.

She dreams of seeing her business grow and knows that with the help of Interactuar and the people who support her work, she will be able to succeed in this.

As a result, she seeks a loan that will allow her to buy more hens so that she can increase her production capacity of eggs and thus respond to her clients’ demand for eggs.

In this way, her sales will increase considerably, in addition to her business growing, which will allow her to go forward.

Tatiana also wants to have a big business, for which she can use all of her capacity to take it forward, and thus offer her son a stable financial future.

loans.use: to buy more hens for her egg-selling business.

loans.name: Julius's Group

texts.en:
Julius, pictured above, is a group leader and is representing his group, formed by 9 farmers in Matete District, Kenya. He joined One Acre Fund for the first time in 2010 and decided to represent his group because he wanted to help more farmers. He is married and has four children.

With a portion of this loan Julius will not only purchase maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season, but also a solar light. Receiving a solar light as part of his loan means that now he will be able to have light during dark hours for his children to be able to study. Julius plans to use the profits he gains this year to send his children to school.

In total Julius’s Group will use the inputs received from this loan to plant a total of 5.25 acres of land. They will also receive a total of 4 solar lights.

loans.use: to buy cost efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Benson's Group

texts.en:
Benson is 61 years old and has six children. He is a group leader and is representing his group of 13 farmers in Matete District, Kenya. 

Benson has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2011. This decision was largely a result of his desire to have access to quality training and to acquire new farming methods. Although he described his last harvest as good, he believes he could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. Benson also decided to purchase two solar lights as part of his loan, which he is very excited about, as it will allow him to reduce his consumption of paraffin fuel and, therefore, save more money.

Obtaining this loan means that Benson's Group will be able to receive a total of 13 solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 6.5 acres.

loans.use: to purchase two solar lights and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Luz Maria

texts.es:
Luz Marina es una tierna abuelita de 73 años de edad, muy trabajadora  que con sus negocios de venta de mercancía y confección ha logrado conformar una fórmula ganadora para sostenerse. 
Es madre de 3 hijas ya todas ellas mayores de edad, y busca una ayuda para iniciar este 2015 de la mejor manera, ofertando empleo y ayudando a pequeños soñadores a iniciar negocio a partir de charlas y experiencia vividas.
Con un crédito en el cual busca tu apoyo quiere comprar una máquina de confección, comprar los muebles de la máquina, telas, y mercancía de ropa complementaria para las prendas que confecciona.
texts.en:
Luz Maria is a loving grandmother, who is 73 years old. She is very hard working, and with her businesses selling merchandise and making dresses, she has succeeded in pursuing a winning formula for providing for herself.

She is the mother of 3 adult daughters. She is looking for help to being 2015 in the best way by offering jobs and help to young dreamers by starting a business through talking and lived experience.

With the loan, she wants to buy a sewing machine, furniture for the machine, fabric, and merchandise of complementary clothing for the garments she makes.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine, furniture for the machine, fabric, and merchandise of complementary clothing for the garments that she makes.

loans.name: Marlindey

texts.es:
Sin mucho capital, Marlindey montó su taller de confección con el ánimo de generar ingresos con los cuales pueda sostener los gastos de su hogar donde convive con sus hijos y su esposo. 
Con sus trabajos, Marlindey ha logrado captar un gran número de clientes que le han garantizado muy buenas ventas mensuales, por lo que espera que su negocio siga creciendo y posteriormente pueda generar empleo para las personas más necesitadas. 
Con la finalidad de responder a la demanda sus clientes, Marlindey busca que un préstamo le brinde la posibilidad de acceder a la compra de insumos como tela, hilos y agujas.
Marlindey espera que así su familia pueda gozar de unos mejores ingresos los cuales les permitan tener una mejor calidad de vida y una educación de mejor calidad. 
Además, Marlindey espera que si su negocio sigue ampliándose a un buen ritmo y que en su taller pueda generar como mínimo un empleo para una persona que lo requiera y no tenga oportunidades laborales.
texts.en:
Without much capital, Marlindey started a sewing workshop with the goal of generating income with which she can provide for the expenses for the household she shares with her children and husband.

With her work, Marlindey has succeeded in capturing a large number of clients that have guaranteed very good monthly sales. As a result, she hopes that her business continues growing and eventually that she can create jobs for people who need them. 

With the goal of responding to the demand of her clients, Marlindey seeks a loan that will allow her to buy supplies, such as fabric, thread, and needles.

Marlindey hopes that her family will be able to enjoy a better income, which will allow them to have a better quality of life and a better quality of education.

Additionally, Marlindey hopes that her business continues growing at a good rate and that her workshop can create at least one job for a person that needs it and doesn’t have any other job opportunities.

loans.use: to buy supplies, such as fabric, thread, and needles.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is 35 years old and from Buhweju District. He is a principle farmer majoring in tea. His plantations are located at the above mentioned address. He is a married man with two children aged five and two. He works in his shamba (a field used for growing crops) six days a week and eight hours a day. He also operates a retail shop at Nyakabingo–Buhweju and it is run by his wife. 

This business of farming was started in the year 2009 and it has been very profitable. He resorted to farming after buying a piece of land from his small savings for he is a teacher and he earns a monthly salary. He immediately started planting tea plants so that he gets an income for his family. He borrowed UGX 2,000,000 only to buy fertilizer for his tea plantations so he can trade in green tea leaves. Most of his clients are tea factories i.e. tea traders. He hopes to educate all his children and be financially stable later in life.

His source of income is affected by the drought (dry season) where outputs are not promising and yet the demand is too high. Again another challenge is price fluctuations which leave farmers in shock. Whereby a kilo of green tea leaves was at 500, now it’s at 200.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizers.

loans.name: Sirley Del Socorro

texts.es:
Sirley con 29 años de edad es casada y madre de 5 hijos. Toda su vida fue criada en el campo, donde ha realizado actividades agropecuarias la mayor parte de su vida.  
Actualmente posee cultivos de plátano y complementa con la producción de leche, de algunas vacas que son de su propiedad, tanto la cosecha de plátano, como los litros de leche que ordeña a diarios, son vendidos en el mercado de Turbo, así logra obtener los recursos suficientes para llevar el sustento diario a su hogar. 
Sirley es una mujer seria, responsable, comprometida con su familia y su trabajo, por ello siempre quiere seguir avanzando es busca de un futuro mejor, por esta razón solicita un crédito para invertirlo en la compra de insumos agrícolas (abonos, fertilizantes, pesticidas) con el fin de continuar con el cuidado de sus cultivos y poder sacar una cosecha en óptimas condiciones; todo esto le ayudará a seguir adelante, mejorando poco a poco su nivel de vida y la de sus hijos, a los cuales les podrá ofrecer mejor educación para que tengan un futuro próspero y lleno de éxitos.
texts.en:
Sirley, 29, is married and the mother of five children.  All her life, she was raised in the country where she has engaged in agricultural activities the majority of her life.
These days she has a banana crop and she supplements this with the production of milk from some cows that belong to her.  Both the banana harvest and the liters of milk that she fills daily are sold in the market in Turbo.  Thus she is able to obtain resources sufficient to bring sustenance to her home on a daily basis.
Sirley is a serious, responsible woman who is dedicated to her family and her work.  For this reason, she wants to continue moving forward in search of a better future and she is requesting this loan in order to invest in the purchase of agricultural supplies (manure, fertilizers, pesticides) so that she can continue to care for her crops and get a harvest in the best condition.  All this will help her continue moving forward, improving little by little her standard of living and that of her children, whom she will be able to offer better education so that they will have a prosperous future full of success.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies (manure, fertilizers, pesticides).

loans.name: Martha Isabel

texts.es:
Martha junto con su pareja se han trazado un propósito para cumplir en 5 años, que será darle a sus hijos un buen estudio y comprar una vivienda propia, quizás el ultimo podría demorarse un poco más debido a los altos costos de estas pero lo primero es soñarlo.
Martha para lograr este sueño aporta un grano de arena muy valioso con su venta de ropa, un negocio muy cambiante en el cual para vender tienes que tener artículos de última moda que son los que más le piden.
Martha quiere solicitar un crédito para la compra de surtido de ropa para hombre y dama como jean, camisas, camisetas, abrigos, blusas.
Se participe del lindo proyecto de esta empresaria, que con su esfuerzo busca tener su hogar propio para dejarles una herencia a sus dos hijos.
texts.en:
Martha and her partner have set a goal for themselves to be reached in five years: they will give their children proper schooling and they'll buy their own home. Perhaps the latter might take a little longer due to the high costs of real estate, but the dream is the first step.

To achieve this dream, Martha makes a valuable contribution through her clothing sales, a very dynamic business that relies upon having the latest fashion styles available to her clients, because that's what they demand the most.

Martha wants a loan to buy a variety of clothing for men and women, including jeans, shirts, tee shirts, coats, and blouses.

Take an active part in the fine project of this businesswoman, who aims with her efforts to have her own home so she can leave a legacy to her two children.

loans.use: to buy a variety of clothing for men and women, including jeans, shirts, tee shirts, coats and blouses.

loans.name: Carolina

texts.es:
Carolina es una mujer joven de 24 años de edad, felizmente casada y madre de un pequeño de tan solo 4 años de edad, inicio hace poco con un negocio de venta de ropa, con poco capital y por ende poca mercancía, explorando como esta nueva faceta como independiente.
Al ver que tenía buenos resultado y que en este negocio quizás pueda mejorar sus condones de vida quiere solicitar un crédito para la compra de surtido de ropa para mujer, con el propósito marcado de venderla toda y juntar capital, para plantar la semilla de un sueño que es junto con su esposo comprar su propia vivienda propia para vivir como la feliz familia que son.
texts.en:
Carolina, age 24, is the happily married mother of a Little four month old.  She started a little while ago with her business of selling clothes.  She started with a little capital, and she therefore has little merchandise.  She is exploring this new facet of being independent.

Upon seeing that she had good results, maybe she will be able to improve her living conditions.  She wants to request a loan to buy women’s clothing as stock.  Her intention is to sell it all and to get together capital to plant the seed of a dream.  The dream is, together with her husband, to buy her own house in order to live as the happy family that they are.

loans.use: to stock up on clothing in order to flourish in her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to cover her university fees.

loans.name: Saodat

texts.ru:
Саодат занимается животноводством, у нее имеется скотный двор, где она заботится о своих животных. Саодат в течение 15 лет  разводит коров, бычков, овец и козлят. Она хорошо справляется со своей работой, так как эта деятельность ей по душе. 
Саодат живет в районе Спитамен с мужем и детьми. Ей 47 лет. Животноводческая деятельность является основной, потому что за счет дохода от этого бизнеса она обеспечивает семью. Саодат обратилась за кредитом, чтобы сохранить  деятельность и увеличить поголовье скота. Она намерена на заемные средства приобрести пару скотин и расширить животноводческую деятельность. Поддержите Саодат.
texts.en:
Saodat is involved in animal husbandry and has a livestock yard, where she takes care of her livestock. Saodat has been raising cows, bulls, sheep and goats for 15 years. She handles her work well because this works makes her soul happy. 

Saodat lives in the Spitamen district with her husband and children. She is 47 years old. Animal husbandry is her primary business because she supports her family with the earnings from this business. Saodat requested a loan to save her business and increase her livestock headcount. She intends to use this money to buy a couple of heads of livestock and expand her animal husbandry business. Please support Saodat.

loans.use: to buy a couple of heads of livestock and expand her animal husbandry business

loans.name: David Manuel

texts.es:
David es un campesino humilde y trabajador de 30 años de edad, que desde pequeño aprendió todas las labores del campo, gracias a las enseñanzas de su padre.
Actualmente posee cultivos de plátano, cuyas cosechas son recolectadas y vendidas en el mercado del pueblo donde reside, esto le genera los recursos suficientes para llevar el sustento diario a su hogar y solventar las necesidades básicas de su esposa y 2 hijos.
Se motiva a solicitar el crédito con el fin de invertirlo en la compra de insumos agrícolas al por mayor (abonos, pesticidas, fertilizantes), esto le permitirá seguir cuidando de sus cultivos y mejorar la productividad de la próxima cosecha, lo que beneficiará los ingresos que percibe por cada venta.
David manifiesta que su mayor anhelo es seguir luchando para generar una estabilidad económica y brindar a su familia mejores condiciones de vida y bienestar.

El cultivo de David Podrá mantenerse y salir adelante con tu ayuda!
texts.en:
David, age 30, is a humble and hard-working man from the country.  When he was little he learned all of the jobs in the field, thanks to the teachings from his father.

He now has banana crops.  Their harvests are gathered and sold at the town market where he lives.  This generates sufficient resources to bring home the daily bread and pay for the basic necessities for his wife and two children.

He is motivated to request the loan to buy agricultural supplies wholesale (compost, pesticides, and fertilizers).  This will allow him to continue caring for his crops and improving productivity for the next harvest.  This will benefit the earnings that he gets from each sale.

David says that his greatest desire is to continue struggling in order to generate financial stability and to provide his family with better living conditions and well-being.

David will be able to maintain his crop and get ahead with your help.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies wholesale (compost, pesticides, and fertilizers).

loans.name: Grace's Group

texts.en:
Grace is a 53-year-old proud mother of seven children. She is a group leader, often described as a very reliable person, and is representing her group of 15 farmers in Matete District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2013, Grace has noticed that she has had more profits from each harvest.

Grace described her harvest as good last year, but believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. She is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, in addition to fertilizer and maize, because she will now be able to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study. With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to send her children to school.

With this loan, Grace’s Group will be able to plant a total of 6.5 acres of land and purchase a total of 12 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Norma Isabel

texts.es: Norma de 41 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus tres hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de zapatos desde hace 4 años, su negocio está ubicado en una zona muy transitada por eso posee muchos clientes, con las ventas que realiza logra solventar los gastos que se le presentan en el hogar, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de zapatos por mayor para poder tener mejores ingresos y una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Norma is 41 years old, she lives in her own home with her husband and three children. 

Norma has been making a living selling shoes for the last 4 years. Her business is located in a high-transit zone and as a result she has many customers. With the sales she makes, Norma is able to cover the household costs. 

Norma is requesting a loan to buy wholesale shoes, this will allow her to increase her earnings and gain a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy shoes wholesale

loans.name: Yuri Katerine

texts.es:
Comprar surtido de arroz, panela, productos lácteos, carnes frías, trigo, son la razón para que Yuri una joven de 24 años de edad, madre cabeza de familia de un pequeño de tan solo 3 años llegue a ustedes, el motivo es que no tiene capital para comprar surtido y que lograra con esto? Pues tendrá la capacidad de abastecer su negocio y ofrecer productos que anteriormente no tenía.
Por eso pide su ayuda ya que con tu aporte sacara su negocio adelante y buscando mejorar sus condiciones de vida y que su hijo continúe estudiando
texts.en:
Yuri, 24, a single mother of a little one only three years old, comes to you because she needs to buy an assortment of rice, brown sugar, dairy products, cold meats, and wheat.  The reason is that she doesn't have the capital to purchase an assortment. What will she achieve with this?  Well, she will have the ability to supply her business and offer products which previously she did not have.
For this reason, she begs your help since with the loan she will move her business forward.  She is seeking to improve her life conditions and for her son to continue studying.

loans.use: to buy an assortment of rice, brown sugar, dairy products, cold meats, and wheat in order to supply her business.

loans.name: Maria Esther

texts.es:
Maria Esther tiene 48 años de edad, vive en casa propia con su cónyuge e hija en el distrito de Lagunas, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. Este distrito se encuentra habitado por gente sencilla y amable, dedicada principalmente a la pesca artesanal, agricultura y ganadería.

Ella se dedica a la venta de verduras, frutas, arroz, azúcar, aceite, entre otros productos, cuenta con experiencia en el negocio y con clientes fijos quienes brindan muy buenas referencias personales y laborales de ella. El préstamo será utilizado para la compra de una mayor cantidad de mercadería como arroz, azúcar, aceite, fideos, entre otros, para incrementar el stock de su negocio, con esto Maria Esther espera ofrecer una mayor variedad de productos a sus clientes satisfaciendo sus gustos y preferencias lo que tendrá un gran impacto en su nivel de ventas y le va a permitir mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Maria Esther is 48 years old and lives in her own home with her spouse and daughter. They live in the district of Lagunas, Chiclayo, Lambayeque region, in the north of Peru. In this district you will find humble and friendly people, mainly making a living from artisan fishing, agriculture and livestock. 

Maria Esther makes a living off the sale of vegetables, fruits, rice, sugar and oil, amongst other things. Maria Esther is experienced in this business and has stable customers who give her very good work and personal references. 

The loan will be used to buy merchandise, including rice, sugar, oil and pasta, in large quantities, in order to increase her business's stock. As a result, Maria Esther hopes to be able to offer a greater variety of products to her satisfied customers, to their tastes and preferences. This would greatly impact her sales and thus allow her to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy merchandise, including rice, sugar, oil and pasta, in large quantities, in order to increase her business's stock.

loans.name: Khosiyat

texts.en: Khosiyat is 57 years old. She has two sons. One of her sons is a student. He is 19 years old and another son is 24 years old. He works as a taxi driver. Khosiyat is a professional seamstress. She has been engaged in this activity for six years. She is a very kind and responsive woman. Khosiyat is requesting this loan for paying the tuition of her son at University. Her main challenge is the lack of finances. Khosiyat hopes for your kindness.

loans.use: to pay her son's tuition at University.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase many goat kids to raise and sell.

loans.name: Karen Vanessa

texts.es: Karen, tiene 23 años de edad, es madre soltera por viudez, tiene un hijo y reside en una colonia del municipio de Villanueva, Cortes junto a sus padres y su hijo. Con el propósito de generar ingresos para la manutención de su hijo trabajó en una maquila como operaria, luego quedó sin empleo. Hace seis meses se dedica a vender mercadería como ropa, sandalias, zapatos y cosméticos para obtener sus ingresos.
