Este negocio lo tiene en el mercado local de la zona donde vende camisetas, blusas, ropa para niños, calzado y cosméticos. Decidió solicitar un prestamo por 8,500 para surtir con variedad de cosmeticos, prendas de vestir y calzado para aumentar las ventas y mantener sus clientes. Su plan es ahorrar para poder construir su propia casa y también darle buena educación a su hijo.
texts.en:
Karen, 23, is a single, widowed mother who has a son and lives in the suburb in the municipality of Villanueva, Cortes, with her parents and her son.  With the objective of generating income to care for her son, she worked in a factory as an operator, but then was out of work.  For six months she has been making a living selling merchandise such as clothing, sandals, shoes, and cosmetics in order to obtain an income.  She has this business in the local market of the zone where she sells T-shirts, blouses, children's clothing, footwear, and cosmetics.
She decided to request a loan for 8,500 to stock a variety of cosmetics, articles of clothing, and footwear to increase sales and keep her customers.  Her plan is to save to be able to construct her own house and give her son a good education.

loans.use: to buy clothing such as blouses, T-shirts, pants, shoes, and cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Golibjon

texts.ru:
Голибчон трудолюбивый мужчина 40 лет. Он  живет в кишлаке Мучун. Он женат и имеет четырех детей. У него среднее образование. У него очень дружная семья. Живут они в сельской местности. Чтобы иметь доход в семье, все члены семьи пытаются как-то зарабатывать деньги.  Он занимается животноводством и земледелием.   
Основным и стабильным бизнесом Голибчона является животноводство. Он разводит и продаёт скот. В этом деле ему помогает жена. Она ухаживает за скотом, а также продаёт полученное от скота молоко. 
Бизнес животноводства приносит ему хороший и стабильный доход. Поэтому он желает расширить этот бизнес. Ему необходимо купить ещё несколько голов скота для выращивания и дальнейшей продажи. Для этого Голибчон обратился в Арванд и хочет получить кредит на покупку скота. Он надеется, что этот бизнес будет успешно расширяться и приносить больше прибыли, чтобы качественно удовлетворять нужды семьи. Голибчон заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en:
Golibjon is a hardworking 40-year-old man. He lives in the Muchun village. He is married and has four children. He has a secondary education. He has a very friendly family. They live in a rural area. All of the family members try to earn money somehow in order to have an income in the family. He is involved in animal husbandry and farming.

Animal husbandry is Golibjon's primary and stable business. He fattens up and sells livestock. His wife helps him with this business. She takes care of the livestock and also sells milk.

The animal husbandry business yields a good and stable income for Golibjon. This is why he wishes to expand this business. He needs to buy several heads of livestock for fattening up and subsequent resale. Golibjon came to Arvand, wanting to obtain a loan for this livestock purchase. He hopes that this business will successfully expand and bring in more profit in order to satisfactorily meet the family's needs. Golibjon thanks Arvand for the support in advance.

loans.use: to buy several heads of livestock for fattening up and subsequent resale

loans.name: Gabriel Ramon

texts.es:
Él es Gabriel un joven, inteligente, capacitado, capaz, curioso y emprendedor de tan solo 24 años de edad, que en un espacio acogedor logro montar con un bajo capital un negocio de reparaciones y venta de celulares, siendo uno de los pocos negocios en su sector que oferta estos servicios.
Gabriel tiene una pequeña hija de tan solo 6 meses de edad, y su sueño es ser lo suficiente para mantenerla, por ello quiere mejorar su negocio, mejorar las ventas y tener más rentabilidad y para ello trazo una inteligente estrategia en la cual busca comprar celulares malos, para arreglaros y venderlos obteniendo una mejor utilidad.
texts.en:
Gabriel is young, intelligent, capable, skilled, curious and enterprising, and only 24 years old. 

In a welcoming space, Gabriel has managed to start, with little capital, a cell phone repairs and sales business. This is one of the few such businesses in the area that offers such services.  

Gabriel has a small 6 month old daughter and it is his dream is to do enough to support her. For his daughter Gabriel wants to improve the sales and profitability of his business. In order to achieve this, Gabriel's intelligent strategy is to look for and buy cell phones in bad condition, repair them and sell them in better use.

loans.use: to buy telephones in a bad condition, repair them and sell them in better use

loans.name: Nizomiddin

texts.ru:
Низомидин молодой и трудолюбивый  мужчина в возрасте 32 лет.  Он живёт в джамоате Саразм.  Его жену зовут Сабохат.  Она  швея.  Занимается вышиванием  национальных платьев.  У него двое детей.  Он занимается  земледелием  и животноводством.  В свободное время  занимается   строительством домов. 
Бизнес животноводства приносит хороший доход, поэтому Низомиддин хочет расширить этот бизнес, увеличив поголовье своего скота. Для этого он обратился в Арванд, чтобы получить кредит на покупку скота. Низомиддин заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en:
Nizomiddin is a young and hardworking 32-year-old man. He lives in the Sarazm jamoat. His wife's name is Sabohat. She is a seamstress. She is involved in embroidering national dresses. Nizomiddin has two children. He is involved in farming and animal husbandry. He is also involved in building houses in his free time.

The animal husbandry business yields him a good income, and this is why Nizomiddin wants to expand this business by increasing his livestock headcount. He came to Arvand to request a loan to buy livestock. Nizomiddin thanks Arvand for the support in advance.

loans.use: to buy livestock in order to expand his business

loans.name: Yenis Marlet

texts.es:
Yenis, una mujer de 34 años de edad llena de sueños y aspiraciones en su vida, vive en una finca en el municipio de Valencia y se gana la vida con la producción y venta de pollos y huevos.  
Con este trabajo intenta sostener a su familia compuesta por su esposo y 7 hijos.
Es un trabajo que ha venido ejerciendo desde hace aproximadamente 2 años con el fin de salir adelante.
Pide un apoyo económico para la compra de pollos, gallinas ponedoras, alimento y materiales para su galpón.
Con este préstamo podrá tener un negocio más sostenible y consolidado.

Con un préstamo que hagas hoy podrás mejorar la vida y el negocio de Yenis!
texts.en:
Yenis, 34, is a woman full of dreams and aspirations for her life.  She lives on a farm in the municipality of Valencia and she makes a living from the production and sale of chickens and eggs.  With this work, she tries to sustain her family composed of her husband and seven children.  She has been doing this work for two years with the objective of getting ahead.
She requests economic support in order to buy chickens, laying hens, feed, and materials for her chicken coop.  With this loan, she will be able to have a more sustainable and consolidated business.  
With the loan you make today, you will be able to improve the life and business of Yenis!

loans.use: to buy chickens, laying hens, feed and materials for her chicken coop.

loans.name: Dorcy Jicelly

texts.es:
Ella es Dorcy una joven de 27 años de edad, creativa, responsable, emprendedora, y ante todo alegre que disfruta la vida, ella es comerciante de mercancía principalmente extensiones de cabello que promociona principalmente a la comunidad afro-descendiente que son los principales compradores.
Solicita un crédito para la compra de cabello natural y realizar así las extensiones con las que espera conseguir buena utilidad para ir creciendo poco a poco y en un futuro quizás porque no, comprar una casa
texts.en:
She is Dorcy, 27, a creative, responsible, enterprising, young woman who is happy to enjoy life.  She is a merchandise vendor, principally of hair extensions which she promotes primarily to the community of African descent who are her primary customers.
She is requesting a loan to purchase natural hair and thus make extensions with which she hopes to obtain good ability to grow little by little and in the future maybe to buy a house.

loans.use: to buy natural hair in order to make hair extensions.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth raises and sells pigs. She also engages in a food-vending business, making and selling homemade doughnuts. It is a type of fried dough confectionery or dessert food.  She is a 35-year-old married mother of five children from Mayorga, Leyte. Her oldest child is 17 and the youngest is 8.

She is asking for a loan to buy pig feed and for additional capital for food vending. With the loan, she would continue to raise healthy pigs. With the additional capital, she could prepare large quantities of doughnuts to sell to her community. She could earn more income and provide her family with basic needs.

In the future, Elizabeth would be grateful and determined to expand both sources of income to be successful and to become sustainable as well.

loans.use: to buy pig feed and for additional capital for food vending

loans.name: Munira

texts.ru: Мунире 40 лет и она родом из района Зафарабод.  Она замужем и является матерью двоих детей. У нее две дочери в возрасте 12 и 8 лет, которые учатся в средней школе. Мунира имеет  место продажи на рынке, и она  занимается там продажей детских игрушек и хозяйственных товаров. Она начала этот бизнес в  2010 году. Мунира планирует привезти партию детских игрушек и хозяйственных товаров, чтобы расширить свою деятельность и привлечь  себе больше клиентов.  Из-за нехватки денег она обратилась за кредитом, чтобы достичь своих целей. Поддержите Муниру в этот нужный момент.
texts.en: Munira is 40 years old and she is a native of the Zafarobod district of Tajikistan.  She is married and the mother of two daughters, ages 12 and 8, currently attending secondary school.  Munira has a retail outlet at the market, where she sells children's toys and household goods.  She started this business in 2010.  She is now planning to bring in an assortment a children's toys and household goods in order to expand her activity and attract more customers.  Because she doesn't have the necessary funds, she has applied for a loan to achieve her goals.  Please support Munira at a time when she really needs it.

loans.use: to bring in children's toys and household goods.

loans.name: Mekar Jadi Pondoan Group

texts.en:
The Mekar Jadi Pondoan group has received five loans from MUK. The new loan will be specifically used to develop a business raising pigs. Borrowers take good care of pigs for satisfactory results. That's because all the members of the group had received training and gained knowledge about caring for pigs in the right way.
Entering the sixth loan, there is a change in management to provide a new atmosphere in the group. Ni Nyoman, the former leader, was replaced by Ni Ketut and Ni Nyoman has now become treasurer. One member resigned from the group after getting maximum results and decided to continue the businesses with her own capital. She was replaced by a new member. Ni Ketut will use the loan to buy superior quality piglets to be fattened for sale after maintained for five months. Ni Ketut has two children who are still in primary school. All profits will be used to support the cost of education of her two children.

loans.use: to buy superior quality piglets

loans.name: Selfa's Group

texts.en:
Selfa is 39 years old and has 5 children. She is a group leader and is representing her group formed by 7 farmers in Matete District, Kenya. 

Selfa has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2010. This decision was largely a result of her desire to have access to quality training and to acquire new farming methods; and, although she described her last harvest as very good, she believes she could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. Selfa also decided to purchase a solar light as part of her loan, which she is very excited about, as it will allow her to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money.

Obtaining this loan means that Selfa's Group will be able to receive a total of 6 solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 3 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.en:
Eduardo is a resident in the town of Mayorga, Leyte. He is a married father of seven children, five still attending school. He runs a sari-sari (variety) store, selling various goods such as biscuits, powdered milk, canned goods, bread, seasonings, soap and soft drinks. He also sells fish to the nearby towns to augment his income.

Eduardo has requested a loan to buy assorted goods for the store and additional fresh fish. His store will be filled again with a variety of goods and he could continue to sell fresh fish to his customers. In the long run, Eduardo would slowly recover and start to manage his income and pay his dues.

He is willing to expand his current sources of income for the welfare of his growing children and also to support their education so they have better futures as well.

loans.use: to buy assorted goods for the store and fresh fish.

loans.name: Benard's Group

texts.en:
Benard is 54 years old and has 6 children. He is a group leader and is representing his group formed by 8 farmers in Matete District, Kenya. 

Benard has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2010. This decision was largely a result of his desire to have access to quality training and to acquire new farming methods; and, although he described his last harvest as excellent, he believes he could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. Benard also decided to purchase a solar light as part of his loan, which he is very excited about, as it will allow him to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money.

Obtaining this loan means that Benard's Group will be able to receive a total of 7 solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 3.5 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth earns a living by dressmaking. She sews and makes dresses in all shapes, kinds and forms. She is married and has a 19-year-old son. She has been engaged in dressmaking for nine years already. She lives in the town of Mayorga, Leyte. 

Elizabeth is asking for a loan to purchase a new sewing machine. She then could fill more orders and start to earn more income. She will also set aside some of the profit for future use. 

Elizabeth hopes that someday, she will be able to successfully handle her present business for the welfare of her son and to improve their standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine

loans.name: Nelisa

texts.en:
Nelisa is a merchant from Mayorga, Leyte. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store, selling basic household items like noodles, canned good, biscuits, chips, soap, and condiments. In addition, she also raises and sells hogs. She is a married mother of two children, ages 17 and 12. To augment her income, she also is engaged in food vending.

Nelisa has requested a loan to buy additional stock for the store, to purchase pig feed and for additional capital for food vending. This loan is essential for making her businesses succeed. She will be able to raise healthy pigs and contribute to the success of her present sources of income. Slowly, she could  balance her finances and provide her family with a proper diet.

In the future, Nelisa is hoping that she will manage her sources of income successfully.

loans.use: to buy additional stock for the store, purchase pig feed and additional capital for food vending

loans.name: Balbarmaa

texts.en:
Mrs. Balbarmaa, 45 years old, lives with her husband and two children in Kherlen, the easternmost town of Mongolia. 

Balbarmaa has been working as a coordinator at the bus station for 17 years. Her husband transports passengers between districts for a living. Their children go to high school. 

Balbarmaa's family recently moved into a new apartment without any furniture. So, she is requesting a loan of $1,575 USD to buy furniture such as a sofa, drawer and chairs. By doing so, her family will live in a comfortable place where her children can study hard and her husband can take rest after hard work. The borrower's family used to live in an old Mongolian traditional Ger (a portable felt dwelling) and moving into an apartment was her long time wish.

loans.use: to buy furniture such as a sofa, drawer and chairs

loans.name: Sambi Ternak Group

texts.en: This loan group has done such a great job of helping members start their own businesses that two people have been able to leave the group and finance their own companies. This is the main goal of MUK, which aims to help women start and run their own businesses. Today, the Sambi Ternak group has a new leader and is requesting a loan for 12,000,000 IDR for its eight members. Putu, the treasurer of this group, will use her portion of the loan to buy feed and fix the enclosure in which she keeps her animals. In the next two weeks, her sow will give birth and she would very much like for all the piglets to be born safely. She will then raise them for two months, after which she will sell them and use the proceeds to fix her kitchen.

loans.use: to buy feed and fix a cage.

loans.name: Sari Mertha Group

texts.en:
In the last loan, Ni Luh used the funds to buy fertilizer for cacao and coconut in her garden. Together with her husband, Ni Luh worked in the garden beginning at 09:00 am, sowing fertilizer. After almost 6 months passed and through routine maintenance, the results have started to appear. Coconuts trees each used to generate 150 fruit; now they produce 180 fruits per tree. Cacaos had fruits much then before and are more resistant to disease. Ni Luh and her husband very happy.

Now with the new loan, Ni Luh and Sari Mertha group members will buy corn and chilli seeds. Now is the time for planting corn and chili because of the rainy season. With meticulous care and diligence, Ni Luh is optimistic she will get the maximum results. Ni Luh plans to fix her kitchen with the proceeds.

loans.use: to buy corn and chilli seeds

loans.name: Normita

texts.en:
Normita lives in Mayorga, Leyte. She is a 49-year-old married woman with six children. Four of her children are still attending school. She owns and operates a sari-sari store. She sells basic goods like sugar, eggs, noodles, seasonings, soap and beverages. Aside from that, she also raises and sells hogs. She also engages in farming and grows rice as well.

Normita is asking for a loan to purchase assorted groceries, piglets, and farm supplies like fertilizers. These tools are very helpful in the operation of her livelihood. She will have more stocks on her store, and improve the yield of her farm. Slowly, she will be able to pay her dues and handle her finances.

In the future, she is hoping that with the present resources, nothing is impossible to experience success with hard work and determination.

loans.use: to purchase assorted groceries, piglets, and farm supplies like fertilizers.

loans.name: Sotharat

texts.en:
Sotharat, 34 years old, lives in a community of Pursat Province, Cambodia. She has three children who are currently in school. To make a living and support her family, she manages and operates a farming business on a small rice farmland which is located near her house. So far, she has been in this types of business for almost twenty years. On average, she is able to make an income of USD 10.00 a day.

She wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family by having a latrine to use, because there is no latrine in her house now. Therefore, she is borrowing a loan from Kiva to build a latrine. By doing this, she can help her family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration. She is thankful for the loan granted through HKL with a much lower interest rate than other general loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine

loans.name: David's Group

texts.en:
Pictured above is David, who, as a group leader, is representing his group formed by 12 farmers in Kakamega South District, Kenya. He is married and is a father to 4 children, and is known in his community as a very experienced farmer.

Initially, David joined One Acre Fund in 2011 because he wanted to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. Since he joined the program he says that his life has improved, especially because he has been able to consistently feed his family. With the profits from the coming harvesting season, David plans to save more money for the future.

Between the 12 farmers in David's Group, a total of 7.75 acres of land will be planted using the maize seeds and fertilizer received with the loan. Additionally, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light so, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 5 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve maize harvests.

loans.name: Tsedenjav

texts.en: Mr. Tsedenjav is 47 years old and lives with his wife, two daughters and one son in Darkhan, the second largest city in Mongolia. He has been a construction worker since 1988. His wife and older daughter earn a living by providing taxi service to local people. His younger daughter studies at a university. Their son is currently unemployed and stays at home. Mr. Tsedenjav doesn't want his son to sit idly at home so he is requesting a loan for $1,825 to buy an electric car so his son can provide taxi service. The advantage of an electric car is that it emits no pollutants, wastes less fuel,and is environmentally friendly and economically efficient. The city of Darkhan encourages the use of electric cars and imposes lower taxes on their users.

loans.use: to buy an electric car .

loans.name: Darma Sedana Group

texts.en:
Because pork prices are still high and the quality of pigs from the Darma Sedana group are good enough, they had satisfactory sales results. They can pay the loan on time, meet the needs of their families, save money and use it for working capital. 

Two members of the group succeeded with their business and continue with their own capital. They are very grateful for the funding and knowledge that has been given. Ten other members requested a loan with the expectation of getting better results so that they can be independent. 

Ni Ketut will buy five superior quality piglets and she hopes to become a successful farmer and an example for other members. 

In the next six months, the group expects an increasing loan size.

loans.use: to purchase five superior quality piglets.

loans.name: Batmunkh

texts.en:
Batmunkh, 37, lives with his wife and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been transporting goods between districts since 2012. His wife is the watchman at a high school. Their children go to high school. 

Three years ago, Batmunkh leased a light truck and paid half of its cost. Now he is requesting a loan of 800 USD to pay the other half. If he pays the full amount and transfers the ownership to his name, he can access more transportation business opportunities. 

Batmunkh is a very hardworking individual who cares deeply for his family.

loans.use: to pay half the cost of a truck.

loans.name: Neko

texts.en:
Neko engages in the food vending business. He sells taho, which is a Philippine snack food made of fresh soft/silken tofu, arnibal (sweetener and flavoring), and sago pearl (similar to tapioca pearl). He is a 24-year-old married man with a one-year-old son. He lives in Dulag, Leyte. He also sells balot. A balut is a developing duck embryo that is boiled and eaten in the shell. It is commonly sold as street food.

He is asking for a loan to buy ingredients like ground beans, silken tofu, brown sugar and many others. These ingredients will be used in preparing taho, and he will sell it in his local community. He could now purchase more balot to resell. With these, his income will improve and he could start to settle his obligations. He will be able to provide the needs of his growing child.

Neko dreams of expanding his business to make it productive and profitable.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like ground beans, silken tofu, brown sugar, and many others.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy soft drinks, noodles, seasonings and other ingredients needed in her business.

loans.name: Donna

texts.en:
Donna believes that first impressions count—and for that reason, she has spent nearly ten years of her professional career giving her clients “the royal” cleaning experience. Donna is the proud owner of Royal Maid Home & Carpet Cleaning Co. Operating out of Pflugerville, Texas, she recently decided to rebuild her business and start over again.

“When the recession hit, my call volumes were cut in half, and I became nervous about the success of my business,” Donna said. “My expenses were going up, but my income was going down — the recession forced me to make a tough decision.”

Since that time, Donna has gone back to school to take computer courses, business math, and business English, and has also received administrative certifications.

“The recession is over, and things are finally starting to come around,” she said. “Yes, I had to make a tough decision to close my business, but I’ve accomplished so much since then.”

Her newly re-established business has been in operation for four months. Donna currently employs one part-time employee and is planning to hire one more to help her business grow. She came to LiftFund, formerly known as Accion Texas Inc., seeking support for advertising, supplies, and equipment.

“I am so grateful that I now have a second chance to re-establish myself within my community,” she said.

loans.use: to pay for advertising, supplies, and equipment.

loans.name: Diego

texts.en:
Diego is a Guatemalan artisan who specializes in hand-carved wood art. He would like to invest in a bulk purchase of wood as well as new equipment for his workshop, including a grinder and a lathe.

Diego has been selling through NOVICA since 2011. This is his story:

"What I enjoy the most about my work is also my biggest challenge, creating new designs. Wood is a noble element, totally transformable, that gives you a lot if you know how to work it, treat it and take care of it. I remember with much gratefulness a companion in the first workshop where I worked. He took a lot of time to teach me things I never imagined possible to do with my hands. Now I spend some of my time teaching the young people who work with me."

"I'd like to thank everyone who supports artisans like myself. With this microcredit I will be able to buy the raw materials and tools I need to increase sales and improve my family's quality of life. May God shower you all with many blessings."

Use the link below to view Diego's hand-carved wood art on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/8047

loans.use: to invest in a bulk purchase of wood as well as new equipment for his workshop, including a grinder and a lathe

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en: Teresita is a 59-year-old mother who has two adult-age children. She has owned and managed a small retail store in her community for almost ten years. This is her way of helping her husband in obtaining income. She aspires to improve more of her business in order to earn a higher income and sustain the needs of her family. Due to insufficient capital, she would like to obtain a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy more canned goods, snack foods, beverages, seasonings, laundry soaps, eggs, candies and soft drinks to resell. Through this financial assistance, she believes that someday she will make her business more profitable.

loans.use: to buy more canned goods, snack foods, beverages, seasonings, laundry soaps, eggs, candies and soft drinks to resell.

loans.name: Juan Jose

texts.es: Juan de 49 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y su hija, el se dedica a la venta de refrescos, licuados, agua, golosinas, etc. su chalet lo tiene ubicado cerca de su lugar de residencia en una zona muy transitada, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas productos por mayor para continuar con sus ventas y así tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Juan is 49 years old and lives in his own home with his wife and child.  He has a business selling drinks, shakes, water, snacks, etc.  His store is located near his home in a busy area, and with the earnings from his sales, he is able to cover some of the household expenses.  

Juan is requesting a loan to buy more products at wholesale to continue with his sales so that he can increase his income.

loans.use: to buy products at wholesale to sell

loans.name: Marciana

texts.en:
Marciana raises and sells hogs. She is a 32-year-old woman who lives in Dulag, Leyte. She also runs a sari-sari (general) store. She sells basic household items like coffee, cooking oil, sugar, eggs, noodles and canned goods. 

She is asking for a loan to buy pig feed and pigs for her agricultural business, as well as assorted groceries for her store. This loan will be a useful tool in managing her sources of income. She will be raising raising healthy hogs and also filling her store with various goods. With these improvements, she will be earning more and start to pay her dues.

Marciana would like to expand both businesses for the improvement of her livelihood.

loans.use: to buy pig feed and pigs for her agricultural business, as well as assorted groceries for her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for working capital for his business expansion.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.en:
Antonio is a Peruvian artisan who specializes in wood mirrors, jewelry boxes and home decor. He would like to invest in a bulk purchase of wood for his designs.

Antonio has been selling through NOVICA since 2005. This is his story:

"I'd describe my work as life itself, and my existence together with it. When I was only 17, I created my first piece and it was an immense satisfaction. Art guides my hands in that moment of pleasure as I begin a design. My pieces are inspired by the olden times and reflect the style of vintage pieces. They transmit my love for life and for nature — its flowers, birds and all the rich flora and fauna of our country."

"I'd like to use this microcredit to take advantage of the warm season and acquire wood for my handicrafts. I'd also like to add some new designs to my collection. Thanks so much for your unconditional support."

Use the link below to view Antonio's wood mirrors, jewelry boxes and home decor on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/5387

loans.use: to invest in a bulk purchase of wood for his designs

loans.name: Kang's Group

texts.en: Kang, 35, lives with her family in a rural village in Kampong Thom province. She is the mother of three children, two of whom are in school and one of whom is too young to attend. She earns a living by growing rice and cassava. She has been involved this business for a long time and earns about 7,000 KHR per day. This is her first loan request from VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). Kang also leads a loan group with four members, and plans to use her portion of the loan to build a decent latrine. She hopes that this will improve her family's health and living conditions.

loans.use: to build a decent latrine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy and build a water source with satellite at their home to improve access to water and sanitation for their family.

loans.name: Kobina

texts.en:
Kobina is a Ghanaian artisan who specializes in carved African masks. He would like to invest in a purchase of raw materials, including wood, beads, paints, sand paper and polish.

Kobina has been selling through NOVICA since 2012. This is his story:

"My father painted, and I also have a flair for drawing and painting. This makes designing masks something that comes naturally to me. What I did to hone my skills was to visit art workshops where I could observe artisans. I was so eager to learn more, that I got a raw mask and started to make designs and paint it with acrylics. The outcome was very good, and that is how I started in this art form."

"The microcredit has been very helpful to me in the past. With this help, I have been able to increase my inventory. This is reflected in improved sales, which is helping so much for the payment of my kids' school fees."

Use the link below to view Kobina's African masks on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/8495

loans.use: to invest in a purchase of raw materials, including wood, beads, paints, sand paper and polish

loans.name: Eric

texts.en:
Eric is a Ghanaian artisan who specializes in African masks and wood carvings. He would like to invest in a purchase of raw materials, including wood, sand paper, stain and polish.

Eric has been selling through NOVICA since 2000. This is his story:

"I first showed interest in carving as a young man, and would sometimes go around helping the carvers in my community. However, my mother wanted me to be an electrician so she sent me to the city to study electronics. Soon enough, I realized that this was not my calling, and I decided to return home to learn the art of carving, and dedicate my life to it."

"I will always pray for those who contribute to this microcredit, as it allows me to constantly improve my business. The loans I have received in the past have really improved my economic and social life. I am very grateful to all of you."

Use the link below to view Eric's African masks and wood carvings on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/1974

loans.use: to invest in a purchase of raw materials, including wood, sand paper, stain and polish

loans.name: Umedai

texts.en: Umedai is a young resident of Rudaki district. She is 24 years old. She is married and has a small child who is two years old. Her husband went abroad in search of work. Umedai lives with her mother and sister. Two years ago, Umedai decided to start a new business in order to support her family. She began studying the profession of seamstress to earn money to improve the living conditions of the family. Umedai quickly mastered this activity. Her mother helps her in the work. Umedai is asking for a loan to buy the necessary materials and fabrics to sew women's clothes. She believes in you and expects support from your side.

loans.use: To purchase fabrics and materials for sewing

loans.name: Odette

texts.en:
Odette is a Mexican artisan who specializes in marble and onyx game sets. She would like to invest in a bulk purchase of stone, as well as new diamond cutting discs for her workshop.

Odette has been selling through NOVICA since 2000. This is her story:

"My father and I opened our workshop 30 years ago. Submerged in this artistic heritage, we began crafting parquet tables in onyx and marble. The art of sculpting marble and onyx demands patience and virtue, both of which have been cultivated over time in the family workshop."

"Thanks to you all for participating in making our dreams a reality and allowing us to share our art with the whole world."

Use the link below to view Odette's marble and onyx game sets on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/2344

loans.use: to invest in a bulk purchase of stone, as well as new diamond cutting discs for her workshop

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is an artisan from Ghana who specializes in wood carvings and jewelry. He would like to invest in a purchase of raw materials, including wood, fabric, leather, twine, and rattan.

Robert has been selling through NOVICA since 2006. This is his story:

"I am a self-taught artist. I never took any classes or attended courses. I use manual tools to carve my pieces from wood and then I paint them myself. I enjoy working alone, and my inspiration comes from nature. One of my favorite things in life is to explore nature and spending time with my wife and two daughters. One of my dreams for the near future is to become an art lecturer, even though I was never able to go to art class myself."

"I am very grateful to you all. The last microcredit I received helped me to create new designs. I believe that this loan will help elevate me to an even higher height."

Use the link below to view Robert's wood carvings and jewelry on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/5683

loans.use: to invest in a purchase of raw materials, including wood, fabric, leather, twine, and rattan

loans.name: Juan Evangelista

texts.es:
Juan desde hace 30 años se dedica a la producción agrícola y diariamente se levanta para trabajar y atender sus tierras en las cuales tiene cultivos principalmente de plátano.

Es una actividad aprendida de manera empírica y poco a poco ha ido perfeccionando sus técnicas y habilidades en este campo.

Adicionalmente genera ingresos alternos gracias a su trabajo como jornalero.
Hoy en día se siente orgulloso de lo que ha podido construir con su esfuerzo y se siente muy agradecido con la Corporación Interactuar y los prestamistas de Kiva por las oportunidades que le brindan de progresar.
El pide un préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de abonos, riegos y pesticidas, de este modo mantener sus tierras en optimas condiciones para los cultivos.

Su mayor sueño es tener una casa propia y allí poder disfrutar de su vejez al lado de su esposa.
texts.en:
For the past 30 years, Juan has worked in agriculture.  Every day he wakes up to work on his land where he grows plantain crops. 

He has learned his skill empirically and little by little has perfected his techniques and abilities in this field. 

Additionally he earns extra income as a day laborer. 

He is proud of what he has been able to build through his efforts and he is very appreciative of the " Corporación Interactuar" as well as the Kiva lenders for the opportunities he has been given to move ahead. 

He is requesting a loan to invest in purchasing fertilizer, irrigation tools and pesticides and in this way maintain his land in optimal conditions for his crops. 

His biggest dream is to have his own house and be able to enjoy his old age next to his wife.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, irrigation tools and pesticides.

loans.name: Almandina

texts.es:
No te dejes engañar de la cara seria de la señora Amaldina que por nervios quedo con ese rostro, ella es una sonriente mujer, muy trabajadora y luchadora, que no se explica como con su negocio de venta de alimentos los cuales ella misma realiza y sale a vender en el carro que se puede ver en la foto, levanto  a su extensa familia conformada por 6 hijos y lo más impresionante es que lo hizo como madre cabeza de familia. 
Amaldina es de esas personas que les preguntas que dificultad tiene y siempre te dirá que ninguna, pero ahora solicita un apoyo para comprar surtido de alimentos, ya que por una enfermedad paro un rato el negocio y necesita retomarlo.
texts.en:
Don't be misled by the serious look on Almadina's face; her facial expression is due to nervousness.  She is a smiling woman who is very hardworking and tenacious.  She tells us that with her business selling food from the cart seen in the photo, she has been able to raise her large family, which includes 6 children.  What is even more impressive is that she has done this on her own, as she is the head of the household.  

Almadina is one of those people who, when asked about the difficulties she has, will always say there are none.  But now she is requesting support to buy food to stock up her business, because due to an illness she stopped the business for a time, and now she needs to start it up again.

loans.use: to stock up on food for her business

loans.name: Azucena Del Carmen

texts.es: Azucena de 38 años de edad posee desde hace 10 años una pequeña tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia, tiene muchos clientes por los buenos precios y la amabilidad que tiene a la hora de vender, Azucena vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus dos hijos y está solicitando un crédito para poder comprar más sopas, huevos, granos básicos, refrescos, golosinas, pan dulce, etc. y así poder tener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: 38-year-old Azucena has had a convenience store in her home town for 10 years. She has a lot of customers because of her good prices and friendliness. Azucena lives in her own home with her husband and their two children. She is requesting a loan to be able to buy more soups, eggs, basic grains, soft drinks, sweet bread, etc. This will allow her to increase her income and have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more soups, eggs, basic grains, soft drinks, candy, sweet bread, etc.

loans.name: Junipher

texts.en:
Junipher manages a sari-sari (variety) store. He sells various goods like noodles, salt, cooking oil, eggs, toothpaste, detergents, soap and  beverages. He is a 39-year-old married man with four children from Mayorga, Leyte. His oldest child is 10 and the youngest is 1 year old. He also raises and sells hogs. In addition to that, he toils the land and grows rice.  But despite these sources of income, he encountered financial difficulty in financing his business.

He is asking for a loan to purchase a thresher (a device that first separates the head of a stalk of grain from the straw) and additional stock for the store.  These will help ease his work during harvest season of his farm. It could also fill his store with various stock. With these tools, slowly he could gain income and start to manage his finances.

He is determined to expand his resources to become more sustainable and to continue to support the needs of his growing children.

loans.use: to purchase a thresher (a device that first separates the head of a stalk of grain from the straw) and additional stock for the store

loans.name: Dario De Jesus

texts.es:
Con sus propias manos, el señor Darío está construyendo su sueño, un negocio de salón de belleza, un negocio que con el pasar del tiempo y la experiencia ha perfeccionado, pero siempre trabajando en peluquerías para otras personas, pero se siento capaz y desea construir su propia empresa.
Dario quiere solicitar un crédito para realizar las reformas locativas que necesita, como lo son compra de material para terminar de construir, pintura, lámparas, algunos activos y elementos de decoración para darle su toque de elegancia que necesita. 
Su propósito con la empresa es mejorar sus condiciones de vida y generar empleo.
texts.en:
With his own hands, Dario is building his dream; a beauty salon, a business that with the passing of time and experience he has perfected, but he has always worked in other people's hair salons, but he feels capable of and wants to build his own business.

Dario wants to request a loan to make the necessary renovations to the site, such as buying materials to finish the construction, paint, lamps, some assets and decorative items to give it the touch of elegance it needs.

His aim with the business is to improve his living living conditions and generate employment.

loans.use: to buy paint, lamps, decorative elements, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase sheep to fatten as well as ingredients to make soap

loans.name: Sabougnouma Group

texts.fr:
Soungalo est un homme âgé de 40 ans,  il quitta l’école en sixième année fondamentale.  Il réside dans une commune rurale  au Mali, il est marié et  père de neuf enfants dont cinq scolarisés.
Sa femme  est  ménagère  et tient une gargote à la foire hebdomadaire du village pour subvenir à ses petits besoins. 
Passionné d’embouche bovine, Soungalo exerce cette activité depuis cinq ans. Il souhaite augmenter son activité d’embouche ; Pour y parvenir il  fait recourt  au R.M.C. R. Son  prêt  sert à acheter les bœufs maigres pour les engraisser puis il  les vend. Il  s’approvisionne dans les marchés locaux et revend ces bœufs au grand marché à bétail de  Bamako la capitale. Sur quatre mois, Soungalo   pourra  avoir un  bénéfice de trente-cinq mille franc CFA par tête qui pourra lui permettre de faire face aux biens être de ces enfants (nourritures, l’habillement, frais scolaires et sanitaire).
L’engrais organique généré par  l’embouche augmentera  le rendement des champs de céréale de Soungalo ceux qui est source de motivation pour lui.
Les épidémies des animaux  est  un problème qu’il  rencontre souvent dans l’exercice de cette activité.
Il remercie le R.M.C.R pour le soutien financier et les conseils qui l’aident à faire mieux son activité.
texts.en:
Soungalo is a 40-year-old man who left school in the 6th year of elementary school. He lives in a rural area in Mali. He is married and the father of 9 children, 5 of whom are in school.

His wife keeps animals and also runs a small restaurant at the weekly market in the village in order to meet her financial needs. Soungané is passionate about raising cows, and has been doing so for 5 years. He wants to grow his livestock business. In order to do so, he contacted RMCR. His loan will allow him to purchase skinny cows in order to fatten them for sale. He purchases his stock at the local markets and resells his cows at the large livestock market in the capitol, Bamako. In 4 months, Soungalo can make 35,000 CFA francs per head of cattle, which will allow him to ensure his children's well-being (food, clothing, school fees). 

The organic fertilizer created by the cows will increase the productivity of Soungalo's cereal fields, which is another source of motivation for him. Contagious diseases affecting animals are often a problem for him in his business. 

He thanks RMCR for the financial support and asks that they help him to do even better in his business.

loans.use: to buy skinny cows to fatten and then sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy clothing to sell

loans.name: Sinignesiki Group

texts.fr: Sitan est une commerçante d’habits, mariée, mère de 5 enfants, ils sont tous  scolarisés, elle réside au Mali avec son mari qui es cultivateur. Sitan est âgée de 45 ans. Elle n’a pas eu la chance  d’aller à l’école (analphabète) .Elle vend des habits en gros  et en détail  elle exerce cette activité il y’a 10 ans de cela, elle s’approvisionne au marché public de son village  et revend aux différentes foires locales. Pour accroitre sa vente d’habits  elle emprunte au prés du RMCR de l’argent afin d’acheter beaucoup d’habits pour revendre. Ses bénéfices vont lui permettre de payer les fournitures scolaires,  les chaussures de ses enfants et de survenir aux bien être de sa famille  ensuite elle ambitionne aussi d’aménager une boutique pour les habits afin de rester stable.
texts.en: Sitan is a clothing seller. She is married and the mother of 5 children who are all in school. She lives in Mali with her husband, who is a farmer. Sitan is 45 years old. She didn't have the chance to attend school and can't read. She sells clothing wholesale and retail, and has had this business for the past 10 years. She purchases her stock at the public market in her village and resells at different local fairs. To grow her clothes selling business, she borrows money from RMCR in order to purchase lots of clothing to resell. Her profits will help her pay for school fees and shoes for her children, and the see to the well-being of her family. Later, she would like to set up a clothing store in order to stay in one place.

loans.use: to buy clothes to resell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy bags of flour to make bread to sell

loans.name: Eveline Del Pilar

texts.es:
Eveline del Pilar tiene 28 años de edad, es madre soltera, vive con su hijo en una zona rural en el distrito de Oyotún, ubicado en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte del Perú. La población se dedica al comercio, agricultura y ganadería como actividades económicas principales.

Ella se dedica a la venta de accesorios y ropa para damas, caballeros y niños, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su mismo domicilio. Cuenta con más de 5 años de experiencia en el negocio y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El presente crédito será utilizado para la compra de una mayor cantidad de ropa para aumentar el stock de su negocio, con esto Eveline del Pilar espera ofrecer una mayor variedad de ropa a sus clientes logrando de esta manera satisfacer sus gustos y preferencias, lo que se verá reflejado en un mayor nivel de ventas y le permitirá mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Eveline del Pilar is 28 years years old and a single mother.  She lives with her child in a rural area in the district of Oyotun, located in the province of Chiclayo, in the region of Lambayeque, on the north coast of Peru.

She works at selling accessories and clothing for women, men and children.  Her business is  located in her home.  She has more than 5 years of experience in this business and she has very good personal and work references from the area.

The loan will be used to buy a greater quantity of clothing in order to increase the stock of her business.  With this, Eveline del Pilar hopes to offer a greater variety of clothing to her customers, succeeding in this way to satisfy their tastes and preferences.  This will be reflected in a greater level of sales and will permit her to improve her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy a greater amount of clothing to increase the stock of her business

loans.name: Maria Cristina

texts.es:
María es una confeccionista de 48 años de edad, madre de dos hijos adolecentes y con un propósito de enviarlos a estudiar a la universidad y un sueño de mejorar las condiciones de vida de vivienda y de su familia. 
Ella como confeccionista a terceros le ha ido muy bien pero la rentabilidad de este negocio no es la esperada, ya que la mano de obra es muy barata y para hacer de esto tu vida necesitas trabajar hasta 15 horas diarias, para cubrir buen número de pedidos, pero ella para suplir ese bajo precio de mano de obra tiene una línea propia que por falta de capital no ha podido florecer.
María quiere solicitar un crédito para la compra de telas, hilos, accesorios, para incentivar y levantar su línea propia de ropa.
texts.en:
Maria is a dressmaker who is 48 years old.  She is the mother of 2 adolescents, and she has a goal to send them to study at the university.  She also dreams of improving her home and the living conditions of her family.

Maria makes garments for third parties, and this business has been doing very well.  However, the profitability of the business is not as she had hoped, because labor is very cheap and in order to earn a living this way she has to work up to 15 hours a day to cover a good number of orders.  However, in order to supplement this low wage, she has her own line of clothing.  It's only because she has lacked capital that this line of clothing has not flourished.

Maria is requesting a loan to buy fabric, thread, and accessories to boost and build up the part of her business that features her own line of clothing.

loans.use: to buy dressmaking supplies so that she can innovate with daring new styles of clothing

loans.name: Maria Eucebia

texts.es: Maria una joven emprendedora y muy luchadora agradece los diferentes apoyos financieros que ha recibido desde al año 2013 para poder dar asistencia y mantenimiento a sus cultivos de café. Estos han ayudado a crecer y fortalecer su tierra, cosecha, ingresos familiares y demás de una manera pacífica y sin preocupaciones. Su primer financiamiento lo utilizo para compra de insumos agrícolas que ayudaron a dar protección y mantenimiento a sus cultivos de café ya que para ese momento la roya se propagaba muy rápido entre los diferentes cultivos y dañando los de muchos productores a la vez. Su segundo financiamiento fue solicitado también para el mismo rubro de manera que este fue invertido en la asistencia ya que después del corte del grano las plantas quedaron deterioradas y maltratadas obteniendo al final de la cosecha 50 quintales de café los cuales vendió a muy buen precio en el mercado a pesar de la baja del mismo. En esta ocasión solicita nuevamente pueda ser apoyada por los diferentes inversionistas en la plataforma de KIVA para poder comprar los insumos necesarios para poder asistir nuevamente la propiedad la cual esta cultivada y en proceso de producción en esta nueva temporada.
texts.en: Maria, an entrepreneurial and determined young woman, thanks the financial support she has received since 2013, which allowed her to maintain her coffee crops. This support has helped strengthen and grow her land, harvests and family income in a peaceful and worry-free manner. She used her first loan to buy agricultural supplies that helped protect her coffee crops, as at that time rust was spreading rapidly in the area, damaging many producers. She used her second loan for the same purpose, as after picking the coffee beans, the plants remained deteriorated. At the end of that harvest, she obtained 50 quintals of coffee, which she sold at a very good price in the market in spite of decreasing prices. She is currently requesting a new loan from Kiva lenders to be able to purchase the supplies necessary to maintain her crops.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies for her coffee crops and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Nigora

texts.en: Nigora is 32 years old. She lives with her husband and sons in Dushanbe City, Tajikistan. Her mother also lives with them. After graduating from secondary school, Nigora started to sew with the help of her friend. She likes her work because it gives her good income. To expand her activity, Nigora wants to buy the necessary supplies for sewing, such as fabric and thread. Her main problem is lack of money. She asks for your support through this loan.

loans.use: to buy supplies for sewing.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
The lady in the photo is Joyce, 39 years old, married and has six children who attend school. Joyce does maize farming and also operates a grocery kiosk selling kale, onions and tomatoes. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa to learn more about enterprise development, record keeping and financial management.

She is borrowing a loan to help boost her farming by buying certified seeds and add stock to her grocery thus improve her income to a higher level. She plans to use the anticipated income to cater for her family's needs, such as food.

Joyce is grateful to Kiva for their help and support.

loans.use: To buy seeds that will boost crop yield and also pay for more stock of vegetables such as tomatoes, onions and kale.

loans.name: Milkah

texts.en:
The person in the photo is Milkah, 47 years old, married and living with her husband and her three children. She is a mixed farmer who farms potatoes, maize and beans and also works in a pharmacy. She has applied for a loan to buy certified seeds and fertilizer so that she can improve her crop yield. She hopes that her income will increase thus help improve her family living standards such as medical care and also provide quality education for her children.
Milkah is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the help and support.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer that will help improve her crop yield.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
The person in the photo is Alice, 35 years old, married and living with her husband and her two children. She is a business person selling charcoal, clothes and also does poultry farming. She has applied for a loan to add more stock to her charcoal and clothes selling businesses so that she can meet her customers' rising demand hence more income from improved sales. She hopes this will enable her to cater to her family's needs with ease.
Alice is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for their help and support.

loans.use: To buy more stock of charcoal and clothes to meet customers' rising demands.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is engaged in a hog raising business for eight years. She has also been cultivating her one hectare of rice field for three years. Grace is married and blessed with four children. Two are still studying and the other two are still infants. She aims to have a better way of living and increase her income. To make her goal realistic, she is asking for a loan of PHP4,000 which will be use to purchase hog feed and vitamins needed to improve the growth of her hogs. Grace is hoping to obtain the said amount of loan to keep her hog raising business profitable.

loans.use: to buy hog feed and vitamins needed for her hog raising business.

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en: Vincent is married and the father of one child. He describes himself as hardworking and operates a shop where he services electronic equipment. He has been involved in this business for 8 years and works in a busy area so his customers are both commercial and private. He describes his biggest business challenge as insufficient funds and has requested a loan for Kes 40,000 to buy spare parts for servicing electronics. His goal is to open more business outlets within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will have a better life. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank; he repaid the previous one successfully.

loans.use: buy spare parts for servicing electronics.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy and build a bathroom, septic tank, and closet at her home to improve access to water and sanitation for her family

loans.name: Than's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural area in Kampong Thom province, Than is 54 years old and a father of six dependent children. He earns an income to support his family by rice farming and cassava growing. He earns additional income by selling grocery items. He has been involved with these businesses for ages and they earn him about 7,700 KHR per day. 

For Than, this is his second cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and he has fully repaid his past loan. In a group of fourteen members, he is the group leader. He will spend his entire loan portion to build a decent latrine. He hopes that with this new latrine, he can improve his families health.

loans.use: To build a decent latrine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy and build a bathroom, water reservoir and closet at her home to improve access to water and sanitation for her family.

loans.name: Ann

texts.en: Ann is married and the mother of six children. She describes herself as hardworking and operates a retail business where she sells charcoal. She has been involved in this business for 13 years and works in a busy area with many regular customers. She describes her biggest business challenge as insufficient funds, and has requested a Kes 50,000 loan to buy more charcoal to sell. Her business goal is to be a supplier within five years and to improve her family's standard of living. Ann is requesting her third loan from SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loans were repaid successfully. She will use the profits she earns to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: buy more charcoal.

loans.name: Mfano Group

texts.en:
Raphael is 56 years old, married and has five children who are at school. He has been running a local restaurant known as babalishe serving chips, rice, ugali and cooked banana with meat, vegetables etc. He has been in this business for 10 good years, working from 6am to midnight daily. He is able to make a good profit per day. 

He is now requesting his sixth credit from Tujijenge Tanzania. He has paid back all of his previous credits successfully. Raphael normally uses his credits to improve his service; making sure his stock of cooking items is full (bought cooking oil, rice,beans, maize, baking flour and cooking stoves together with charcoal). He used the extra income as a father to cover school fees for his kids and family expenses. In the coming years, he would like to build a nice family house for his family.

Generally, his business has grown more after Kiva's loan support. He is so thankful to everyone who has shown and keep showing support to his group. 

With this new request, he will buy food cooking ingredients for his babalishe. Raphael will share this loan with his group Mfano, which consists of three members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy food cooking ingredients for his babalishe.

loans.name: Boniface

texts.en: Boniface is a married man. He has two children, ages three years and five years old. He describes himself to be hardworking. He operates a transport business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are regular. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. He will use the Kes 80,000 loan to buy another motorcycle. His business goal is to have a transport company within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will have better living standards. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: buy another motorcycle.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en: Daniel is a married man. He has six children. He describes himself to be optimistic. He operates a welding business where he makes metallic doors, windows and other items. He has been involved in this business for four years. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are the general public. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of metal bars, sheets and other welding materials. His business goal is to have a bigger workshop within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will have a good quality of life and improved profits. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: buy more stock of metal bars, sheets and other welding materials.

loans.name: Edilberto Segundo

texts.es:
Edilberto es un campesino, humilde y trabajador con el empuje y verraquera que distingue a los hombres y mujeres del campo.
Es un Hombre de mente emprendedora y desde muy pequeño aprendió todos los oficios del campo como cultivos y crianza de animales, tanto así que hoy en día tiene su propio cultivo de platanos; alimentos que vende en la plaza de mercado del municipio de Valencia.
Este personaje tiene como propósito aumentar sus cultivos y mejorar los que actualmente tiene y es por eso que acude a la ayuda de un crédito con la Corporación Interactuar para la compra de insumos agropecuarios como fertilizantes, abonos y la compra de semillas de Platano.
El préstamo le dará la oportunidad de progresar como empresario y como persona, además de aumentar sus ingresos y seguir aportando el sustento en su hogar.
Él lo único que quiere es poder mejorar la calidad de vida de él y su familia.
texts.en:
Edilberto is a farmer, humble and hard-working; with the spirit and determination that distinguishes countrymen and women.

He is a man with an enterprising mind, who learned all the farming skills such as planting and animal-raising, at a young age—so much so, that today he has his own plantain crop, and foods that he sells in the municipal market of Valencia.  

His goal is to increase his crops and improve those that he currently has; and that is why he is looking to Interactuar for help in the form of a loan.  It is for the purchase of farming supplies such as fertilizer and compost, and plantain seeds. The loan will give him the opportunity to progress as an entrepreneur and as a person, and to increase his income and continue providing for his home.

The only thing he wants is to be able to improve the quality of life for himself and for his family.

loans.use: to purchase farming supplies such as fertilizer and compost, and banana seeds.

loans.name: Twiga Grp Msm Group

texts.en:
Monica is in her mid 40's and is married with five children who are still in school. She has been running a business of selling small, dried fish for ten years. She works from 7 am to 6 pm daily and is able to make a small monthly profit. This will be Monica's 4th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania (Kiva's partner). She used the previous loans to keep increasing her dried fish stock and has paid back all her loans successfully. She saved some of her profit in a bank account and used the other part to pay school fees and household expenses. She will use this loan to increase her supply of dried fish to sell.
Monica will share this loan with her loan group, Twiga Grp Msm, which consists of two members who hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase her supply of dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Desilito

texts.en: Desilito is a hardworking father who is raising his family in a rural community. He is 49 years old, married and has four grown-up children. He cultivates their farmland by planting onions and rice to sell. Due to the hardship of living, he aspires to expand his onion plantation in order to have a high production. Having inadequate capital, he would like to avail an additional PHP 18,000 to buy fertilizer and pesticides and pay the labor cost incurred in planting onions. Being a patient and industrious father, he believes that he will be having a plentiful harvest and gain a higher income to sustain the necessities of his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides and pay the labor cost incurred in planting onions

location.town: Brgy. Bone South, Aritao, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Emily

texts.en: Emily is a single woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be determined. She operates a retail shop where she sells sugar, drinks, cooking fat, flour and other items. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stocks of sugar, salt, flour, cooking fat and other items. Her business goal is to be prosperous within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: buy more stocks of sugar, salt, flour, cooking fat and other items.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily runs and operates a sari-sari (variety) store, selling various commodities like canned goods, noodles, soap, soft drinks, condiments and toiletries. She is a 49-year-old married woman with four children. Three of her children are still attending school. Aside from that, she also engages in the fish vending business.

She is asking for a loan to buy additional stocks for the store like canned goods, toiletries and beverages. These will fill her store full of stocks. It could attract more consumers. Slowly, her earnings will improve and start to balance her finances.

In the future, she would like to expand her sources of income to become more sustainable and continue to support the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks for the store like canned goods, toiletries and beverages.

loans.name: David

texts.en: David is a married man and has six children. He describes himself to be determined. He operates a construction business where he builds houses. He has been involved in this business for two years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are of all types. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. He will use the Kes 95,000 loan to buy paint, brushes and other masonry materials. His business goal is to be prosperous within five years. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy paint, brushes and other masonry materials.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is 58 years old, married, and has one child. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Norma has a tailoring business in the Philippines. She requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional materials like fabric, thread, zippers, etc. for her business.

Norma has been in this business for 15 years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials like fabric, thread, zippers, etc.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be capable. She operates a retail business where she sells spare parts. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. She will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy more stocks of motor vehicle spare parts, oil, etc. Her business goal is to expand within five years. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stocks of motor vehicle spare parts, oil, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy and build a water source at her home to improve access to water and sanitation for her family

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of fruits, vegetables and snack ingredients needed for her business.

loans.name: Senaida

texts.en:
Senaida is thankful that she was granted a 20,000 PHP loan, which she used to purchase various grocery items and products needed in her general store. She is glad that through her earnings she is able to send her children to school and meet their daily living expenses. 

She would now like to apply for a 25,000 PHP loan, which she will use as part of her working capital to buy large quantities of grocery items like rice, coffee, soda, rice noodles, frozen foods, etc. which she sells at retail. She knows that more items in her store will yield more sales and thus increase her earnings. Her income from her store is a stable source to sustain her family's basic needs and for the education of her children. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her. 

Senaida dreams of having a bigger general store and aims to give her children the best education possible for them to have a better future. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which she studies.

 *All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital  and repay Micro-Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages for her business.

loans.name: Yuris Adriany

texts.es:
Yuris hoy cumple su sueño, un objetivo que ha perseguido por algún tiempo, y que no ha podido realizar por no tener capital y no encontrar hasta el momento una entidad que la apoyara, hasta que llegó interactuar y juntos trabajan para convertir un terreno de Yuris con un pequeño capital en una cría y venta de aves, en la foto se ve el progreso. 
Yuris pide un apoyo para completar su sueño, e iniciar su vida para mejorar su hogar que lo conforman 4 hijos todos ellos menores de edad.
texts.en:
Yuris has now achieved her dream, a goal she has pursued for some time, and she hasn't been able to reach it due to a lack of funds, and up until now she hadn't found an organisation that would support her until Interactuar came on the scene and together they will work to convert a plot of land that Yuris has with a little capital into a poultry breeding and sales, the photo shows the progress.

Yuris is asking for support to reach her dream and start a better life to improve her household which consists of 4 children, all young.

loans.use: start a poultry business, build a coup and stock it with chickens.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a 25-year-old father of two, who lives in the Nkubu area, which is located in the central province of Kenya. He has farmed for five years and earns an honest and decent income. Peter has both crops and a dairy farm and has a small business to make ends meet. Although he has been making profits, life has not been easy for Peter. However, he has managed to overcome every challenge he faces. 

Peter seeks a loan via Juhudi Kilimo to venture into horticulture farming. His location is favorable to other types of farming, due to the good road network, climate, and market demand. Peter and his family will work very hard to take good care of their investment in horticulture, in which they put their hopes for a better life. Peter is disciplined regarding finances and he plans to enter international markets to earn more income and obtain a stable future for his family. Improve this Kenyan man's life with a loan!

loans.use: to venture into horticulture farming.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is single and has a business raising chickens in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feed, vitamins, and other supplies for her chickens.

Rosemarie has been in this business for five years now. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feed, vitamins, and other supplies for her chickens.

loans.name: Juanito

texts.en: Juanito is a farmer who is raising his family in a rural community. He is 50 years old, married, and has only one child.  He plants and harvests onions and rice, which he sells in the local community. He aimed to plant more onions and rice, but he doesn't have enough capital. For this reason, he wants to access financial assistance amounting to PHP 25,000 to pay for labor costs, pesticides, and fertilizers needed in onion production. Through this financial assistance, he believes that he will improve his farming business and increase his income.

loans.use: to pay for labor costs, pesticides, and fertilizers needed in onion production.

location.town: Brgy. Bone South, Aritao, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
As a married parent of eight children, Rosita works hard to support her family. She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Rosita is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients like meat, fish, vegetables, spices, etc. for her food vending business.

Rosita has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like meat, fish, vegetables, spices, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Welma

texts.en:
Welma is 57 years old and married with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She has an abaca weaving business in the Philippines. Welma has requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional raw materials for her business.

She has been in this business for 25 years. Welma would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional raw materials for her business.

loans.name: Marcela Maria

texts.es:
Ella es marcela una joven llena de entusiasmo, alegría un poco de susto porque a sus 21 años de edad se le está cumpliendo su sueño de montar un almacén, como se puede apreciar a las fotos, esta hermosa joven está haciendo todo lo posible por consolidar su negocio, ahorros, ayuda de su pareja, de interactuar, todos juntos cooperando para montar su almacén.
Pero ahora necesita de tu ayuda, ella sabe que aún le falta pues apenas iniciar con tu aporte Marcela podrá comprar el surtido de ropa que le falta, accesorios y así arrancar pronto su negocio.
No dejes sola a marcela, y colaborare para que pueda tener una empresa para generar el capital suficiente para darle el sustento a su pequeño hijo.
texts.en:
This is Marcela, a young woman full of enthusiasm and joy, and a bit frightened because, at 21 years of age, she is about to fulfill her dream by opening a shop. As you can appreciate from the photograph, this beautiful young woman is making everything possible by organizing her business, using her savings and the help of her life partner, all working together to open her store.

But now she needs your help. Marcela knows what she still lacks if she is to begin forging ahead. She needs to be able to purchase a selection of clothing and accessories quickly to start her store.

Don't leave it up to Marcela alone. Collaborate with her so that she can launch an enterprise and generate sufficient capital to enable her to provide for her little son.

loans.use: buy the selection of clothing and accessories that she needs to open her store.

loans.name: Khouch

texts.en: Khouch, 38, is a farmer from Kampong Cham province and a mother of three children. To support her family, she grows rice as a single source of income. She earns additional income as a wedding photographer. This is the first loan for Khouch with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She will use the loan to buy a camera to support her business. She hopes that she can earn more income to improve her family’s situation and live in a better condition than before.

loans.use: to buy a camera to support her business.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a water source with electric pump at her home to improve access to water and improve sanitation for their family.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy and build a bathroom, septic tank, and closet at her home to improve access to water and provide sanitation for her family.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is 31 years old, married and has two children. He is raising his family in a rural community and makes a living through farming. He also operates a motorcycle transport business to earn additional income. He aims to improve the living conditions of his family and give his children a better life. To continuously operate his motorcycle, he needs to obtain a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy gasoline, spare parts and accessories needed for the maintenance of his motorcycle. Having this financial assistance, John believes that he will be able to operate his motorcycle and earn a higher income.

loans.use: to buy gasoline, spare parts and accessories needed for the maintenance of his motorcycle.

loans.name: Marta Gladis

texts.es: Marta de 55 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo, ella posee una tienda desde hace varios años ubicada en su lugar de residencia, vende una variedad de productos como golosinas, refrescos, granos básicos, café, sopas, huevos, gelatinas, azúcar, etc. y tiene muchos clientes por los buenos precios, Marta está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas mercadería por mayor ya que esa es su única fuente de ingresos y así podrá tener mejores ganancias para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
