Marta is 55 years old, she lives in her own home with her husband. She has had a shop for many years, located in her place of residence, she sells a variety of products such as candies, drinks, staple grains, coffee, soups, eggs, jellies, sugar, etc. and she has many customers because of her good prices. 

Marta is requesting a loan to purchase more wholesale merchandise, as this is her only source of income and so she will be able to have better earnings to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy candies, drinks, staple grains, coffee, soups, eggs, jellies, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Wendmangda 03 Sapone Group

texts.fr:
Monsieur CASSIMIR est le représentant du groupe WENDMANGDA 03 SAPONE. Marié, il est  père de 04enfants. Le plus âgé à 15 ans et le moins âgé a 02 ans. 02 vont à l’école. Il a 07 personnes en charge.
Monsieur fait l'élevage depuis plus de 20 ans. Il s’approvisionne dans les villages environnants. 
Il veut s’acheter  05moutons et 10poulets.
Monsieur veut utiliser ses bénéfices pour renforcer son activité. Il ambitionne assurer la scolarité des enfants.
texts.en:
Casimir is the representative of the group WENDMANGDA 03 SAPONE. He is married and the father of four children. The oldest is 15 years old and the youngest is two years old. Two of them are in school. He has seven dependents. 

He has been farming for over 20 years. He buys his supply from the surrounding villages. He wants to buy five sheep and 10 chickens. Casimir aims to ensure this children's education. He hopes to use his earnings in order to support his business.

loans.use: to buy five sheep and 10 chickens.

loans.name: Sanene Group

texts.en:
Ally is 34 years old and divorced but taking care of his one schooling child. He manages his family by running a boda boda service, transporting passengers around the town. He has done this service for his life since he found it difficult to find a nice job with his education level. He now has more customers and is able to raise a good profit each day. Ally starts working early in the morning and closes at midnight. 

To improve his service and be confident all the time with his motor, he has approached Tujijenge Tanzania as his area institution to request financial support. He wants to pay for motor maintenance expenses and buy new spares for his motorcycle. In the coming years, Ally would like to be very successful in his family and for his kid to be well educated. This is his first credit request.

He will share this credit with his group, Sanane, consisting of three people. The group members will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to pay for motor maintenance expenses and buy new spares for his motorcycle.

loans.name: Caricias Del Sol Group

texts.es: María de 50 años de edad es separada con 03 hijos dependientes. Este es el grupo “Caricias Del Sol” conformado por 05 socios comprometidos y responsables. María se dedica al  servicio de limpieza público. Gracias a su esfuerzo ha logrado comprar su propia vivienda. Su mayor deseo es poner su tienda de abarrotes. Su último crédito los destinará para gasto familiar y estudios vacacionales de su hija. El grupo “Caricias Del Sol” agradecen a las personas que hicieron posible este crédito. María es la primera del lado derecho viste polo rosado.
texts.en: María, 50 years old, is separated and has three children who depend on her. This is the group “Caricias Del Sol” (Caresses Of The Sun), formed by five committed and responsible members. María works in public cleaning. Thanks to her effort she has been able to buy her own home. Her greatest desire is to establish her grocery store. Her latest loan will be used for family expenses and her daughter’s vocational studies. The group “Caricias Del Sol” appreciates the people who made this loan possible. María is the first from the right side dressed in a pink shirt.

loans.use: to pay family expenses and pay for her daughter’s vocational studies.

loans.name: Liney Cecilia

texts.es:
Ella es Liney una mujer de 34 años de edad que guiada y motivada por un amigo quiere iniciar u propio negocio de cría y venta de peces, pues no tiene empleo y su amigo le ha hablado y demostrado los beneficios que tiene ser emprendedor, pero para iniciar un negocio que es un tema muy delicado necesita capital que no tiene y por ello quiere recurrir a interactuar para que juntos puedan construir una empresa y disminuir grano a grano el desempleo.
Con el crédito construirá un pozo, comprara peces, y su respectivo alimento.
texts.en:
Liney is a 34 year old woman, she is guided and motivated by a friend who who wants to start their own business breeding and selling fish, as she doesn't have a job and her friend has talked to her about it and demonstrated the benefits of being an entrepreneur, but to start a business which is a very sensitive issue, she needs capital which she doesn't have and so she wants to turn to Interactuar so that they can build a business together and bit by bit get out of unemployment.

With the loan, they will build a tank, buy fish and feed for them.

loans.use: to purchase a well, buy fish and fish feed.

loans.name: Fedelita

texts.en:
Fedelita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Fedelita requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients like noodles, spices, vegetables, meat, etc. for her food production business.

Fedelita has been in this business for two years now.

In the future, Fedelita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like noodles, spices, vegetables, and meat for her food production business

loans.name: Javier

texts.es:
A sus 56 años de edad encontrar trabajo para el señor Javier se ha convertido en todo un dolor de cabeza , por ende gracias a las enseñanzas que su padre le dio a lo largo de su vida quiere iniciar su negocio de venta de pescado, para lo que necesita gran apoyo pues es un hombre humilde pero que mantiene un hogar, su idea es trabajar todos los días y cubrir buen terreno para lo que necesita un medio de transporte que sería un motocicleta, comprara una cava y surtido de pescado.
Él solicita tu apoyo, con tu aporte ayudarías a reducir el desempleo y a una familia a tener un negocio para ser autosuficiente y no tener que pedir limosnas a otros.
texts.en:
At 56, finding work has become a real headache for Señor Javier.  Therefore, thanks to the lessons his father taught him throughout his life, he wants to start his fish sales business--for which he will need support, as he is a man who is humble, but a household provider.  

His idea is to work every day and cover a large territory, for which he needs transportation such as a motorcycle; and he will buy a cooler and a supply of fish. 

He is requesting your support, as your contribution would help to reduce unemployment, and help a family to have a business, so that they can be self-sufficient and not have to ask for charity from others.

loans.use: to buy a cooler and a supply of fish.

loans.name: Maria Estebana

texts.es: Maria de 56 años de edad vive en casa propia con hija quien trabaja y le ayuda económicamente, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa su negocio lo tiene ubicado en el mercado municipal desde hace 2 años, tiene muchos clientes fijos por la calidad de la ropa y los buenos precios, ella está solicitando un crédito para la comprar de mas ropa por mayor para poder continuar con sus ventas y así poder tener mejore ingresos.
texts.en:
Maria is 56 years old and lives in her own home with her daughter, who works and helps her financially. She sells clothes and her business is located at the municipal market. Maria has been in business for two years and she has many established customers because of the quality of the clothes and the good prices.

She is requesting a loan in order to buy more clothes in bulk so that she can continue her sales and have more income.

loans.use: to buy more clothes in bulk.

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en: Thomas is a married man. He has three children with ages ranging from 3 to 13 years old. He describes himself to be optimistic. He operates a retail business where he sells tires. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are both commercial and private. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. He will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy more stock of tires. His business goal is to open more business outlets within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will have a better life. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of tires

loans.name: Brenda Yosselin

texts.es:
Brenda, de 22 años de edad, estudió hasta cuarto grado, esta casada, su esposo es albañil, tiene una niña de 2 años de edad, aun no asiste a la escuela, ellos viven con los padres del esposo de Brenda.

Brenda, es empleada, trabaja en un comedor haciendo comida, pupusas etc. Tiene un año de estar trabajando, su buen desempeño, responsabilidad y honradez le han permitido, que se gane la confianza de su jefa. En la casa su madrastra, le enseño todo respecto a cocinar y eso le está ayudando a salir adelante con su familia. El lugar donde trabaja está a 1,000 metros, el recorrido lo realiza a pie y el horario de trabajo es de 5:30 de la mañana a 4:00 de la tarde.


El préstamo será invertido para comprar lamina, ladrillo, madrera para el techo, para pagar la mano de obra y comprar puertas. Todo esto para construir una pequeña vivienda, para que puedan tener privacidad, ya que actualmente viven en la misma casa con los suegros. Con esta ayuda ella y su familia podrán tener su propio espacio donde descansar. 

Su sueño es continuar trabajando, para poder darle el sustento a su hija y darle lo que ella no tuvo en la infancia.
texts.en:
Brenda, 22 years old, studied until fourth grade. She is married and has a 2-year-old daughter who doesn't go to school yet. Her husband works in construction. They live with Brenda's husband's parents.
 
Brenda is employed at a diner making meals, pupusas, etc. She has been working there for a year. Her good work ethic, responsible nature and honesty have allowed her to win over the trust of her boss. Her mother-in-law has taught her everything to do with cooking and this is helping her get ahead, along with her family. The place where she works is a kilometer from her house and she walks to work. Her hours are 5:30 a.m. to 4:00 p.m. 

The loan will be invested to buy laminated tin, bricks, wood for the roof, to pay for labor and to buy doors. All this build a small home so they can have privacy, because they currently live in the same house as her in-laws. With this help, she and her family will have their own space where they can relax. 

Her dream is to continue working so she can bring up her daughter and give her what she never had as a child.

loans.use: to buy laminated tin, bricks, wood for the roof, to pay for the labor and to buy doors.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en: Nida is a responsible housewife who supports her husband in gaining income. They help each other in planting and harvesting rice and vegetables for sale. They aim to improve their farming business and increase their income in order to sustain their necessities and finance the education of their youngest child. They want to expand their onion plantation, but they have limited capital. For this reason, Nida wants to avail an additional PHP 10,000 to buy fertilizer and pesticides and pay labor costs incurred in planting onions. They believe that this financial assistance will be a great help to them to improve their farming business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides and pay labor costs incurred in planting onions

location.town: Brgy. Bone South, Aritao, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Gulhumor

texts.en:
Gulhumor is a 43-year old resident of Rudaki district. She is married and the mother of three children. Her sons are 21 and 17 years old, and her daughter is 23 years old. Her husband and eldest son are earning in the Russian Federation, and the youngest son is in high school. The daughter is doing a sewing business.

Gulhumor has spent 10 years of her life engaged in sheep breeding in her yard. She is a responsible and hardworking woman. Gulhumor is taking a loan to buy a few sheep and rams. She buys them from other rural area, fattens them for several months in her barnyard, and then exports them to the local market to sell at a profitable price. With this loan, Gulhumor can increase her head of sheep and increase the profit from her business. Gulhumor hopes for your sympathy and kindness.

loans.use: To purchase a few sheep and rams

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida is 49 years old and single.  

She is in the agricultural business, buying and selling chickens in the Philippines. Nida requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional chickens to sell.

Nida has been buying and selling chickens for six years now, and has borrowed one time in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Nida would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional chickens to sell

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Meet Alice, a smallholder farmer with extremely humble beginnings. She is based in Tinga village in the Nyamira region of Kenya. Her upbringing was difficult. She never managed to finish her primary education, but she is very determined to give the best life to her children. Fifteen years ago, Alice started farming on her husband's two-acre farm. She did it mostly for subsistence until recently. She now keeps a dairy cow that gives her 10 litres of milk to sell every day. She also grows vegetables that she uses to prepare food and to sell. Alice is seeking a loan to buy rabbits and start rabbit farming .The advantage of this type of farming is that rabbits grow fast especially if fed well, reaching maturity at 5 months and slaughter weight at 3 months. They also require less land (space) with diminishing land size; Therefore, they can be kept in the backyard. This investment will not only double the income that Alice is making from rabbit meat selling, but will also mitigate risks associated with having just one business. The additional income will enable her to comfortably handle her family's food and education costs, which happen to be her highest expenses. Please consider providing a loan to Alice to help her improve her economic activity. Support this mother who does the impossible to support her children.

loans.use: To start rabbit farming

loans.name: Miguel Enrique

texts.es:
Miguel siempre se ha distinguido por ser un hombre muy creativo y responsable que sale a rebuscarse el sustento de su familia,  conformada por tres hijos y su señora, lo difícil es que vive en una zona donde escasea el empleo y ahora que Interactuar llegó hasta esos rincones quieren sacar el máximo provecho del excelente proyecto que trae para ellos, confiando y brindándoles la mano cuando más lo necesitan.
Miguel quiere solicitar un crédito para la compra de cerdos, adecuar un corral e iniciar formalmente un negocio en el que espera tener buenos resultados para poder darles a sus hijos una excelente educación.
texts.en:
Miguel has always distinguished himself as a very creative and responsible man who searches high and low for ways to support his family, which is composed of his wife and three children. 

The difficult thing is that he lives in an area where jobs are scarce; and now that Interactuar has come to this corner of the world, he wants to make the most of its excellent program, which is bringing trust and lending a hand when it is needed most.

Miguel wants to request a loan to purchase pigs, to set up a pen, and formally open a business.  He hopes to have good results with it, so that he can provide his children with an excellent education.

loans.use: to purchase pigs, set up a pen, and formally start a business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy and build a water source with satellite at their home to improve the family's access to water and sanitation

loans.name: Gulrakat

texts.en: This 46-year-old seamstress is named Gulrakat. She lives in Rudaki district with her family. She is married and has two children. Her daughter and son are 21 and 9 years old. Gulrakat works as a nurse in a rural hospital. In her free time, she is engaged in sewing women's clothes. Gulrakat is a hardworking woman who has been engaged in a sewing business for more than eight years. Gulrakat is taking a loan to purchase a sewing machine and fabric to continue sewing and not lose her source of income. This loan will help her maintain a daily income from her activity. Gulrakat hopes for your help.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine and fabric to continue sewing

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is thankful that she was granted a 20,000 PHP loan, which she used to purchase various grocery items and products needed in her general store. She is glad that through her earnings she is able to meet her daily living expenses. 

She would now like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan, which she will use to buy large quantities of grocery items like rice, coffee, soda, rice noodles, and frozen foods, which she sells at retail. She knows that more items in her store will yield more sales and thus increase her earnings. Her income from her store is a stable source to sustain her family's basic needs and educate her children. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given to her. 

Delia dreams of having a bigger general store and living a more prosperous life in her old age. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which she studies.

 *All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Rodel

texts.en:
Rodel owns and manufactures hollow blocks. It is a concrete block also referred to as a foundation block. This is one of the materials highly used for a wide range of construction industries.  He is a 39-year-old married man with five kids from Dulag, Leyte. His oldest child is 15 and the youngest is 9 months old. He has been engaged in making hollow blocks for almost seven years.

He is asking for a loan to purchase sand, cement and other materials. These will produce more hollow blocks to sell, and cater to the needs of his customers. With these, he can now earn more and start to handle his finances.

In the future, he would expand his business for the welfare of his growing children and to become more sustainable as well.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and other materials

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en: Due to capital insufficiency, Rosemarie wants to access financial assistance of PHP 10,000 from Kiva lenders to improve her small retail store. She intends to use her loan to buy more stocks of soft drinks, bread, canned goods, noodles, beverages, seasonings and laundry soaps to resell in the local community. She hopes that she will avail her requested amount to improve her business and help her husband in financing the education of her three children and satisfy their daily necessities.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of soft drinks, bread, canned goods, noodles, beverages, seasonings and laundry soaps to resell

loans.name: Parvina

texts.en: Parvina is 32 years old. She is a very humble, good and generous woman. She has two children. Parvina sells vegetables in the market. She has been engaged in this work for two years. The purpose of getting a loan is that Parvina wants to expand her activity and develop the economic situation of her family. Currently, she does not have enough money to buy vegetables. She needs your help.

loans.use: to buy vegetables

loans.name: Samwel's Group

texts.en:
Samwel, pictured above, has been a farmer for more than 40 years, and is now proud to represent his group of eight farmers in Webuye District. He is 60 years old, married and has 12 children.

Samwel likes to think of himself as a very reliable person. He has been working alongside One Acre Fund since 2012 and decided to represent his group because he wanted to be more active in his community. He says that being part of the One Acre Fund community has meant that he has been able to consistently feed his family. Samwel plans to use the profits from this coming season to send his children to school.

In total, Samwel’s Group will receive inputs to cultivate 4.5 acres of land. Given that some members of the group will also be purchasing a solar light, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of six solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve his harvest of maize

loans.name: Rica

texts.en:
Rica is thankful that she was granted a PHP 10,000 loan, which she used to buy ingredients needed in her food stall business. She is glad that through her earnings, she is able to support her family and meet their daily basic needs.

She would like now to apply for PHP 12,000, which she will use to buy oil, bananas, sugar and other items needed to cook banana-cue, a favorite snack of Filipinos. She is encouraged by the good turnout of her snack business, since it greatly helps to sustain the needs of her family. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given to her. 

Rica dreams that all her hard work will bear fruit to give her family a better future. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for raw ingredients such as sugar, bananas, and other products needed in her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy organic fertilizers

loans.name: Sreymom

texts.en:
Sreymom, 21, lives in the community of Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has one little child. To make a living, she has been involved in the farming business since 2010.  She grows cassava and sells her agricultural products to the local dealers and customers in the market. On average, she is able to generate a net profit of USD $5.00 a day.

In this farming season, she is lacking the money to buy farm supplies for her cassava farm. To continue her farming, she is borrowing some money from KIVA to buy farm supplies like fertilizers, seeds and insecticides.  

She is thankful to the lenders for their financial support. She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies like fertilizers, seeds and insecticides.

loans.name: Elecita

texts.en:
Elecita is 49 years old and married with three children, who are in school. Elecita works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a loan of 7,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell, like sardines, noodles, soap, etc. Elecita has been in this business for 3 years.

In the future, Elecita would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell, like sardines, noodles, soap, etc.

loans.name: Samwel's Group

texts.en:
Samwel is 69 years old and has 11 children. He is a group leader, representing a group of 11 farmers in Webuye District, Kenya. 

Samwel has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2010. This decision was largely a result of his desire to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods and, although he described his last harvest as good, he believes he could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. 

Samwel has decided to purchase two solar lights as part of his loan, which he is very excited about, as it will allow him to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money.

Obtaining this loan means that Samwel's Group will be able to receive a total of 11 solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 7.5 acres.

loans.use: to purchase two solar lights and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertiliser to grow corn.

loans.name: Elna

texts.en:
Elna is a widow and works hard to support her family. She has a buy-and-sell used clothing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of shirts, shorts, and other clothing to sell.

Elna has been in this business for 25 years now. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure her family's financial stability.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of shirts, shorts, and other clothing to sell.

loans.name: Philomena

texts.en:
Philomena is in her early 40s. She is married with two children who are still going to school. She has been selling clothes for five years now. She works from 6.30am to 8pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.  

This will be Philomena's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She will use this loan to buy up-to-date clothes to meet her customers' requirements. She dreams of owning a wholesale shop for selling clothes.

Philomena will make sure she pays back her loan according to the repayment schedule.

loans.use: to buy up-to-date clothes to meet her customers' requirements.

loans.name: Everlita

texts.en:
Everlita is 41 years old and married with three children who are in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock like biscuits, coffee and milk to sell. Everlita has been in this business for four years.

In the future Everlita would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock like biscuits, coffee and milk to sell.

loans.name: Geraldine

texts.en:
Geraldine is 29 years old with one child. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock like soft drinks, noodles, sardines, etc. to sell.

Geraldine has been in this business for five years.

In the future she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock like soft drinks, noodles, sardines, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Samwel's Group

texts.en:
Samwel is 54 years old and has five children. He is the group leader of a group of 10 farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya. 

Samwel has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2011. This decision was largely a result of his desire to earn enough to feed his family and, although he described his last harvest as good, he believes he could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. 

Samwel has decided to purchase a solar light as part of his loan, which he is very excited about, as it will allow him to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money.

Obtaining this loan means that Samwel's Group will be able to receive a total of seven solar lights as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 6.75 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertiliser to grow corn.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
As a married parent of nine children, Emma works hard to support her family.

She has a business selling shrimp in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling fermented shrimp from a mobile cart. Emma is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase more shrimp to sell through her business.

Emma has been sustaining her business activities through her past 15 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more shrimp to sell.

loans.name: Yoleng

texts.en:
Yoleng is an 18-year-old single son of a family from Prey Veng province, Cambodia. He is studying management in his first year at a university in the city. His parents are farmers who mainly earn income from cultivating rice and fattening animals. 

Yoleng doesn’t have enough money to pay his university fees for four years, so he would like a loan. He will be able to graduate and find a job with this loan. Yoleng dreams of working in a bank with a decent salary, so he can improve his living standards.

loans.use: to pay his university fees.

loans.name: Sumini

texts.en:
Sumini is married with eight children, all of whom go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (her sister and brother). She resides in her own house and her family has access to electricity and piped water. 

Sumini has a retail shop and has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more crates of soda, rice, maize flour, bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap and cooking oil. She has been in this business for six years. 

She works in the shop seven days a week. Her major business challenges include transportation, seasonality and defaulting suppliers. She is aspiring to build rental houses to diversify her income.

loans.use: to buy more crates of soda, rice, maize flour, bags of sugar and other items to sell.

loans.name: Chhan

texts.en:
Chhan, 30 years old, lives in a small community of Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. He has three independent children who are currently in school. To make a living, he has been involved in a rice farming business since 2008. On average, he is able to make an income of USD 3.00 per day.

The earnings that he receives seasonally from his farming are very low. He wants to have one more business as a supplementary income. However, his limited capital doesn't allow him to do so. That is why he is applying for a Kiva loan for capital to invest in a sugar cane juice selling business. This loan will allow him to have one more source of income which will help to remove poverty from his life. He is thankful to all lenders for their financial support toward poor people.

loans.use: to invest in a sugar cane juice selling business

loans.name: Florida

texts.en:
As the widowed parent of four children, Florida works hard to support her family.

She has a business selling food in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from direct selling Avon products and pre-paid mobile credit. Florida is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Florida has been sustaining her business activities through her past 27 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her business selling food.

loans.name: Alfred's Group

texts.en:
Pictured above is Alfred, often described as an extremely hardworking individual. He is 32 years old and, as a group leader, he is representing his group of 11 farmers in the Teso District, Kenya. He is married and has two children.

Alfred is returning this season to work with One Acre Fund as this means that he has access to quality training and new farming methods, which is why he decided to join in the first place. Alfred says that he is happy to have made that decision because, since he first joined in 2013, he has been able to consistently feed his family, which has improved his day-to-day life significantly. Alfred will use the profits from this season to save more money for the future.

The group will use this loan to purchase a total of nine solar lights as well as seeds and fertilizer to plant a total of 5 acres.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to grow corn.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Gina works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Gina is borrowing PHP 9,000 through NWTF to buy additional ingredients like meat, sugar, spices, etc. for her food vending business.

Gina has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients like meat, sugar, spices, etc

loans.name: Yéwouté Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Yéwouté, rassemble 5 personnes qui logent dans le même quartier et ont des activités différentes. Ils se sont regroupés pour bénéficier d’un financement qui pourra les aider dans leurs activités respectives.
Issa est le président, il est marié et père de six enfants (dont son ainée, une fille de 20 ans). Il est charpentier de profession qui exerce le métier depuis plus de 20 ans et s’active aussi dans le domaine de l’embouche depuis maintenant 3 ans. Il vient solliciter ce crédit pour acheter deux bœufs et les emboucher pour les revendre. Issa s’occupe de la dépense quotidienne de son foyer grâce aux revenus de ces deux activités et compte pouvoir faire des économies afin de pouvoir faire la réfection sa maison.
texts.en:
The Yéwouté group is comprised of five people who live in the same neighborhood but do different activities. They came together to benefit from financing that would help them with their respective activities.

Issa is the president. He is married and the father of six children (his oldest is his 20-year-old daughter). He has been a carpenter by profession for 20 years. He also has been working in livestock fattening for three years. He just requested this loan to buy two cows that he will fatten and resell.
 
Thanks his revenue from these two activities, Issa can take care of his household's daily expenses. He would like to save so that he can renovate his house.

loans.use: buy two cows to fatten and resell.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is thankful that she was granted a 15,000 PHP loan to buy spare parts and maintain her jeepney. Her earnings were a big help to meet personal and household needs.

She would like to apply for a 20,000 PHP loan for her to buy spare parts and for the maintenance of her jeepney. It is important that her unit is always in good running condition to ensure efficient service and steady income for her family. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial assistance. She wishes everyone a blessed New Year!

Rebecca has dreams for her grandchildren to finish school and earn a college degree to allow them better opportunities in life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and so she can draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts and maintenance of her jeepney unit.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia resides in Mayorga, Leyte. She has a 17-year-old son. She engages in the hog raising business. In addition to that, she also engages in the food vending business. She cooks home meals like stewed vegetables and meat recipes.

Lilia is asking for a loan to buy supplies for food vending like meat and vegetables. These ingredients will be used in preparing more meals, and she will sell them in her local community. In this way, slowly her income will improve and she will start to handle her finances. With this, she could now provide her family with a nutritious diet.

She dreams of expanding both of her businesses to make them productive and profitable.

loans.use: to buy supplies for food vending like meat and vegetables.

loans.name: Gie Benno Group

texts.fr:
Le GIE Benno regroupe des commerçants qui s’activent dans le même marché.
Monsieur Cheikh Tidiane est le responsable de l’association, il fait du commerce de céréales depuis 14 ans maintenant. Il possède une cantine qu’il veut renforcer grâce au crédit. Il est actif toute la journée. Il va acheter du mil, du maïs et des arachides pour revendre. La période de l’hivernage passé, il profite des prix bas des produits pour acheter une grande quantité qu’il pourra revendre avec une marge bénéficiaire.
Cheikh Tidiane a des engagements familiaux puisqu’il est marié et père de 3 enfants dont l’ainé, 7 ans et le cadet 8 mois. Il s’occupe de la dépense quotidienne et de l’éducation de l’ainé pour l’instant. 
Il désire promouvoir son activité en louant un hangar afin d’augmenter la quantité des produits.
texts.en:
The Gie Benno group brings together shopkeepers who work in the same market. 

Mr. Cheikh Tidiane is in charge of the group. He has been selling cereals for 14 years. He has a cafeteria and would like to use his loan to improve it. 

He works all day. He will buy millet, corn, and peanuts and then sell them.  With the rainy season in the past, he can now take advantage of lower prices to buy more products that he can sell for a profit.

Cheikh Tidiane has family responsibilities. He is married and has three children between the ages of 8 months and 7 years. For the time being, he takes care of the daily expenses and the education of his eldest child. He would like to grow his business by renting a warehouse that will allow him to house more products.

loans.use: buy cereals, millet, corn, and peanuts that he will resell.

loans.name: Oñondivepa Group

texts.es:
El comité “ Oñondivepa ” está integrado con 19 señoras ellas poseen diversas actividades comerciales en las que ponen su mejor esfuerzo y quieren ir mejorándolas poco a poco por medio de su esfuerzo.
Lucia es una de las integrantes de este grupo, ella se dedica a la costura de todo tipo de prendas y otro tipo de confecciones, es una mujer muy buena en lo que hace, es por ello que tiene una muy buena clientela que siempre le hace muchos pedidos y esto la ayuda con los ingresos para ayudar a su familia.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de telas en cantidad, de manera a poder seguir con sus confecciones como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
The "Oñodivepa" loan group has 19 members, all women. They have different types of businesses where they work as hard as they can. They want to improve their businesses gradually through their efforts.

Lucia is one member of this group. She makes a living as producing all sorts of clothes and doing other sewing work. Lucia is very good at what she does and so has a good customer base that makes many orders. This helps Lucia to earn an income to help her family.

Lucia is applying for this loan in order to buy materials in bulk. She can then continue with her sewing business as she has been doing before.

loans.use: to buy material in bulk for sewing work.

loans.name: Julia Elvira

texts.es: Julia una estudiante de 30 años de edad es casada. Ella estudió la carrera de Enfermería por un periodo de 05 años. Julia se siente feliz al poder continuar sus estudios lo cual tiene pensado realizar su especialización en dicha carrera. Es por ello que solicitó el crédito para el pago de su pensión de estudio.  Actualmente Julia trabaja en una clínica lo que le permite cubrir una parte de sus estudios y la de su familia. El deseo de Julia es de terminar satisfactoriamente su carrera y ser más competitiva y de esta manera mejorar sus ingresos. Agradece a los inversionistas Kiva por apoyar a estudiantes como ella.
texts.en:
Julia is 30 years old and married. She is a student and studied nursing for five years. Julia is happy to continue her studies and is planning to specialise within her field. As a result she is applying for a loan in order to pay tuition fees.

Julia currently works at a clinic, allowing her to part of her and her family's expenses. Julia wants to finish her degree and be more competitive, thus allowing her to earn a higher income. Julia is grateful to Kiva investors for supporting students like her.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees.

loans.name: Israel De Los Angeles

texts.es:
Israel, de 40  años de  edad, estudió hasta cuarto grado, está casado desde los 26 años, su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos, ella es quien le apoya en todos los trabajos a él.- Han procreado 2 hijos ambos menores de edad, quienes asisten a la escuela, uno estudia cuarto grado y el otro segundo grado. 

Israel, se dedica a la agricultura, por la zona en la que vive no tiene muchas opciones de trabajo, desde pequeño uno de sus tíos le enseño a trabajar, ya que se creció sin padre y desde pequeño le toco tomar el cargo en su familia, ya que era de los hijos mayores.- Fue por esa razón que ya no pudo continuar en la escuela. 

La distancia que recorre hacia su trabajo, es aproximadamente un kilómetro, el recorrido lo realiza a pie, el trabajo lo realiza él solo y pero cuando hay mucho trabajo busca trabajadores para poder realizar los trabajos a tiempo, el horario de trabajo es de 5:30 a.m. a 11:00 a.m. 

El préstamo será invertido para comprar clavos, madera y pagar la mano de obra que le ayude a reparar el techo de su casa, ya que es encuentra en mal estado y esto pone en peligro la vida de su familia. 

El sueño de Israel es, ayudar a sus hijos para que estudien la carrera que más les guste y que puedan tener las oportunidades que él no tuvo.
texts.en:
Israel is 40 years old and has a fourth grade education. He married when he was 26, and his wife takes care of the household chores and supports him in his work. The couple has two children, both under 18, who attend school. One is in fourth grade, the other in second.

Israel works in farming. There are not many employment opportunities where Israel lives but from a young age Israel's uncle taught him how to work. Israel grew up without a father and had to be the man-of-the-house from an early age as he was the eldest. As a result, Israel was not able to continue attending school.

Israel walks around one kilometre to work. He works alone but, when there is a lot of work to be done, he hires labourers to be able to do the work on time. Israel works from 5.30am until 11am.

This loan will be used to buy nails and wood and to pay labourers to help repair the roof of his home. The roof is in bad condition, posing a danger to his family.

Israel's dream is to help his children to study the degree that they want at university and for them to have opportunities that he did not have.

loans.use: to buy nails and wood and to pay labourers to help repair the roof of his home.

loans.name: Manuela

texts.es:
Manuela es una mujer soltera de 29 años de edad, viven junto a sus hermanos y sus padres en una comunidad de Sololá. 
Manuela es una señorita que con esfuerzo y dedicación, ha podido aprender un oficio de su madre, ella se dedica a la elaboración de ropa típica, es un trabajo que le encanta  hacer  y se divierte haciéndolo,  ella vende en el mercado de su comunidad, es asi como Manuela genera sus ingresos, además de esta actividad, ella también cultiva café y banano, es una persona que lucha y se esmera en trabajar.
 Pues con los ingresos ella apoya a su papá con algunos gastos de la casa. Ella es soltera pues lo que ella sueña es comprar su propio terreno para construirse una casa, ella cuenta con un pequeño fondo pero no es suficiente para realizar esta compra, pues con el afán de cumplir sus sueños ella solicita un préstamo para adquirir este terreno y con los ingresos que genera sus dos actividades va pagando poco a poco. Además otro sueño de Manuela  es  cuando tenga su casa pueda instalar un negocio, Manuela quiere aprovechar su juventud, para que cuando sea mayor de edad tenga un lugar donde vivir y un espacio donde poder instalar un negocio.
texts.en:
Manuela is 29 years old and single. She lives with her siblings and parents in a community in Sololá.

Manuela is someone who, with effort and dedication, has been able to learn a trade from her mother and now makes traditional clothing. Manuela loves this work and has fun doing it. She sells her products in the community market, earning her an income. In addition she grows coffee and bananas. Manuela is somebody who fights and works hard at her job.

With her income, Manuela supports her father with some household costs. Manuela is single and dreams of buying her own land to build a house. She has a small amount of savings but not enough to make this purchase. In order to achieve her dream more quickly, Manuela is applying for a loan to buy land. Little by little, Manuela will use the income from her two jobs to pay off the loan. 

Another dream that Manuela has is to set up a business once she has a house. Manuela wants to take advantage of her youth so that, when she is older, she will have a place to live and a space where she can open a business.

loans.use: to buy land.

loans.name: Esfuerzo Es Exito Group

texts.es: El grupo “ESFUERZO ES ÉXITO” está conformada por mujeres trabajadoras y responsables. Maria tiene 50 años de edad es casada. Ella se dedica a la venta de bebidas y a la vez vende productos de belleza a través de catálogos. En sus tiempos libres presta servicios de mantenimiento en tres viviendas. El crédito lo invirtió en la compra de una vitrina para exhibir sus productos de belleza y más bebidas. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el crédito brindado. Maria viste chompa de color turquesa
texts.en:
The "Esfuerzo es Éxito" group has hard-working and responsible women as its members.

One member, María is 50 years old and married. She makes a living selling drinks and beauty products through catalogues. In her spare time, María works as a cleaner in three homes. This loan will be used to buy a display case to show her beauty products and more drinks.

The group thanks Kiva investors for this loan.

In the photo, María is wearing a blue sweatshirt.

loans.use: to buy a display case and soft drinks.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to put a roof on a room and rent out the room.

loans.name: Antonia Idalia

texts.es:
Antonia, de 47 años de edad, estudió hasta tercer grado, los pocos ingresos que tenían sus padres, no le permitieron poder continuar estudiando, por lo que tuvo que dedicarse a ayudar en el trabajo de la casa.- Se casó a temprana edad, vivió con su esposo y procrearon 3 hijos, quienes ya son mayores de edad, su esposo ya falleció. Dos de sus hijos viven con ella, quienes le apoyan en sus trabajos, y una hija está fuera del país.

Ella, se dedica al comercio de carne de res, ya tiene 15 años de experiencia, por mucho tiempo se ha dedicado a ésta actividad, el trabajo lo aprendió por medio de sus padres, quienes se dedicaban a lo mismo.- También se dedica a la crianza y venta de ganado, el destazo lo realiza en su casa, por lo que no recorre distancia y la distribuye por encargo. El horario de trabajo es de las 3:00 am a 9:00 am, el destazo lo realiza tres veces a la semana.  

El préstamo será invertido para comprar 2 vacas para engordarlas y luego venderlas o destazarlas.- El préstamo le ayudará para poder incrementar la producción de ganado y tener más opciones ya sea para vender o destazarlo.

Sus sueños son, continuar las ventas y poder mantener a flote su fuente de ingreso y con esto cubrir las necesidades del hogar.
texts.en:
Antonia is 47 years old and has a third grade education. Her parents' small income was not enough to allow her to continue attending school and so she had to help with work at home. Antonia married at a young age. She lived with her husband and they had three children, now adults. Antonia's husband has passed away. Two of the couple's children still live at home and help her with her work, while one daughter lives abroad.

Antonia makes a living selling red meat. She has 15 years' experience with this work, having learned the trade from her parents who did this same work. Antonia also makes a living raising and selling cattle, and slaughters the animals in her house. She does not, therefore, need to travel to work and receives orders for the meat. Antonia works from 3am until 9am, slaughtering three times per week.

This loan will be used to buy two cows to fatten up and slaughter or sell. The loan will help Antonia to increase production and have more options regarding selling or slaughtering.

Antonia's dream is to continue with sales and to be able to keep on earning an income and use it to pay all household costs.

loans.use: to buy two cows to fatten up and slaughter or sell.

loans.name: Rita

texts.es:
Rita es una joven mujer de 18 años de edad, soltera, sin hijos y su negocio es la venta de comida y el corte y confección de ropa tradicional.
Ella es emprendedora, independiente, constante, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la comunidad ‘Yaurichambi’; caracterizado por su cercanía al lago sagrado Titicaca, área agrícola dónde se cría ganado; vacuno, ovino y camélido, se vive de la pesca y también de cereales y vegetales del lugar, como la quinua, el chuño, la haba, la papa, etc. caracterizada por el clima frío, con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 1-12 grados centígrados y donde los rayos solares golpean con mucha fuerza la superficie.
Rita es de tez morena, baja estatura, cabello negro largo trenzado, su vestimenta es tradicional (sombrero, manta y pollera), su lengua materna es el Aymará y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza. Su vida la realiza en casa de sus padres que se encargan de la producción de queso, viven en una casa construida de adobe con techo de calamina que cuenta con los servicios de electricidad y agua de pozo. Su negocio es la venta de sopa de fideo, actividad que realiza todos los días de la semana en un puesto de venta fijo. La sopa de fideo consiste en fideo hervido, con chuño y carne molida y es muy consumido a media mañana. Debido a unos talleres de costura en los que participo, ella adquirió los conocimientos para la confección de polleras y ropa de cholita. “aprendí corte y confección en un instituto cercano, quiero empezar a confeccionar ropa tradicional…” comenta. Su sueño es tener un taller de costura, ella desea realizar la compra de una máquina de coser para la confección de polleras de cholita y otras prendas. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 2 años que viene desarrollando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Rita solicita un préstamo para la compra de una máquina de coser para comenzar su negocio de confección de polleras.
texts.en:
Rita is a young, 18 year old single woman without children. She runs a business making traditional clothes, and she is a hard-working, entrepreneurial, independent, consistent and responsible woman. She started her business within the 'Yaurichambi' community, close to the sacred Lake Titicaca, a farming area where animals such as cows, sheep and camelids are raised. Here, people eat fish, cereals and vegetables which grow in the area, such as quinoa, chuño (a freeze-dried potato product), beans and potatoes. The area is known for its cold weather, where the daily temperatures vary between 1 and 12 degrees centigrade and the sun's rays beat the land with great ferocity.

Rita is petite and dark-skinned, with long, dark plaited hair. She wears traditional dress (hat, shawl and skirt) and her native language is Aymara although she speaks Spanish for business and cultural purposes. She lives at home with her parents, who are cheesemakers, in a house made from adobe and furnished with a corrugated roof. Their home has electricity and a water-well. She runs her business selling noodle soup each day from her established market stall. The noodle soup consists of noodles boiled with chuño and minced meat, and it is frequently eaten at mid-morning. Rita is also involved with sewing workshops in the area and, consequently, she has acquired the necessary skills to start manufacturing skirts and traditional clothing. She states that she learned to cut cloth and stitch it in a nearby institution and now she wishes to manufacture traditional clothing. Her dream is to have a dressmaker's workshop and, as such, she would like to have a sewing machine to make traditional skirts and other items. This will be Rita's first loan cycle with the institution in the 2 years that she has been developing this business and, for the reasons mentioned above, Rita is applying or this loan so that she can buy a sewing machine to start her dressmaking business.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine so that she can start her own business making traditional skirts.

loans.name: Progresando Para Vivir  (Portoviejo) Group

texts.es:
En la ciudadela Las Orquídeas  de la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúne cada quince días el Grupo De Crédito Progresando para Vivir el cual está formado por 8 mujeres y 2 hombres, todos ellos muy trabajadores que con la ayuda del créditos esperan  sacar adelante sus negocios y así mejorando la calidad de vida de sus familias, ellos se dedican a varias actividades en su mayoría al comercio. 
Una de las socias de este grupo es la señora Verónica, tiene 27 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre y de esta relación  tiene dos hijos de 6 y 3 años de edad, el mayor estudia en escuela. Su marido es laboratorista 
Doña Verónica es una muy buena madre y esposa  que siempre le ha gustado trabajar para salir adelante y para la crianza de sus pequeños hijos,  ella se dedica a la venta de productos de Avon (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja tres días a la semana en sus recorridos de dos a tres horas al día, ella deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. Tiene dos años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien, lo que más vende son los perfumes y cosméticos ya que  son muy buenos.
Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas y cosméticos. Este es su primer  ciclo en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos son rápidos. Sus sueños son seguir adelante en su negocio.
texts.en:
In the area of Las Orquídeas in the city of Portoviejo, the "Progresando para Vivir" loan group meets every fortnight. Made up of eight women and two men, the members are all very hard-working and, with the help of loans, are hoping to move forward with their businesses, thus improving their families' quality of life. The members have different kinds of businesses.

One member of the group is 27-year-old Verónica. She has a partner and two children, ages six and three years old; the eldest in school. Verónica's partner is a lab technician.

Verónica is a very good mother and partner who has always liked to work in order to get ahead and raise her children. She makes a living selling Avon products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes, and women's accessories). She works three days per week, spending two to three hours going round selling her goods. She sells on credit and collects payments once a week. Verónica has been doing this work for two years and it is going very well. Her highest selling products are perfumes and cosmetics as they are good products.

This loan will be used to buy perfumes, creams and cosmetics. This is Verónica's first loan cycle with the group and she likes it because the loans are very quick. Verónica's dreams are to continue moving forward with her business.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, creams and cosmetics.

loans.name: Iluminada

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Iluminada works hard to support her family.

She has a restaurant business in the Philippines, and also earns an additional income from working in a general store. Iluminada is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to purchase ingredients like fish, pork and spices for her restaurant business.

Iluminada has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like fish, pork and spices

loans.name: Gertulda

texts.en: Gertulda is twenty-six years old. She is married with a child who is one and not yet going to school. She is a tailor and has been engaged in this business for a year. With the loan, she would like to buy more clothes to tailor. She plans to reinvest her profits back into the business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to tailor

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy galvanized steel, wood and nails to replace the roof of her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in beams, wood, and metal sheets to build his wattle and daub house.

loans.name: Ada Yacenia

texts.es: Ada de 33 años de edad es una mujer emprendedora que desde hace 10 años cuenta con un taller de estructuras metálicas en su hogar, además vende productos de belleza por catálogo, lo que le ha ayudado a mantener la economía de su hogar al lado de su compañero de vida que le apoya en el negocio del taller. ella vive junto a su compañero de vida y sus 4 hijos de 14, 9, 5, y 7 mese de edad. Ada desea que en su taller no solo se elaboren productos por encargo si no también elaborar productos para tener que ofrecer a sus clientes, para ello necesita invertir en: hierro, electrodos, discos, pintura, lámina, platinas, etc. Por lo que desea adquirir un crédito con FUSAI que le permita realizar dicha inversión y así ofrecer productos como: puertas, ventanas, balcones, verjas, portones, etc.
texts.en:
Ada is a 33 year old enterprising woman who for 10 years has had a workshop of metal structures in her home. She also sells beauty products by catalog, helping the family finances alongside her life partner, who relies on the business of the workshop. She lives together with her life partner and four children.  Her children are ages fourteen years, nine years, five years, and seven months old.

Ada wants her workshop not only to develop custom products but also to develop other products to to offer her customers.  To make this happen she needs to invest in iron, electrodes, disks, paint, film, plates, etc.  A loan with FUSAI will allow her to make the investment and offer products such as doors, windows, balconies, railings, gates, etc.

loans.use: to invest in iron, electrodes, disks, paint, film, plates, etc.

loans.name: Maria Esperanza

texts.es: María de 60 años de edad vive al lado de su esposo y su hijo ya mayor de edad en vivienda propia desde hace 28 años de edad. Ella siempre buscando lo mejor para su familia decidió instalar una pequeña venta de tortas y bebidas frías en su vivienda desde hace 4 años, lo que le ha permitido brindar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. María desea instalar 2 ventanas y una puerta en su vivienda, ya que desde hace un tiempo ha estado construyendo su vivienda, por lo que también desea encementar el piso y las paredes de su vivienda, y para ello solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, 2 ventanas y una puerta para instalar en su vivienda y encementar las paredes y el piso de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Maria is 60 years old and has lived with her husband and adult child in their own home for 28 years. She has always sought the best for her family so 4 years ago she decided to open a small business selling tortas (sandwiches) and cold drinks in her home. This has enabled her to provide a better quality of life for her family.

Maria wants to install 2 windows and a door in her home, as it has been some time that her home was constructed. She also wants to cement the floor and walls of her home. She seeks a loan from FUSAI to invest in cement, sand, gravel, two doors and a door to install in her home and cement the walls and floor of her home.

loans.use: To purchase cement, sand, 2 windows and a door for her house

loans.name: Yanira Elizabeth

texts.es: Yanira de 45 años de edad habita junto a su esposo, su madre, una hija de 14 años y un hijo de 16 años de edad. Yanira trabaja como empleada en una institución cercana a su localidad y es así como junto a su esposo mantienen la economía de su hogar. Yanira desea mejorar las condiciones del techo de su vivienda, dado que con el tiempo se ha deteriorado. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de lámina galvanizada, madera y hierro para proceder a la mejora del techo de su vivienda lo antes posible.
texts.en:
Yanira is 45 years old and lives with her husband, her mother, a 14 year old daughter and a 16 year old son. Yanira is employed at a institution near her town and it is this way, along with her husband, that they maintain their household finances.

Yanira wants to improve the conditions of the roof of their home, as with time, it has deteriorated. This is the reason she is requesting credit from FUSAI, to invest in the purchase of galvanized sheets, wood and iron to proceed with the improvement of the roof of their home as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase: galvanized sheets, wood and iron to repair the roof of her home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tools for his metal structure workshop.

loans.name: Rosenda Paula

texts.es: Rosenda de 50 años de edad es una mujer trabajadora que habita en casa propia al lado de su compañero de vida y sus 2 hijos una niña de 13 años y un varón de 12 años de edad. Ella se gana la vida elaborando deliciosos tamales de gallina los fines de semana los cuales tienen una gran demanda entre sus vecinos y los cantones más cercanos. Rosenda desea brindar  una mayor seguridad a su familia ya que como se observa en la fotografía la pared del corredor está a medio construir y solo cuenta con unas láminas viejas para protegerse, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo y hierro para construir la pared del corredor de su vivienda y de esta manera brindar una mayor seguridad a su familia.
texts.en: Rosenda is 50 years old, She is a working woman who lives in her own house along with her life partner and her two children, a 13 year old girl and a 12 year old boy. She earns her living preparing delicious chicken tamales on the weekends, which are in great demand among her neighbors and the nearby homes. Rosenda wants to bring added safety to her family because, as shown on the picture, the corridor wall is half built and only has some old sheeting for protection. Thus, she is asking for a loan from FUSAI to invest in cement, sand, gravel, brick, and reinforcing bars to build the corridor wall in her house and consequently, bring added security to her family.

loans.use: To invest in: cement, sand, gravel, brick and reinforcing bars to build a corridor wall in her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a freezer and fruit for the sales of shakes and soft drinks.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy: sugar, oil, detergents, candies, beans, rice, etc. for sale

loans.name: Dominga

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal KANCHARISUN, el banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Dominga continua  con el negocio de artesanía, la socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas, la socia continua vendiendo sus artesanías a sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, siendo e esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de chompas, polos, entre otros.
texts.en:
Dominga is a member of the "Kancharisun" communal bank in the district and department of Cusco, Peru.

Dominga continues to run her business selling handicraft products. She is grateful for this loan and promises to make her repayments. 

Dominga is still selling her handicrafts. She is responsible and determined as, with this work, she is helping her family to get ahead.

This loan will be used to buy sweatshirts, t-shirts and other items.

loans.use: to buy sweatshirts, t-shirts and other items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in the ingredients for her sandwiches and cold drinks.

loans.name: Anthony

texts.en:
Anthony is thirty-six and a smallholder farmer who runs an eleven-acre farmland and a small butcher's shop in Igoji, Kenya. He grew up as the second-youngest child in a large, happy family with twelve siblings. He started his own family with three children when he got married ten years ago.

For the last five years, his farming business has sustained his family financially. Anthony keeps two cows, three chickens and two goats. Anthony's big challenge is transportation of farm products and other goods. The road network in his area has deteriorated badly and fuel prices have made it prohibitively expensive to hire vehicles for transportation.

To solve this problem once and for all, Anthony is turning to Kiva lenders to seek a loan for purchasing an Indian motorcycle, commonly known as 'a "Bodaboda" in this part of the world.

With your support, Anthony will have a cheap, reliable and flexible means of transporting his goods within short distances at his own convenience. Anthony, who considers himself honest and hard working, knows that having a motorcycle in his life will be a game-changer. His family's livelihood will be elevated, as the ability to distribute his goods will allow them to have more income.

loans.use: to pay for a motorcycle

loans.name: Glenda Marisol

texts.es: Nuevamente Glenda solicita un  crédito a FUSAI dado que con el primer crédito que recibió no logró hacer todas las mejoras que necesitaba. En esta ocasión desea terminar la fosa séptica por lo que necesita materiales como: cemento, arena, ladrillo, grava, etc. Agradece el apoyo que recibió en el pasado para la mejora de sus condiciones habitacionales, dado que de esta forma le puede ofrecer mejore calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Glenda is requesting her second loan through FUSAI because with the first loan she received she was not able to complete all the home improvements that she needs.  With this loan she wishes to finish the septic tank, for which she needs materials such as: cement, sand, bricks, gravel, etc.

She appreciates the support she has received in the past to improve her living conditions, because in this way she is able to offer her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase cement, sand, bricks, gravel, and other materials to build a septic tank.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cement, bricks, sand, and other materials to build columns for her house.

loans.name: Phally

texts.en:
Phally, 44, is a married woman who lives in a rural area of Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has five children in total; two are single while the other three are married. To make a living, she manages and operates a farming business, growing rice and selling the crops to the local dealers. She has been involved in this type of business for more than ten years. She is able to make an income of USD $3.00 per day, on average.  

Recently, she came up with a new business idea. She wants to contract a cashew plantation to harvest. Therefore, Phally would like to apply for a KIVA loan. She will use this loan as capital to invest in the cashew business. With the support from this loan, she hopes that she can get more income and improve her living standard. 

She would like to thank all lenders for their financial support toward poor people.

loans.use: to contract a cashew plantation to harvest.

loans.name: Driton

texts.en:
Driton is 30 years old, married and the father of one child. He works very hard to earn a living and has been successful in starting and running his own business for five years now. He is a freelance commercial painter, completing work on businesses, homes and any other structures that customers request. Since he is his family's main source of income while his wife stays home to care for their child, he has to work long hours every day to make enough income to provide for their needs.

At this time, Driton is in need of a loan to buy a machine for mixing colors and some other additional tools for his trade. This will help him to become better equipped with the latest tools and technology for producing quality work and meeting professional standards. He expects that this improvement will then generate him more business and more income, both from additional work he will receive and by allowing him to complete work faster, giving him more opportunities to complete more jobs. He hopes that in the near future he will be able to expand his business even more and be able to hire an employee. He is very grateful for this help and wants to thank the lenders for their support.

loans.use: to buy a paint mixing machine and other tools for his trade

loans.name: Soman

texts.en:
Soman is a 20-year-old student and an information technology major. He is pursuing an associate’s degree at a university in the city. Soman’s parents are rice farmers who live in Prey Province in Cambodia. 

Due to a shortage of finances to pay his university fees, he would like to apply for a loan. This loan will help Soman to earn an associate’s degree. After graduation, he hopes to have a job so he will be able to pursue a bachelor’s degree.

loans.use: to pay his university fees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to install electricity in her home.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is married with six children, all of whom go to school. She also has additional family members. She operates a mobile money and mobile phone accessory  shop and has been in this business for 30 years. 

She has applied for a loan of 2,000,000 from MCDT-SACCO to buy mobile phones, airtime, chargers, batteries and headsets. She sells on a retail basis seven days a week. Her major business challenge is electricity. She aspires to own a fully stocked shop of phones. 

She decided to join MCDT-SACCO because of their good customer care. She has her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: to buy mobile phones, airtime, chargers, batteries and headsets.

loans.name: Sophen

texts.en:
Sophen is a 20-year-old university student who is pursing an associate's degree. He majors in information technology and is in the first year of his studies.

He is from Prey Veng province in Cambodia. His parents are rice farmers. 

Sophen is short of finances to pay his tuition fees for the two years, therefore he has decided to take out a loan. This loan will help provide him with skills for his future job. For his dreams after graduation, he hopes to have a job with a good salary to help his parents. He also wants to save money to run a business.

loans.use: to pay his tuition fees for two years.

loans.name: Safargul

texts.en:
Born in 1984, Safargul is married and has 3 little children. Her husband is a taxi driver. Together, they try to provide a good living standard for their children and dream of seeing their children become higher educated.

Safargul is a business woman who has been buying and selling women's and children's clothes for more than 6 years in a local market. She wants to increase working capital and, in this way, get ahead in business. She dreams of opening her own shop. A loan of 3000 Somoni would help Safargul to buy clothes and increase her working capital. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To increase working capital to buy clothes

loans.name: Kim

texts.en:
Kim, 58, lives in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. She has two married children. To make a living and support her family, she manages and operates a farming business on a small rice farmland which is located near her house. So far, she has been in this type of business for more than thirty years. On average, she is able to make an income of USD 7.00 a day.

She wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family by having a latrine to use, because there is no latrine in her house now. Therefore, she is borrowing a loan from Kiva to build a latrine. By doing this, she can help her family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration. She is thankful for the loan granted through HKL with a much lower interest rate than other general loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine.

loans.name: Jonah

texts.en:
Jonah is a hard-working 27-year-old farmer from Ntima location, which is found in the fertile Nkubu region of Kenya. Unlike most of our typical clients, Jonah describes his childhood as supported. He was born 5th in a family of 8 children. He dropped out of school after primary education and started working to make ends meet. Two years ago, Jonah and his sweetheart Irene tied the knot and they are blessed with a child who is now 1 year 6 months old. 

Jonah has been doing farming for 4 years. He works on his 1.25 acre farm to plant trees and crops. He also keeps 1 cow, 3 goats and 5 heads of poultry. He is very cautious when it comes to financial management as evidenced by his weekly budgetary reviews.

Jonah is seeking a loan to purchase an affordable Indian motorcycle. Rural farmers in Kenya use such motorcycles to ferry passengers and transport farm goods to and from the market. This motorcycle is going to make one such farmer, Jonah, turn heads in the village and feel very proud. The motorcycles are trending among rural businessmen because their engine performance, fuel economy and gearbox fuel efficiency is very good. 

Jonah's family's livelihood will certainly be uplifted by this acquisition because they will have solved most of their product distribution challenges.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Sauda

texts.en:
Sauda is a married mother of six children; all of them go to school. She has additional family members living in her home. She sells charcoal from home on a retail basis and has been in this business for 5 years. 

She has applied for a loan of 1,400,000 UGX from MCDT-SACCO to buy bags of charcoal. She generates additional income from selling snacks like fried cassava and chapati . She works seven days a week. Her major business challenges include seasonality and transportation. 

She aspires to own a fully stocked stall of charcoal and also to build rental houses. She owns a house and the family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: To buy bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Loida

texts.en:
Loida is a resident of Dulag, Leyte. She earns a living by engaging in a soft drink vending business. She sells cold soft drinks like coke, sprite and royal. She is a married woman with two kids aged 5 and 3 years old. She has been engaged in this kind of business for 5 years now. 

Loida has requested a loan to purchase a variety of soft drinks. Because of these supplies, she will be able to cater for the needs of her customers. Slowly, she could earn more and start to augment her income. She could then prepare healthy food for the whole family.

 She is eager to expand her business to continue provide for the needs of her young children and to become successful in her chosen field.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of soft drinks.

loans.name: Andrew

texts.en:
Andrew comes from the town of Nkubu in Central Kenya, where he is a crop and livestock farmer. He lives with his wife, Naomi, who he married over two decades ago. The couple has four children aged between 15 and 22 years old. 
Andrew owns 1.5 acres by the river on which he has been farming for close to 19 years. He keeps four cows, three chickens, two goats and one pig. He also grows coffee and 20 trees on this small piece of land. 
Andrew's biggest challenge is lack of rainfall over long periods of time. This has resulted in crop failures in the past. However, the assets Andrew is seeking financing for will help him to avoid losses due to unpredictable weather. Andrew is seeking a loan to buy animal feed and water pipes. The extra animal feed will build his inventory to carry Anthony's livestock through dry spells. The water pipes will become part of the irrigation system that he will use to provide his crops and trees with sufficient water for healthy growth. Andrew is very disciplined financially. He keeps a budget which is reviewed monthly, tracks every expense, and clears all his debts on time. His credit risk score is attractive and he has successfully serviced all his previous loans, the last being for 70,000 Kenyan shillings (KES).

loans.use: to pay for animal feed and water pipes

loans.name: Reina Isabel

texts.es: Reina es una mujer muy comprometida con su familia y desea continuar apoyando a mejorar sus condiciones de vida. Solicita  nuevamente este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en a instalación del servicio de energía eléctrica en su vivienda dado que no cuenta con el servicio. Reina expresa estar muy agradecida por el apoyo que recibió en el pasado para mejorar  las condiciones de su vivienda.
texts.en: Reina is a woman who is very committed to her family and wants to continue supporting the improvement of their living conditions. She again asks FUSAI for this loan to invest in installing electricity in her house since she doesn't have this service. Reina says she is very grateful for the support that she has gotten in the past to improve the condition of her house.

loans.use: to invest in installing electricity in her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in installing electric services.

loans.name: Griselda Elizabeth

texts.es: Griselda es una mujer increíble quien siempre esta pendiente de su familia y se preocupa por dar mejores condiciones de vida. Nuevamente, solicita un crédito a FUSAI, en está ocasión desea reparar el techo del corredor de su vivienda dado que con el primer crédito solo logró terminar de reparar el techo de su vivienda. Con el monto que solicita comprará lámina galvanizada y madera. Espera poder contar con este financiamiento y así poder mejorar el corredor de su vivienda.
texts.en: Griselda is an incredible woman who always is looking out for her family and she is concerned about giving them the best living conditions. Again, she asks FUSAI for a loan. This time, she wants to repair the roof of the outdoor walkway of her home, since with the first loan she only managed to repair the roof of the house. With the amount that she asks for, she will purchase galvanized metal sheeting and wood. She hopes to be able to have this loan and in this way be able to improve the outdoor walkway of her house.

loans.use: to purchase galvanized metal sheeting and wood to repair the roof of the outdoor walkway of her house.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Forty-three year old Marilou operates a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells various commodities like biscuits, chips, candies, fruit flavored juices, noodles, canned goods and soap.
