She is a married woman with five children. Her oldest child is 22 and the youngest is 12. She has operated the sari-sari store for 3 years now.

Marilou has requested a loan to buy additional stock for the store like canned goods, beverages and toiletries.  With this stock, the store could attract more buyers and augment her daily income. She will be able to handle her finances and start to settle her obligations.

In the future, she would exert effort to become successful and be able to have her own capital for a sustainable living. In addition, she would like to continue to finance the studies of her children for a brighter tomorrow.

loans.use: to buy additional stock for the store like canned goods, beverages and toiletries.

loans.name: Mangorano Shg Group

texts.en:
Waving to you is Hannah, a member of Mangorano S.H.G, which joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2013. The group joined to benefit from training and learn practical skills like soap making, which would improve their lives.

Hannah is 45 years old, married and blessed with two children. She farms vegetables and raises dairy animals to earn her living. She has applied for a loan to buy certified seeds, fertilizer and dairy feed so that she can improve her crop yield and animal production. She hopes that her income will increase to help improve her family's living standards and provide medical care and a quality education for her children. Hannah is grateful to Kiva and their lenders.

loans.use: To buy certified seeds, fertilizer and dairy feed that will help improve crop yield and animal productivity.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
This is Mary, a vegetable farmer who also works in a cafe. She is a 37-year-old single mother of two children who are in primary school. Hand in Hand Eastern Africa training has enabled her improve her enterprise and management skills as well as record keeping.
Mary is applying for a Kiva loan to buy certified seeds and fertilizer to help improve her farming. She believes it will boost her sales, leading to an increase in income. This will enable her to provide for her family's basic needs with ease.
Mary is happy about Kiva and their lenders and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: To buy certified seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Narda

texts.es: Narda de 37 años de edad es madre soltera pero eso no le impide sacar adelante a sus hijos apoyada en su venta de licuados de frutas con leche y panes con salchicha, los cuales vende en su vivienda, además vende frutas y verduras de forma ambulante desde hace 20 años. Ella habita en vivienda propia junto a sus 2 hijos de 19 y 18 años de edad que son su mayor alegría y que le apoyan en su hogar. Narda desea invertir en productos para continuar con sus ventas y para ello solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: leche, frutas, verduras, panes, salchichas, kétchup, etc.
texts.en: Narda, 37 years old, is a single mother but this doesn't prevent her from getting her children ahead, with the help of her sales of smoothies made from fruit with milk, and bread with sausages, which she sells in her house. In addition, she has sold fruit and vegetables as a street vendor for the past 20 years. She lives in her own house with her two children, ages 19 and 18, who are her greatest joy and who help her in the home. Narda wants to invest in products to continue with her sales and for this she asks FUSAI for a loan to invest in milk, fruit, vegetables, bread, sausages, ketchup, etc.

loans.use: to invest in milk, fruit, vegetables, bread, sausages, ketchup, etc.

loans.name: Mirian Del Rosario

texts.es: Mirian de 28 años de edad es una mujer emprendedora que se gana la vida desde hace 10 años vendiendo productos de belleza por catálogo, pero además esta laboriosa mujer divide su tiempo en diferentes ocupaciones ya que los fines de semana vende pupusas en su vivienda y en la semana presta sus servicios de cosmetóloga y vende ropa y zapatos para dama,  lo que le ha permitido sostener a su familia. Ella es madre soltera pero eso no le impide salir adelante y vive con su hijo de 7 años de edad que es su mayor motivo para esforzarse y tratar de darle lo mejor, es por ello que lo apoya para que estudie y sea una persona de bien. Mirian desea que su negocio le siga brindan más y mejores ganancias, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: tintes, proteínas, maquillaje, lociones y materiales para elaborar pupusas.
texts.en:
Mirian is 28 years old and is very driven woman who for the past 10 years has earned a living selling beauty products by catalog.  In addition, this hard-working woman divided her time between other jobs, selling pupusas (a stuffed corn tortilla dish) from her home on the weekends and during the week lending her cosmetic services.  She also sells clothes and women's shoes.  This has allowed her to support her family.

She is a single mother, but this does not stop her from getting ahead.  She lives with her 7-year-old son who is her greatest motive for making an effort. She tries to give him the best, so that she can support him so he can study and be a good person.  

Mirian wants her business to continue producing more and better income, for which she is requesting a loan through FUSAI to invest in dyes, hair treatments, make-up, lotion, and ingredients to make pupusas.

loans.use: to buy dyes, hair treatments, make-up, lotion, and ingredients to make pupusas.

loans.name: Jose Evaristo

texts.es: José de 58 años de edad es un hombre trabajador que se despierta desde muy temprano para prestar sus servicios de transporte en una fábrica cercana, actividad que realiza desde hace 10 años y que le ha permitido mantener a su familia y ganarse la confianza de sus clientes. Él habita en vivienda propia junto a su esposa y su hijo de 14 años de edad al que apoya con sus estudios ya que quiere que sea una persona de bien y que salga adelante. José desea reparar su vehículo que es su herramienta de trabajo ya que este ha presentado fallas y el desea darle el mejor servicio a sus clientes para mantener la confianza con la que cuenta, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: repuestos y mano de obra para reparar su vehículo que es su herramienta de trabajo.
texts.en: José, 58 years old, is a hardworking man who gets up very early to offer his transportation services at a nearby factory. He has done this work for 10 years and it has permitted him to support his family and earn the trust of his customers. He lives in his own house with his wife and his 14-year-old son, whom he supports with his schooling since he wants him to be a good person and to get ahead. José wants to repair his vehicle which is his work tool since it has shown some problems and he wants to give his customers the best service to keep the confidence he has. For this reason, he asks FUSAI for a loan to invest in parts and labor to repair his vehicle, which is his work tool.

loans.use: to invest in parts and labor to repair his vehicle which is his work tool.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.en:
Antonio is a 40 year old beekeeper from Calakmul. He’s married and has six children: three daughters and three sons. He started working as an apiarist 10 years ago and has been doing so ever since. During the offseason of honey production, Antonio works as a carpenter.

Inside of the Mayan Rainforest, one of the most important lungs of the American continent, Calakmul is rich in biodiversity and natural resources. Contradictorily, most of its inhabitants are poor and marginalized.

Environmentally, apiculture is an extremely important activity. Bees offer, through pollination, one of the most important natural services for the conservation and regeneration of biodiversity. This becomes especially important in the Yucatan peninsula, where the rainforest’s resources have been exploited by non- environmentally friendly activities.

With this loan, Antonio will be able to to buy beehives and other equipment needed to increase his production of bee honey by more than twice. As a result, he will earn more money, improve the living conditions of his family and make a larger contribution to the conservation of this invaluable site.

loans.use: to buy beehives to increase his production of honey by more than twice.

loans.name: Erick

texts.en:
Erick is 25 years old and runs a 2-acre farm based in Mweru in the Nkubu region of Kenya. He keeps 1 cow and 5 heads of poultry on his farm and uses the income from his business to take care of his wife of 5 years ago and their three-year-old child. Erick considers himself hardworking and caring, attributes he could have acquired from his position as first born among 5 siblings. The loan officer who interviewed Erick described him as "a very good character who is committed to fulfilling his obligations."

Erick started farming 8 years ago and is as passionate about farming as he is about environment. He noted on his appraisal form that he believes humans are responsible for climate changes. It is worth noting that he has planted 30 trees on his 2 acre piece of land.
 
Erick is seeking a loan to purchase a motorcycle and to improve the dilapidated animal housing structure on his farm. The motorcycle will enable him to transport his milk produce and other farm products to the market easily and economically. Improved animal housing will ensure animal welfare and hygiene. This is very important since he will be able to reduce veterinary-related costs and improve milk production at the same time. Erick successfully serviced his first loan of KES 60,000 on time with no difficulty.

loans.use: to pay for a motorcycle and the construction of a cowshed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in galvanized meta sheeting, wood, nails and wire to build a structure in the area around the sink.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in a pole to install electricity in her house.

loans.name: Amonullo

texts.en: Amonullo is an 18-year old man, who is single and lives with his parents in the capital of Tajikistan. Amonullo is a student of the first course at Tajikistan State University of Agro, and because he is intelligent and hard-working, he is taking his classes successfully. He wants to receive a higher education to be a good specialist in the future. He is asking for a loan of $1300 to pay for his tuition. He awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To pay for tuition

loans.name: Zulfiya

texts.en: Zulfiya is a widow. She is a careful mother and the main provider for her two children. She works hard on her farm, where she has a fruit orchard and land where she grows vegetables. She also makes additional income from animal husbandry. Zulfiya’s elder son is in Russia and he sends her a little money to help her make a living. Zulfiya is asking for a loan of 1500 Tajikistani somoni (TJS) to buy potato seeds. She awaits your support and in advance thanks you for your kindness.

loans.use: to buy potato seeds

loans.name: Lukiya

texts.en:
Lukiya is married with five children, only one of whom goes to school. She does not take care of additional family members. She has a business of selling used clothes and has been in this business for 11 years. 

She has applied for a loan of 2,000,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bales of used clothing. She generates additional income through rental rooms. She moves door to door selling used clothes and sells to all categories of people on a retail basis, six days a week. 

Her major business challenges include seasonality and defaulters. She aspires to get permanent business premises and also to start farming. She resides in the family house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: to buy bales of used clothing.

loans.name: Tia Bidii Young Mothers Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand in the photo is Mary, a member of Tia Bidii Young Mothers' Group which joined Hand-in-Hand Eastern Africa to benefit from enterprise management trainings. She is thirty years old, married and has four children.

Mary is a small scale farmer who farms potatoes, indigenous cabbages, kale, spinach, carrots, courgettes (zucchini) and also does dairy farming. She is borrowing a loan to boost her small scale farming by buying certified seeds. She hopes this will improve crop yield, leading to more income. She plans to reinvest some profits to help expand her farming.

Mary is very happy for Kiva and their lenders and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: To buy certified seeds.

loans.name: Karla Michelle

texts.es: Karla tiene 26 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañero de vida, hija y su abuela de 80 años de edad. Karla se gana la vida por medio de la venta de variedad de prendas de vestir. La venta la realiza de forma ambulante desde hace mucho tiempo y es así como lleva el sustento a su hogar. Karla solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de ladrillo, cemento, arena, hierro, etc. para construir un cuarto para su cocina. Espera poder contar con dicho financiamiento y de esta forma dar inicio al cuarto de la cocina lo antes posible.
texts.en:
Karla is 26 years old and lives in her own house with her life partner, her daughter, and her 80-year-old grandmother. Karla earns her living selling a variety of clothing. She has done her sales as a street vendor for a long time and, in this way, she brings sustenance to her home.

Karla asks FUSAI for a loan to invest in the purchase of bricks, cement, sand, metal, etc. to build a room for her kitchen. She hopes to be able to have this financing and in this way begin with the kitchen as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase brick, cement, sand, metal, etc. to build a room for her kitchen.

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es: María de 50 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su hija de 19 años de edad y su yerno. Ella es una mujer trabajadora que se gana la vida prestando sus servicios domésticos en un comedor cercano a su cantón, actividad que le permite salir adelante, además su hija le apoya con los gastos de su hogar. María desea cambiar el techo del corredor ya que este se encuentra deteriorado y en época lluviosa el agua ingresa a la vivienda deteriorando las pocas pertenencias con las que cuenta es por ello que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lámina galvanizada, para cambiar el techo del corredor de su vivienda y de esta manera mejorar un poca la calidad de vida su familia.
texts.en: María, 50 years old, lives in her own house with her 19-year-old daughter and her son-in-law. She is a hard-working woman who earns her living offering her domestic services in a restaurant in a nearby canton, work that allows her to get ahead. In addition, her daughter helps with the household expenses.  María wants to replace the roof on the outdoor walkway since it is deteriorated and in the rainy season, the water gets into the house, deteriorating the few possessions she has. For this, she asks FUSAI for a loan to invest in galvanized metal sheeting to replace the roof on the outdoor walkway of her house and in this way improve her family's quality of life a little.

loans.use: to invest in galvanized metal sheeting to replace the roof on the outdoor walkway of her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in galvanized metal sheeting, wood, nails and wire to replace the roof of the outdoor room in her house.

loans.name: Kamae Gathirikari Self Help Group

texts.en:
The person raising his hand in the photo is Samuel, who is 21 years old. He joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2013 and has benefited from receiving training on enterprise and financial management.
Samuel is a farmer who grows vegetables such as cabbage, kale and carrots. He is applying for a loan to buy manure and pesticides that will help boost his farming. He hopes that his income will increase and thus he will be in a position to pay for his driving school fees. 
Samuel is thankful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: To buy manure and pesticides

loans.name: Mujeres De Chui Nahualate Group

texts.en:
The nine women in this group live in the Chui Nahulate neighborhood of the town of Guineales in the Department of Suchitepéquez, Guatemala. This is a traditional agricultural area where most of the men work in the cultivation of bananas and coffee and many of the women work in traditional weaving. Six of the women in this group sell traditional clothing, two have small stores and one has a bakery. They all want to make their businesses more profitable and successful. They have learned from others that when they work with Namaste they will have classes in financial literacy and a personal business adviser who will help them write a business plan and each month give them advice on ways to improve their business.

Manuela is 36 years old.  She has a sixth grade education, is married and has two sons. The older is seven years old and is in first grade. The second is a baby of seven months.  Her husband works in agriculture and does his best to help support the family. For two years she has had a business selling traditional clothing. This has been a big help to the family economically. She has so far done well with her business and she wants to grow it to both provide better for her family and also to offer more selection and variety to her clients.

She currently has a monthly profit of 3,835 Guatemalan Quetzales and she projects growing this to 5,880 Quetzales during this nine-month loan cycle with Namaste.

loans.use: to buy more traditional clothing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fertilizer and potato seeds

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in: floor tiles and cement and sand to install the floor tiles in his home

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for school costs for his children

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in galvanized sheet metal, roofing supports, and fasteners to repair the roof at the front of her home.

loans.name: Matilde

texts.es: Matilde de 61 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su esposa y sus hijos de 14 y 18 años de edad. Él es un hombre trabajador que se esfuerza cada día para llevar el sustento a su hogar, por lo que durante la semana se gana la vida en la agricultura y fontanería y los fines de semana recorre los cantones cercanos para ofrecer los tamales de gallina que prepara su esposa para poder llevar un ingreso extra a su hogar. Matilde desea ampliar su vivienda por lo que desea construir otro corredor con paredes y techo y es para ello que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo, hierro, lámina y madera para ampliar su vivienda construyendo otro corredor sabiendo que podrá cancelar las cuotas que el crédito implica con las ganancias de su trabajo.
texts.en:
Matilde is 61 years old and he lives with his wife and 2 children, ages 14 and 18, in their own home. He is a hardworking man who puts forth an effort everyday to provide for his household. During the week, he makes a living in agriculture and does plumbing work. On the weekends, he goes throughout nearby districts selling chicken tamales that his wife prepares to earn extra income for the household.

Matilde would like to expand his home by building another corridor with walls and a roof. This is the reason he is requesting a loan with FUSAI, and he will invest in cement, sand, gravel, bricks, iron, galvanized sheet metal, and lumber to build this addition to his home. He knows that he will be able to make the loan payments with his earnings from work.

loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, gravel, bricks, iron, laminated sheet metal, and lumber to expand his home by building another corridor.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To construct a green house and start horticulture farming

loans.name: Aloysius Anyan

texts.en:
He is married with seven children living in a five room house in Bamenda, North West Region of Cameroon. He has had had a lot of problems amongst which are the fire accident that destroyed all his 200 chicks, and a ghastly motor accident that occurred and destroyed his business bus.

With the new business he is starting, he knows it will succeed because of his extensive experience. It will help the community in providing raw food items to the entire neighborhood and also provide manure at relatively lower prices.

With the profit from this business, he will pay for his children’s school fees; use some for the family well being and health care. He rather prefers to take his loan from Ghape because the interest is low; the duration of repayment is really convenient not withstanding the non-financial services offered which include loan management and social networking.

loans.use: To buy items like coco, yam, beans, maize, Irish potatoes, and plantain, seedlings and fertilizers and also to buy piglets and chicks for the purpose of rearing them.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Hello world, meet a visionary and practical and seasoned farmer named Moses! Moses is a 40-year-old farmer based in Mwirua location found in Central province of Kenya. He has a wife called Teresia and 2 boys and 1 girl aged between 6 and 15 years old. Family is everything to a man such as Moses. He takes utmost pride in being the head of his family and the chairman of Mwereri Horticultural Self-Help Group.

The group consists of smallholder farmers from his village who are struggling to grow their rural enterprises with lack of access to financial services offered by financial institutions. The aim of the group is to empower each member to grow financially. They achieve this through running their own table banking, and seeking financial services from organizations that accept group-savings as collateral. One such organization is Juhudi Kilimo. 

Moses is seeking a loan to purchase a water pump that will enable him to irrigate his land and grow more tomatoes. This investment is a life-changer to Moses since he will no longer suffer crop failure due to drought. If anything, this asset will change his fortune since he can grow as much tomatoes as he wants and guarantee that they will be well watered regardless of the unpredictable weather. 

Money that will pour in in future from this investment will enable him to uplift the living standards of his family and take his children to schools with better learning facilities.

loans.use: to purchase a water pump to grow his crops.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in galvanized sheet metal, lumber, and nails to change the roof in the corridor of his home.

loans.name: Bihini Mahila Mandal Group

texts.en:
Zetunben, 53, is a resident of Wadhwan, Surendranagar in the Indian state of Gujarat. She is pictured third from left in the photograph. She runs a retail cloth-selling business that caters to the demand of the residents in her locality. The cloth is obtained from a wholesaler and when Zetunben sells the cloth at the retail price she makes a small profit that translates into her savings. Saris, dresses, drapes, pillow covers and other home textiles complete the range of items she offers for sale. In a typical month, her profit margin is roughly Rs. 3500 (~$58), give or take a few hundreds. 

Neither the pressures of life nor time have managed to slow her down. However, credit on reasonable terms is a constant impediment that prevents her from growing her small business. She is now in search of a loan that will help her purchase larger quantities of cloth and offer a greater variety to her customers. She anticipates that her income will see a quantum jump to Rs. 5500. In the absence of social security, this is her best path to maintaining a life of dignity and independence.

Merjaben, who joins the other women in this group, runs a retail cloth-selling microenterprise like Zetuben. Saparaben, a mother of two, runs a vegetable vending business and Rasidaben is the proprietor of a small-scale fruit-vending  business. Your support will help them bring marked improvements to their lives, the lives of their families, and their local community.

loans.use: To increase the stock of cloth, dresses, saris, and home textiles in her cloth retail microenterprise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in pipes, faucets, cement, sand, gravel, bricks, and iron to set up a potable water system and build a wall in his kitchen.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy galvanized metal sheeting, wood, nails, cement, and sand to change the roof and repair a wall at his house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fruit, sugar, flavorings, and ice.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in: a flushable toilet, cement, sand, gravel, brick and iron to build a bathroom with a flushable toilet in her house

loans.name: Wilber

texts.en:
Wilber is 37 years old and is a married man with four children who all go to school. He is a farmer who grows tea and is from Nyakabingo, Buhweju District. Wilber’s plantations are located at the above-mentioned address and he works in his shamba six days a week and eight hours a day. He also operates a grocery shop and has a small hotel in Nyakabingo that is run by his wife. Wilber started farming in 2009 and it has been very profitable. He started farming after buying a plot of land with his small savings and immediately starting planting tea. Most of Wilber’s clients are tea factories and tea traders. His major business challenges are drought, such as the dry season where outputs do not match demand, and price fluctuations.

Wilber is requesting a 5,000,000 UGX loan to buy fertilizer for his tea garden and to improve his trade in green tea leaves. In the future, he hopes to educate all of his children and become financially stable.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is a 56-year-old married woman with nine children, two of whom are still in school. She is from Dulag, Leyte. Aida raises and sells hogs and poultry and her husband is a laborer. 

Aida is requesting a loan to purchase additional pigs and chicken and additional pig feed. Her loan will help improve her hog raising business and help her to raise healthy pigs. Aida’s income will improve and she will start to balance her finances. In the future, she dreams of expanding her business to make it productive and profitable.

loans.use: to purchase pigs, chicken and pig feed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in pants, blouses, skirts, shirts, t-shirts, dresses, etc.

loans.name: Baroat

texts.en:
Baroat was born in 1960. She is widowed and has three children. 

Baroat has been sewing for more than 30 years. Baroat mainly sews national mattresses and sells them to her clients. She has been busy with this activity for more than 30 years and she has great experience. Baroat’s daughter helps her in sewing. They sew different kind of national mattresses. 

Now, Baroat plans to buy cotton, fabrics, threads and so on for making more mattresses to sell. She is asking for a loan of 2,000 Somoni (TJS) with this aim. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy cotton, fabrics, threads, and so on for making more matresses to sell

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is a married woman and a mother of two children. She is from Ormoc, Leyte. 

Aida runs a small sari-sari or retail store business selling various goods and items to the people in her neighborhood. She has been in this business for more than two years now. She is asking for a loan to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, condiments, snack foods and candies, among other things. A loan will help her to improve her stock and thus attract more buyers to her store. 

In the future, Aida hopes to make her business a success.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, condiments, snack foods and candies, among other things

loans.name: Belinda

texts.en:
Belinda is a 40-year-old married with three children ages 10, 15, and 18. She lives in Dulag, Leyte. Belinda operates a motorcycle transport services and also runs a sari-sari (variety) store, where she sells various items such as cooking oil, noodles, biscuits, canned goods, soap, and seasonings. 

Belinda is requesting a loan to buy two pigs as well as additional supplies for her store. These materials will be very helpful to augment her income. Belinda will raise more pigs in the months to come. With her loan, she will recover and start to manage her finances. In the future, Belinda would like to expand her source of income to become more sustainable. She will continue to support of her growing children.

loans.use: to buy two pigs and additional supplies for her store

loans.name: Crozaldy

texts.en:
Crozaldy is a married man with two children aged 19 and 17 years old. He raises and sells hogs. He and his family live in Dulag, Leyte. 

He has requested a loan to buy piglets, pig feed and materials for pig pen renovation. These things are essential for raising hogs. He will now be able to build a better shelter for the pigs, and can then sell healthy pigs in a few months to come. With this, his income will improve and he can start to handle his finances.

Crozaldy hopes that he will be able to successfully manage his source of income for the welfare of his family.

loans.use: to buy piglets, pig feed, and materials for pig pen renovation

loans.name: Jennette

texts.en:
She is married and is a mother of seven children. They live in a two-room house in Bamenda, North West Region. The death of her elder brother and mother was a great loss to her, and she has been a victim of theft. In spite of this, she is still hopeful that business will improve.

She intends to use the loan for the purchase of toilet tissue, rubbing oil, cooking oil, biscuits, papers, rice, beans, groundnuts, garri, pens, books and milk. The community will benefit from this activity in that all petty trading can be done in the local area to reduce cost and they can also buy at any time of the day.

With the profit from the loan, she will be able to pay the children's school fees, take good care of family needs and the children. She rather prefers a loan from GHAPE because the interest rate is moderate, she pays back in installments and the duration of the repayment of the loan too is encouraging.

loans.use: To purchase toilet tissue, rubbing oil, cooking oil, biscuits, papers, rice, beans, groundnuts, garri, pens, books and milk.

loans.name: Javhar

texts.en:
Javhar is 53 years old and has a daughter and a son. She is a native of Tursunzade town. Javhar's son is married and he is now on earnings from the Russian Federation. She is a farmer with a one-hectare plot of land in her village where she sows vegetables and grains. Javhar has been doing this for seven years and her daughter and daughter-in-law help her with the work. 

Javhar is requesting a loan to buy wheat and potato seeds as well as mineral fertilizer to start sowing. She is preparing the ground for a new crop. Javhar's loan will help her continue farming and preserve the main source of her family’s income.

loans.use: to purchase wheat and potato seeds as well as mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Richard Bong

texts.en:
He is married and has five children. They live in a five-room-house in Bamenda, North West Region of Cameroon. He hates thinking how he lost his job, and also when his sponsor died. He is very confident that the business will be successful because he has a good grasp and perfect knowledge about his poultry techniques. For the past years it has been profitable.

The loan from GHAPE will be used to purchase chicks, piglets, feed for fowls and rebuild the pig sty.

The community will benefit by buying manure to improve fertilization. He will offer seasonal employment to the neighbors, and sell chickens at relatively moderate prices. With the profit from the farming, he will be able to expand his farm, educate his children in school, look after his health situation, and also cater for the needs of the family. 

He prefers a loan from GHAPE because it has low interest rates and a new loan can be given as soon as you finish the old one, coupled with the fact that GHAPE offers non-financial services including trainings, social networking and mainly because they do not ask for collateral before loan disbursement.

loans.use: To buy chicks, piglets, feed for fowls and rebuild the pig sty.

loans.name: Nozimakhon

texts.en:
Nozimakhon is 26 years old. She lives with her husband and his parents in Tursunzoda town. Nozimakhon is hardworking woman. She is a farmer who practices livestock husbandry. Her husband works in Russia. Nozimakhon started farming six years ago and works every day from early morning until late evening on her own land. She has great experience but she currently lacks money.

Nozimakhon is requesting a loan from Humo to expand her work. She will buy mineral fertilizers and domestic animals. She has many perfect plans for the future and will try to realize them. Nozimakhon really needs your support.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizer and domestic animals

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in pineapples, papaya, watermelon, mangoes, jocotes (local fruit).

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is a native from Dulag, Leyte. She is 46-year-old woman with two kids aged seven and eight respectively.

Edna runs a sari-sari (variety) store, selling various items such as bottled mineral water, soft drinks, bread, chips, biscuits and condiments. Her husband is a pedicab driver.

Edna is asking for a loan to purchase goods for her store such as soft drinks, biscuits, bottled water and bread. With this additional stock, she could attract more consumers to purchase from her shop. In the long run, she will become sustainable and start to balance her finances. She could now prepare nutritious diets for the whole family, and she could now continue sending her children to school.

In the future, Edna is hoping that she will be handling her sources of income properly to become sustainable and productive.

loans.use: to purchase goods for her store such as soft drinks, biscuits, bottled water and bread

loans.name: Marietta

texts.en:
Marietta is a 32-year-old woman with four young dependents. She lives in Dulag, Leyte.  For the past two years, Marietta has been raising hogs. She also has a ready-to-wear business where she sells items such as pants, shorts, whole dress and many other types of clothing.

Marietta is requesting a loan to purchase three pigs and buy more clothing for her ready-to-wear business. She will use her loan to raise and sell more pigs and expand her clothing business.  Marietta’s loan will result in higher earning and give her the ability to settle her obligations. In the future, she hopes that she will be able to properly handle both of her sources of income and improve her livelihood.

loans.use: to purchase three pigs and buy more clothing for her business

loans.name: Khayriniso

texts.en:
Khayriniso was born in 1972. She is married and has four children. Khayriniso lives with her children in Tajikistan. 

Khayriniso has been busy with sewing for more than 16 years. Khayriniso sews a variety of women's clothes, and she offers her service from her house. 

Khayriniso needs financial support because her child is ill and she must buy medicines for her child’s treatment. She is asking for a loan of 1,500 Somoni (TJS) to buy medicines. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy medicines for  her child’s treatment

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in: pork rind, cheese, beans, tomatoes, green pepper, onion, cabbage, condiments, corn, chicken, meat, rice, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy pork crackling, cheese, beans, cabbage, tomato, green chile, onion, etc.

loans.name: Bahodur

texts.en:
Bahodur is a beginner entrepreneur who will be 43 years old this year. He is a family man and father of four children with whom he lives in the small town of Vahdat. 

Currently Bahodur is building his new business, and he plans to start a family trading activity. Bahodur has already rented the point of sale in the market of the city, and along with his wife, he is going to sell fabrics and materials,.  

Bahodur's initial capital is not enough for buying goods, so he is asking for a loan. With this loan Bahodur and his wife will have work, and the family will be provided with a source of income. They hope that you will support them now financially to give them this opportunity.

loans.use: To purchase fabrics and materials to start family trading activity

loans.name: Nazira

texts.en:
Nazira is an entrepreneur who is married and has two children. She has been busy with animal husbandry for more than three years. Little by little, with the passing of time, Nazira has perfected her knowledge. Thanks to the good conditions of her animals, she has managed to win a large quantity of customers. Nazira sells her animals in the local market and many of her customers are local butchers who are glad for her work. 

Nazira is requesting a loan to buy cattle to increase her working capital. In this way, she will be able to offer her customers good animals and continue to make financial progress and provide her household with good earnings. Nazira awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Mehdi

texts.en:
Mehdi is a 53-year-old gardener. He is married and his wife is a housekeeper, and they have 2 beautiful daughters. 

Mehdi is a pensioner but the main income for the family comes from gardening. He grows seasonal fruits such as apples, pears, and pomegranates, and also some greens. 

Mehdi likes gardening very much. He loves his fruit trees and takes care of them every day. He earns money for the family by selling his harvest to his neighbours. However, for the last year he hasn't been able to sell any harvest because the irrigation system in his garden broke down, and he needs to repair it. 

He has therefore applied for 800 AZN in order to buy tools to repair his irrigation system so he can continue to grow his fruits and greens.

loans.use: to buy tools to repair an irrigation system

loans.name: Thược

texts.en:
Mrs. Thược works in agriculture farming food.

Thược is 53 years old and she is married with three children. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, a urban area in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Thược's  first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Thược has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.
The main hardship that Thược faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet.

With her business profit, Thược hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and to remodel her house.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es: Miguel tiene 64 años de edad y se gana la vida por medio de la realización de viajes dentro de su localidad. Miguel es un hombre trabajador y responsable, muchas personas dan buenas referencias de su integridad. Miguel desea reparar las condiciones del techo de su vivienda por lo que solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de lámina duralita, polines, pines y para pagar la mano de obra para la colocación del techo lo antes posible.
texts.en: Miguel is 64 years old and earns his living by making trips throughout his area. Miguel is a responsible and hard-working man, many people offer good references as to his integrity. Miguel wants to repair the condition of the roof of his house so he is requesting this loan from FUSAI. He will invest in buying Duralita laminate, beams, anchor pins and to pay for labor to install the roof as soon as possible.

loans.use: to buy Duralita laminate. beams. anchor pins and to pay for labor to install the roof.

loans.name: Nyota Group

texts.fr: Madame NSIMIRE, âgée de 51 ans, mariée et mère de 3 enfants tous écoliers, est cliente du groupe NYOTA où elle assume les responsabilités de présidente. Elle est vendeuse des pains, sucres, lait et beignets au marché depuis 1990 grâce au fonds de roulement obtenu de son mari. Elle vient de sollicter un pret qui lui permettra d’acquérir 2 sacs de sucre, 2 sacs de farines de froment et 2 bidons de lait. Le fruit de cette activité sera utilisé dans la construction de la maison, le payement des frais scolaires des enfants et dans l’épargne. Au final, elle remercie HEKIMA de tout coeur.
texts.en:
Mrs. Nsimire is 51 years old, married, and the mother of three children who all go to school. She is a member to group Nyota, for which she has taken on the responsibilities of president.

She has sold bread, milk, and fried dough at the market since 1990, thanks to a starting capital she received from her husband. She is requesting a loan that will allow her to purchase two bags of sugar, two bags of wheat flour, and two cans of milk.

Proceeds from this project will be used to help build their house, pay for the children’s schooling fees, and save. To conclude, she thanks Hekima with all her heart.

loans.use: to purchase two bags of sugar, two bags of wheat flour, and two cans of milk

loans.name: Amani Group

texts.fr: La cliente MUTALEGWA, vendeuse de friperie au marché depuis 1980 grâce au soutien de son mari est âgée de 59 ans, mère de 12 enfants tous écoliers et membre du groupe AMANI où elle est présidente. Elle vient de solliciter un pret qui lui permettra de se procurer 2 ballons de friperie afin que le benefice de son activité l'aide à améliorer sa maison et à payer les frais scolaires de ses enfants. Elle remercie HEKIMA pour avoir favorisé l’accès facile des femmes aux crédits.
texts.en:
Customer MUTALENGWA has sold second-hand clothing at the market since 1980 thanks to her husband’s support. She is 59 years old and the mother of twelve children who all go to school. She is the president of her group, Amani.

She just requested a loan that will allow her to procure two bundles of second-hand clothing. Profits from her operation will help her improve her house and pay her children’s school expenses. She thanks Hekima for supporting women’s access to credit.

loans.use: to procure two bundles of second-hand clothes.

loans.name: Tayambuka Group

texts.en:
Sarah is a strong and hardworking member of Tayambuka Group (Meaning, ‘We have crossed the line of poverty’). She is married with two school-going children and her husband is a self-employed electrician. Her core business is knitting and selling jerseys and has been in the business since 2011. Apart from knitting jerseys she is a cross boarder trader and also sells dishwashing liquid, floor polish and liquid soap that she produces herself.

Tayambuka group is taking their fifth loan from Thrive Microfinance. They started taking loans from Thrive since 2012 and have been making their repayments right on time. The group members know each other from their savings club as well as from church.

Sarah got a tender to supply Glenview High School with jerseys, the group needs a loan amounting to $5400, and Sarah will use her portion of the loan to purchase knitting yarns and soap-making ingredients. The group is grateful to all those who will help their dreams to come into fulfillment.

loans.use: to buy more yarn to knit jumpers for school children.

loans.name: Siyabonga Group

texts.en:
Siyabonga Group has four ladies who are hardworking and highly ambitious. Siyabonga is a Ndebele name which means thank you. The group was formed from the realization that the members needed to work together if they were to improve their businesses. All members in this group are cross boarder traders and they travel together for restocking and selling.

Egina is one of the four women. She is 34 years old. She stays in Rugare with her husband who is a self-employed welder.  She is a mother of four and all her children are of school going age.

Egina sells bedcovers, sheets and seat covers in South Africa every month. She then comes back with clothing which she sells in Zimbabwe. The training she received from Thrive helped her to improve on planning and record keeping which she could not do thoroughly before.

With the loan from Kiva, she hopes to increase the quantity of stock that she sells in South Africa and also the stock that she brings back to sell in Zimbabwe. This will see her sales improving as well as her profits.  Egina plans to buy her own residential stand since she is currently living in her in-laws’ house.

loans.use: To export bed-covers and sheets to South Africa & import clothes to sell at home.

loans.name: Jose Atiliano

texts.es: José de 69 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su hija de 26 años de edad que es su mayor orgullo ya que la ha sacado adelante a base de mucho esfuerzo. Él es un hombre emprendedor que se gana la vida vendiendo herramientas de trabajo para el campo como son: machetes, cumas, rastrillos, etc. Pero además buscando tener mejores ingresos y aprovechando la clientela afila estas herramientas para tener mejores ingresos económicos. José desea construir un baño en su vivienda ya que actualmente no cuenta con uno, además desea construir un corredor en la misma y para ello solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lámina galvanizada, madera, clavos, cemento, arena, grava y ladrillo para construir un baño y un corredor en su vivienda lo antes posible aprovechando la época seca para no tener inconvenientes por las lluvias.
texts.en:
José is 69 years old and lives in his own house with his 26 year old daughter who is his greatest pride and whom he raised through great effort. He is an enterprising man who earns his living selling agricultural work tools such as machetes, cumas (curved knives), rakes, etc. But looking for better his economic income he takes advantage of his clientele by sharpening these instruments to make added income.

José wants to construct a bathroom at his house which currently does not have one. He also wants to build a veranda on his house so he is requesting a loan from FUSAI. He will invest in galvanized laminate, wood, nails, cement, sand gravel and bricks to build a bathroom and a veranda as soon as possible taking advantage of the dry season so as not to be inconvenienced by the rains.

loans.use: to invest in galvanized laminate, wood, nails, cement, sand, gravel and bricks to construct a bathroom and a veranda on his house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy taro roots, banana tubers, a wheelbarrow, rake, shovel, water tank, hand gloves, and a pick-up (car).

loans.name: Kumriniso

texts.en:
Kumriniso was born in 1978. She is married and she is a careful mother of four children. She is a very enterprising woman. 

For more than ten years, Kumriniso has been busy with knitting. Her daughter helps her. Her honesty, responsibility and punctuality have been the reasons for her job promotion, and she believes she is doing well because she always gives the best of herself. 

Kumriniso is very grateful to Kiva lenders because with their support, she will be able to make improvements to her house, such as painting the walls and ceiling. In this way, she and her family will have a better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy paint to repair her house

loans.name: Gấm

texts.en:
Mrs Gấm has a service business machine for rent. Gấm has been involved in this business for 5 years. Gấm is 30 years old and she is married with 1 child. Gấm lives  in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Gấm first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. The main hardship that Gấm faces in her life is not having a hygenic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.

With her business profit, Gấm hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.

loans.name: Etoile Group

texts.fr: Mabiro est commerçante, femme d’affaires, membre du groupe de crédits «Etoile», client de l’IMF Hekima, mariée a un enseignant, âgée de 38 ans, mere de 8 enfants et qui tous scolarisés. Elle commença son business avec de fonds de reçu de son mari. Elle est vendeuse de divers produits pharmaceutiques dans une pharmacie de la ville depuis 7 ans. Elle va acheter des antibiotiques, pommades de massage, seringues, sérum etc. Elle souhaite accroitre et devenir grossiste. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en:
Mabiro is a retailer and a member of lending group “Star,” a client of IMF Hekima. She is married to a 38-year-old teacher and a mother of eight; all her children go to school.

She started her business with capital received from her husband. She has sold various pharmaceutical products in one of the city’s pharmacy for seven years. She is going to buy antibiotics, massage creams, syringes, serums, etc. She wants to grow her business and become a wholesaler.

In conclusion, she thanks Hekima for its support of entrepreneurs excluded from traditional banking.

loans.use: to buy antibiotics, massage creams, syringes, serums, etc.

loans.name: Alona

texts.en:
Alona is a 50-year-old woman from Ormoc, Leyte. She earns a living through her hog raising business. 

Alona is asking for a loan to buy more piglets to raise, and animal feed. This loan will help her to improve the productivity of her hog raising business as well as her profit. 

In the future, Alona hopes to make her business a success.

loans.use: to buy more piglets to raise, and animal feed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy rolling materials, paint color, paint brushes, elei design, containers, and a printing machine.

loans.name: Thắng

texts.en:
Mrs Thắng works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle. Thắng has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. Thắng is 42 years old and she is married with 3 children. Thắng lives in Quang Xuong district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2014, Thắng joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Thắng has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

The main hardship that Thắng faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.

With her business profit, Thắng hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her children to find good jobs, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.

loans.name: Hằng

texts.en:
Mrs Hằng works in agriculture, farming food. Hằng has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. Hằng is 46 years old and she is married with 2 children. She lives and works in Quang Xuong district, a  rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2014, Hằng joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Hằng has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.

In the future, Hằng hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her children to find good jobs, and to remodel her house.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.

loans.name: Nhóm 03 - Tây Sơn 2 - Phú Sơn 3 Group

texts.en:
Mrs Ngân has a retail business selling mobile phones and phone cards. Ngân has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, a urban area in Thanh Hoa province. She is requesting a loan to purchase more mobile phones and phone cards to resell.

Ngân is 50 years old and she is married with 3 children. Ngân is the group leader of the Nhóm 03 - Tây Sơn 2 - Phú Sơn 3 solidarity group, which consists of 5 members. In 2013, Ngân joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Ngân has successfully repaid 3 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

The main hardship that Ngân faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Ngân hopes for her children to find good jobs, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase more mobile phones and phone cards to resell.

loans.name: Tusaidiane Group

texts.fr: Basekawike est commerçante et présidente de la banque communautaire Tusaidiane, cliente de l’IMF Hekima, mariée, âgée de 42 ans, mère de 6 enfants tous scolarisés. Elle commença son business avec de fonds de reçu de son mari. Elle est vendeuse des huiles de palmes et végétales depuis 20 ans. Elle va acheter des jutes d’huiles de palmes et 20 litres végétales. Son conjoint est un enseignant. Elle souhaite obtenir plus des crédits pour accroitre son chiffre d’affaires, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en:
Basekawike is a retailer and the president of community bank Tusaidiane, a client of IMF Hekima. She is married, 42 years old, and has six children, who all go to school.

She started her business with capital provided by her husband. She has sold palm and vegetable oils for twenty years. She will purchase containers of palm oil and twenty liters of vegetable oil. Her spouse is a teacher.

She wants to obtain further loans to increase her sales, feed her children, and send them to school. In conclusion, she thanks Hekima for its support to entrepreneurs excluded from traditional banking.

loans.use: to buy containers of palm oil and twenty liters of vegetable oil.

loans.name: Luận

texts.en:
Mrs Luận works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle. Luận has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. Luận is 45 years old and she is married with 3 children. She lives and works in Quang Xuong district, a  rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2014, Luận joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Luận has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

The main hardship that Luận faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.

With her business profit, Luận hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her children to find good jobs, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.

loans.name: Theophile

texts.en:
Theophile is 34 years old. He is married with 2 children aged 3 and 7 years; one of them goes to school. 

He has a shop and has been in a business for 2 years. With the loan, he would like to buy cooking oil and rice to resell. The profits from the business will be used to improve the family's welfare and pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: To buy cooking oil and rice to resell.

loans.name: Polenisia

texts.en:
Polenisia is a 48-year-old mother with four children. She runs and operates a small convenience store in her village to earn a living.

Polenisia has requested a loan to buy a freezer, twist ties, chicken, a sack of flour, sack of sugar, sack of rice, tinned fish, a box of vegetable oil, box of milk, sausage, and plastic bags to assist her in running the business.

She has been doing this for more than four years. Polenisia became a member of SPBD in 2008.

loans.use: to buy a freezer, twist ties, chicken, a sack of flour, sack of sugar, sack of rice, tinned fish, a box of vegetable oil, box of milk, sausage, and plastic bags.

loans.name: Siline

texts.en:
Siline is a 40-year-old mother with six children. She runs and operates a small business of a plantation in her village to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than four years.

Siline has requested a loan to buy taro roots, banana tubers, a water tank, shovel, rake, wheelbarrow, safety boots, hand gloves, chemicals, and a pick-up to assist her in running the business. She will use the business profit to expand her business in the near future and provide for her family’s needs.

Siline became a member of SPBD in 2010.

loans.use: to buy taro roots, banana tubers, a water tank, shovel, rake, wheelbarrow, safety boots, hand gloves, chemicals, and a pick-up.

loans.name: Cindy Marisela

texts.es: Cindy tiene 27 años de edad y habita junto a su compañero de vida y grupo familiar en casa propia. Cindy se dedica a la prestación de servicios domésticos desde hace mucho tiempo y es así como apoya con la economía del hogar. Con el deseo de mejorar sus condiciones de vida solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la construcción de un baño y fosa séptica para lo cual necesita comprar materiales como: cemento, arena, ladrillo, hierro, etc. Espera poder contar con este financiamiento y de esta forma dar inicio a la mejora lo  antes posible.
texts.en: Cindy is 27 years and lives with her life companion and family in her own house. Cindy has worked providing domestic services for a long time and this is how she helps with the household economy. With the desire to improve her living conditions she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in constructing a bathroom and a septic tank. She needs to buy material to do this like cement, sand, bricks, re-bar, etc. She hopes to be able to count on this loan and in this way begin as soon as possible.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel, re-bar etc, to build a bathroom and a septic tank.

loans.name: 020306240003 Đại Long - Hoằng Thanh Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Duyên is 46 years old and she is married with three children. Duyên lives in Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. She is the leader of a seven member group, the 020306240003 Đại Long - Hoằng Thanh solidarity group. 

Duyên has a retail business selling cakes, sweets, sugar, and milk. Duyên has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. 

In 2013, Duyên joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Duyên has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Duyên is requesting a loan to purchase more cakes, sweets, sugar, and milk to resell. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

In the future, Duyên hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to find good jobs.

loans.use: to purchase more cakes, sweets, sugar, and milk to resell

loans.name: Amani Kwetu Group

texts.fr: La cliente Odile est commerçante, membre de la banque communautaire Amani kwetu, cliente de l’IMF Hekima, mariée, âgée de 48 ans, mère de 10 enfants  dont 5 scolarisés et 5 autres n’étudient pas. Elle commença son business avec de fonds de reçu d’une coopérative de la place. Elle est vendeuse des huiles de palmes et tomates depuis 10 ans. Elle va acheter 40 litres d’huiles de palmes et 2 paniers de tomates. Son conjoint est un chômeur. Elle souhaite obtenir plus des crédits pour accroitre son chiffre d’affaires, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables. Il sied de signaler qu'une cliente porte son bébé.
texts.en:
Customer Odile is a retailer and a member of community bank Amani kwetu, a client of IMF Hekima. She is married, 48 years old, and a mother of ten children, five of whom are currently in school while five do not study.

She launched her business with capital obtained from a local cooperative. She has sold palm oil and tomatoes for ten years. She will purchase forty liters of palm oil and two baskets of tomatoes. Her spouse is unemployed.

She wants to obtain further loans to increase her sales, send her children to school, and feed them. In conclusion, she thanks Hekima for its support to entrepreneurs excluded from traditional banking. It’s worth mentioning that another client is carrying her baby in the picture.

loans.use: to buy forty liters of palm oil and two baskets of tomatoes.

loans.name: Frorence

texts.en:
Frorence is 33 years old. She is married with 4 children aged between 6 and 12 years; all of them go to school.  

She has a shop and has been in business for 2 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more rice, soap and biscuits to resell. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy more rice, soap and biscuits to resell.

loans.name: Clarisse

texts.en:
Clarisse is 24 years old. She is married with 2 children aged between 1 and 5 years; one of them goes to school.  

She sells clothes and has been in business for 7 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more shirts and skirts to resell. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest and renovate her house.

loans.use: To buy more shirts and skirts to resell.

loans.name: Dative

texts.en:
Dative is 32 years old. She is married with 5 children aged between 1 and 11 years; two of them go to school.  

She has a shop and has been in business for 5 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more millet,salt and cooking oil to resell. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy more millet, salt and cooking oil to resell.

loans.name: Lucie

texts.en:
Lucie is 52 years old. She is married with 5 children aged between 8 and 17 years, all of them go to school.  

She has a shop and has been in business for 8 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more rice, biscuits and salt to resell. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy more rice, biscuits and salt to resell.

loans.name: Vestine

texts.en: Vestine is 33 years old. She is married with three children aged between one and nine years, and one child is in school. She sells clothes and has been in this business for two years. With this loan, she would like to buy more t-shirts, shorts and shirts to resell. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy more t-shirts, shorts and shirts to resell.

loans.name: Gaudence

texts.en: Gaudence is 29 years old. She is married with two children aged between one and four years, who do not yet go to school.  She has a shop and has been in this business for three years. With the loan, she would like to buy more lotion, rice, and maize flour to resell. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy more lotion, rice, and maize flour to resell.

loans.name: Laxmibai Shg Group

texts.en:
Subhasri is in charge of the group Laxmibai Shg. She has a store where she sells assorted women's clothing such as dresses, full pantsuits, skirts, trousers, sweaters, sarees, and blouses; men's shirts and pants; children's clothing for boys and girls, baby clothes, and women’s and children's shoes of different kinds. She also sells gifts for all occasions, such as pots and pans, dishes, watches, lamps, table decorations, picture frames, and toys in general. She has been in business for five years.

She started out as a street vendor, and today she rents a beautiful retail space, although her dream is to one day purchase her own space and not have to pay rent any more. She has her husband's unconditional support and the love of her two sweet children, so she is grateful for everything she has.

Schools are approaching for dresses, and she has several orders of linen in different sizes, colors, and brands. She doesn't have enough money to cover them, so she needs a loan in order to purchase the pants she needs by the dozen. She doesn't want to let her customers down because a lot of people trust in her, and some depend on buying from her to make their living reselling the items.

loans.use: to buy new clothing items.

loans.name: Maria Santos

texts.es: María de 53 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a sus 2 hijos de 15 y 22 años de edad a los que ha logrado sacar adelante ella sola luego de perder a su esposa. Ella es una mujer emprendedora que siempre ha buscado lo mejor para sus hijos por lo que desde hace 20 años instalo una pequeña tienda de productos básicos actividad que le ha permitido salir adelante. María luego de atender su negocio se siente cansada y lo que más desea es tener un lugar agradable donde descansar, es por ello que ha decidido construir un cuarto dormitorio y para ello solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo y hierro para construir un cuarto dormitorio donde poder descansar después de tantas horas de trabajo.
texts.en:
María, aged 53, lives in her own home together with her two children aged 15 and 22, both of whom she has managed to provide for all alone after losing her partner.

She is an enterprising woman who has always wanted the best for her children, which is why she set up a small store twenty years ago, selling basic staple goods, which has allowed her to get ahead.

María gets tired after looking after her business, and what she would like most of all is to have a nice place where she can rest, so she has decided to build a fourth bedroom. Because of this, she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to buy cement, sand, gravel, brick to build a fourth bedroom where she can rest after working for so many hours.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel, brick to build a fourth bedroom.

loans.name: Marguarite

texts.en: Marguarite is 58 years old. She is married with three children aged between 21 and 26 years, and all of them go to school.  She sells food and has been in this business for 10 years. With this loan, she would like to buy more beans, maize, and sorghum to resell. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy more beans, maize and sorghum to resell.

loans.name: Lợi

texts.en:
Mrs. Lợi operates a food stall/restaurant selling fish. Lợi has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. 

The main hardship that Lợi faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet.

Lợi is 46 years old, and she is married with two children. She lives and works in Hau Loc district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2013, Lợi joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Lợi has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

In the future, Lợi hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet.

loans.name: Jeannette

texts.en: Jeannette is 22 years old. She is married with two children aged between two months and three years, who do not yet go to school. She has a shop and has been in this business for four years. With this loan, she would like to buy more maize flour, rice, and cooking oil to resell. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest and to buy food for home consumption.

loans.use: to buy more maize flour, rice, and cooking oil to resell.

loans.name: Thủy

texts.en:
Mr. Thủy works in agriculture, farming food. Thủy has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

The main hardship that Thủy faces in his life is not having a hygeinic latrine. He is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet.

Thủy is 41 years old, and he is married with three children. Thủy lives in Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Thủy's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

With his business profit, Thủy hopes to maintain a successful business, to make enough money to provide for his kids, and for his children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet.

loans.name: Jean Nepomuscene

texts.en: Jean Nepomuscene is 31 years old. He is married with two children aged between three and six years, and one child goes to school. He has a shop and has been in this business for two years. With this loan, he would like to buy more cooking oil, rice, and books to resell. The profits from the business will be used to buy food for home consumption and to renovate his house.

loans.use: To buy more cooking oil, rice, and books to resell.

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en:
Jacqueline is 33 years old. She is married with four children aged between 4 and 10 years; three of them go to school.

She has a shop and has been doing business for two years. With the loan, she would like to buy more rice, salt, and lotion to resell. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest and buy food for home consumption.

loans.use: to buy more rice, salt, and lotion to resell.

loans.name: Lan

texts.en:
Mrs. Lan works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle. Lan has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

The main hardship that Lan faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet.

Lan is 43 years old, and she is married with three children. Lan Vên lives in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2014, Lan joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Lan has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

With her business profit, Lan hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, to make enough money to provide for her kids, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet.

loans.name: Nhóm 05 Vạn Thắng, Đa Lộc Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Nấm works in agriculture, raising poultry. Nấm has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

Nấm is 63 years old, and she is married with three children.

Nấm is the group leader of the Nhóm 05 Vạn Thắng, Đa Lộc solidarity group, which consists of three members. 

In 2014, Nấm joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Nấm has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

In the future, Nấm hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to maintain a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Nhóm 49 Thắng Phúc, Ngư Lộc Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Minh operates a food stall selling processed seafood. Minh has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase more seafood to process for sale.

Minh is 55 years old, and she is married with four children.

Minh is the group leader of the Nhóm 49 Thắng Phúc, Ngư Lộc solidarity group, which consists of three members. 

In 2009, Minh joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Minh has successfully repaid seven loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

In the future, Minh hopes to build a new house, for her business to do well, and for her children to find good jobs.

loans.use: to purchase more seafood to process for sale

loans.name: Jeanne D Arc

texts.en: Jeanne D'Arc is 32 years old. She is married with 5 children ages between 2 and 12 years, four of them go to school. She has a shop and has been in business for the past 5 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more sugar, soap and salt to resell. The profits from the business will be used to renovate her house.

loans.use: To buy more sugar, soap and salt to resell.

loans.name: Beathe

texts.en: Beathe, 33, is married with 2 children ages between 10 and 11 years, both of them go to school. Beathe has a shop and has been in a business for 15 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more rice and biscuits to resell. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest and buy food for home consumption.

loans.use: to buy more rice and biscuits to resell.

loans.name: Elena Arely

texts.es: Elena de 27 años de edad vive al lado de su tía en vivienda propia desde hace muchos años. Ella es una mujer emprendedora que se esfuerza por salir adelante prestando sus servicios domésticos de forma domiciliar desde hace 10 años. Elena desea construir un muro perimetral ya que actualmente solo cuenta con un tapial de láminas viejas y tela metálica que no le brindan mayor seguridad por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo y hierro para construir un muro perimetral alrededor de su vivienda y con ello brindarle una mayor seguridad a su vivienda.
texts.en:
Elena, aged 27, has lived next door to her aunt for many years in her own home.

She is an enterprising woman who makes an effort to get ahead in life, having been providing her domestic services in people's homes for ten years. 

She wishes to build a perimeter wall as she currently only has a wall made of old sheet metal and wire mesh, which doesn't offer the best security. This is why she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to buy cement, sand, gravel, brick and iron, in order to build a perimeter wall around her home, bringing with it a higher level of security.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel, brick and iron, in order to build a perimeter wall around her home.

loans.name: Laurence

texts.en:
Laurence is aged 43. She is married with five children aged between 8 and 18 years; all of them go to school. She sells clothes and has been in a business for ten years.

With the loan, she would like to buy more clothes to resell. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to resell.

loans.name: Aguka Group

texts.en:
Aguka is a group led by Olive, who is 27 years old. The group name means “Expand” in English.

Olive has been a group leader for two years. She has a shop and has been in business for two years. The group members sell different items, and they have the same idea for changing their lives.

With the loan, she would like to buy more sugar, rice, and maize flour to resell.

The profits from the business will be used to improve their standards of living.

loans.use: to buy more sugar, rice, and maize flour to resell.

loans.name: Twisanzure Group

texts.en:
Antoine is the group leader. She is aged 43. She is married with three children aged between 6 months and 7 years.

The group is called Twisanzure, which means “Flexible” in English. They sell different products, and they wish to expand their businesses for changing their better future.

Antoine is a tailor and has been in a business for 25 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more clothes for tailoring to resell. The profits from the business will be used to expand her business and renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for tailoring to resell.

loans.name: Romel Amel

texts.es: Romel de 37 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañera de vida y su hijo que se encuentra estudiando gracias al apoyo que le brindan. Él es un hombre trabajador que se desempeña como albañil independiente desde hace 10 años lo que le ha permitido salir adelante apoyándose también con su compañera de vida que se gana la vida vendiendo tortillas. Romel desea construir una pila en su vivienda ya que actualmente solo cuenta con unos barriles que ya se encuentran deteriorados y el teme por la salud de su familia por ser estos de hierro, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo y hierro para construir una pila en su vivienda para poder recolectar agua para el uso de su hogar.
texts.en:
Romel is 37 years old. He lives in his own home with his life partner and son, who is studying thanks to the support offered to him. He is a hardworking man who has worked as an independent builder for 10 years, which has enabled him to succeed. Additionally, he relies on his life partner, who makes a living selling tortillas. 

Romel wants to build a water storage tank in his house since currently he only counts on a few barrels that are already damaged. He fears for the health of his family because the barrels are made of iron.

For this reason, he is asking for a loan from FUSAI to invest in cement, sand, gravel, bricks, and iron to build a water storage tank so he can collect water to use in his home.

loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, gravel, bricks, and iron to build a water storage tank.

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es: Miguel tiene 40 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su esposa. Miguel es un hombre muy trabajador quien trabaja como carpintero desde hace mucho tiempo. Miguel solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de arena y cemento dado que desea repellar las paredes de la vivienda. Espera poder contar con dicho financiamiento y de esta forma mejorar sus condiciones de vida y las de su familia.
texts.en:
Miguel is 40 years old and he lives in his own home with his wife. He works very hard and he's been earning a living as a carpenter for a long time.

He is requesting this loan from FUSAI to buy sand and cement to plaster the walls of his home. 

Miguel hopes to get the loan so he can improve his living conditions and that of his family.

loans.use: to buy sand and cement to plaster the walls of his home.

loans.name: Teresa Del Carmen

texts.es: Teresa tiene 48 años de edad y junto a su esposo mantienen la economía del hogar. Con el deseo de salir adelante ella hace todo lo que esté en sus manos para dar a su familia mejores condiciones de vida. Ella posee un comedor onde ofrece variedad de platillos a sus clientes. Teresa es una mujer muy visionaria y ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de los insumos necesarios para seguir ofreciendo sus ricos platillos que tanto prefieren sus clientes. Con el monto solicitado comprará: arroz, frijoles, carnes, aceite, verduras, maíz, frutas, etc.
texts.en: Teresa is 48 years old and, with her husband, they maintain the household economy. With the desire to get ahead, she does everything that is at hand to give her family better living conditions. She has a restaurant where she offers a variety of dishes for her customers. Teresa is a very visionary woman and has decided to ask FUSAI for this loan to invest in the purchase of the supplies needed to continue offering her delicious dishes that her customers so prefer. With the requested amount, she will purchase rice, beans, meat, oil, vegetables, corn, fruit, etc.

loans.use: to purchase rice, beans, meat, oil, vegetables, corn, fruit, etc. for her food sales.

loans.name: Rosario De Jesus

texts.es: Rosario tiene 44 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañero de vida y sus hijos. Rosario trabaja cuidando un rancho cercano a su localidad y es así como lleva el sustento a su hogar. Rosario ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de arena, cemento, piedras, grava y ladrillo, dado que desea construir un muro en su vivienda. Espera poder contar con este financiamiento y de esta forma dar inicio a la construcción lo antes posible.
texts.en: Rosario is 44 years old and lives in her own house with her life partner and their children. Rosario works taking care of a nearby farm in her locality and it in this way that she brings sustenance to her home.
